description: This Chardonnay-based wine, with 10% Chenin Blanc, opens with aromas of pressed yellow flowers, peach blossom and just-ripe tropical fruit. There's good zip to the bright fruit flavors, finishing fresh and clean. Drink now.
title: Domaine Rives-Blanques 2016 White (Pays d'Oc)

description: Wood aromas and spice show strongly in this wine. On the palate, there is a toasty character that gives a bitter edge to the ripe red fruits. That needs to go, so wait to drink this wine from 2019.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine de la Ferté  (Givry)

description: Showcasing the rich vintage, this is a generous fruit-driven wine. With red-berry flavors and plenty of acidity to balance, the wine is soft and juicy. Drink it from 2018.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Le Renard  (Bourgogne)

description: This large appellation in the Côte Chalonnaise can produce fruity wines like this. With red-berry fruits and light tannins, the wine has spice and crisp edge of acidity that comes from fruit that was just ripe, surprising in the rich 2015 vintage. The wine will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Laurent Dufouleur Château Mi-Pont  (Mercurey)

description: This tangy, ripe and fruity wine is crisp with acidity. It's attractively brimming with fruit and ready to drink.
title: Louis Max 2016  Mâcon-Villages

description: Crisp apple perfume builds on the palate, suggesting unusually lifted notes of raspberry, strawberry and cherry in this semidry Riesling. It's a plush, slightly rounded white with easy, juicy fruit and a brisk finish.
title: Highland Cellars 2015 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: The freshness and concentration of the fruit flavors in this full-bodied wine is exceptional. It smells like Concord juice and tastes dark and grapy, forming a simple but appealing personality that's hard to resist.
title: Infidel 2014 Zinfandel (Lodi)

description: Crisp apple aromas lead to a spicy, yellow and melon-flavored wine. With its touches of vanilla and warm, ripe character, the wine is full and generous. Drink now.
title: Domaine Bernard Moreau 2016  Bourgogne

description: A crisp, tangy and mineral-driven wine, this is also ripe with generous citrus and apple flavors. The texture is still tight. which will allow it to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine de l'Echelette 2016 La Belouse  (Mâcon-Cruzille)

description: Oak-driven spice, camphor and coconut aromas lead the nose of this wine. Tight, bracing and lacking fruit richness, it shows instead roasted coffee bean, toasted oak, dried cherry and vanilla notes. Astringent, grainy tannins leave a raspy finish.
title: Sassi San Cristoforo 2012 Riserva  (Barbaresco)

description: It's very difficult to rate this unusual bottling in a blind tasting. It's a nonvintage dry red wine blended from mature years and has few if any peers in California. It's very tasty because of traits that are usually considered flaws. A tawny color and an aroma like tawny Port lead to a very soft texture, and warm plum, raisin and nut flavors. The wine is rather full in body, light on tannins, and tastes quite mature and mellow.
title: Sean Thackrey NV Pleiades XXV Old Vines Red (California)

description: This is a great value for a wine from the celebrated Amador region. Aromas like strawberry jam and brown sugar lead to very ripe and fruity flavors in this full-bodied but lively wine. It's fun to sip and doesn't try for a serious profile or heavy texture.
title: Shenandoah Vineyards 2015 Special Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)

description: A touch of wood aging gives this wine richness, aided by the ripe fruit of the vintage. The wine is full with citrus, crisp apple and ripe pear. With its nervy texture and acidity, it needs to age a bit more. Drink from 2018.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2015 Buissonnier  (Bourgogne)

description: Fresh tangerine, green melon and lime abound in this fruit-forward dry white. This shows light-footed refreshment without a lot of complication. The finish is brisk and pristinely citrusy.
title: Three Brothers 2016 Lonesome Stony Estate Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

description: This wine's sawdust, green herb, vanilla and spice aromas are brooding. The light- to medium-bodied palate delivers cherry flavor, bringing appeal but wanting more expression.
title: Kestrel 2013 Signature Series Raptor Red (Yakima Valley)

description: Citrus and salad-like aromas are more subdued and neutral than punchy. This feels melony and lower than normal on zestiness. Flavors of green fruits and mild herbs finish mellow and slightly bitter.
title: Kingston Family 2016 Cariblanco Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Sweet cedar meets with dried blueberry, baked black currant and toasted pastry on the nose of this bottling. Dried pine needle and forest underbrush flavors show on the sip, spicing up the dried plum and cocoa-spice flavors.
title: Donati 2013 Ezio Cabernet Sauvignon (Paicines)

description: Touches of crushed purple violets add depth and interest to the brambly black berry and raspberry core of this lush wine. Hints of menthol and charred oak dance in the background, with flavors of cherry skin and blackberry taking centerstage on the solidly structured palate.
title: Fortant 2016 Coast Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Pays d'Oc)

description: This appellation blend is nowhere near as amazing as the winery's single-vineyard expressions from this vintage, but it'll work for an everyday sipper. Light red cherry meets with damp herbs, wet hay and forest floor on the nose, while the simple palate combines red fruit with more herbs and orange peels.
title: Foxen 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This leads with mocha, herb and leather aromas. The palate is still tight and closed but offers red berry, clove and sage hints with some air. Clenched tannins grip the close.
title: Francesco Rinaldi 2014  Barbaresco

description: At first shy on the nose, this opens to reveal baking spice and dried violet aromas. A tobacco note underscores its mature black plum and ripe blackberry flavors while smooth tannins offer easygoing support. Drink through 2019.
title: Fratelli Ponte 2015  Barbera d'Asti Superiore

description: This is a crisp, lightly wooded wine. Tangy texture and mineral acidity are part of the lively character of this still young, zesty bottling. Drink from 2018.
title: Clos des Rocs 2016 En Près Forêt  (Mâcon-Loché)

description: Crisp and clean yet very tropical and ripe on the nose, this bottling shows strong guava and mango perfume notes. The palate also rides the guava wave, with touches of bubblegum, coconut and white-flower syrup.
title: Eberle 2016 Mill Road Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

description: Lightly roasted berry and cassis aromas are a touch hot but good. This wine is solid on the palate, with hard-smacking tannins. Flavors of chocolate, spicy berry fruit and a touch of campfire finish more roasted than fruity.
title: Echeverria 2015 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)

description: Heady freesia and tangerine zest perfume this fresh, lemony Grüner Veltliner. The palate highlights bright grapefruit and lemon flavors nuanced with pollen and smoked nuts. A brisk, deftly balanced dry white to enjoy now through 2019.
title: Fulkerson 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Seneca Lake)

description: This dry light-bodied wine smells very fresh—even green—and tastes like tart green apples, white pepper and fresh parsley. It has very crisp acidity and a mouth-puckering texture that will make it a good pairing with raw oysters.
title: Wilderotter 2016 Vermentino (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: This has black-skinned berry, forest floor and toast scents. The easygoing palate delivers tart cherry, vanilla and clove flavors alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2019.
title: Cà Bianca 2014 Antè  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

description: This has delicate but alluring orange blossom, Mediterranean herb and wild berry scents. The bright, savory palate doles out crushed red cherry, raspberry and white pepper hints alongside crisp acidity. It has a clean, fresh finish.
title: Bosco Nestore 2016 Donna Bosco Rosato (Colline Pescaresi)

description: Briny citrus-peel aromas show a pyrazinic green side and a touch of corn tortilla. A somewhat dilute palate is bolstered by a shock of citric acidity, tasting of stone fruits and citrus. On the finish, early nectarine notes are replaced by briny flavors.
title: Castellroig 2014 Terroja de Sabaté i Coca Xarel-lo (Penedès)

description: Heavy oak on the nose means aromas of pencil lead, wet cement and blacktop are in the lead. This wine feels resiny and tannic, with a similar woody flavor accenting herbal black fruit. Although this is a good Cabernet, it's quite oaky.
title: Carmen 2014 Gran Reserva Los Quillayes Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Leafy herbal saucy aromas of plum and currant come with hints of tobacco and café mocha. This blend of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Tempranillo has a Bordeaux-like flavor profile complete with leafy plum and herbal spice notes. On the finish, this holds onto its herbal character.
title: Aljibes 2011 VA Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

description: A crisp combination of mineral notes, citrus aromas and citrus peel lead to a juicy medium-bodied palate. Lime and apple flavors are slightly briny, while this is dry, pithy and true to the Garnacha Blanca variety on the finish.
title: Altavins 2015 Ilercavònia Grenache Blanc (Terra Alta)

description: The aromas are light, with notes of freshly cut apple and spice. It drinks dry with elegantly styled fruit flavors that linger on the finish. It shows a very pretty styling.
title: Analemma 2014 Atavus Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

description: Light strawberry fruit with tart acidity carries a wine of modest proportions. It's drinking well, and might be a good choice for a simple salmon preparation, as it would not overwhelm the fish. The finishing tannins have a definite herbal flavor.
title: Argyle 2014 Nuthouse Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Light spicy, earthy aromas, tart raspberry and cranberry flavors and a firmly tannic texure add up to a well-structured and rather lean-tasting wine. It makes a good accompaniment to food.
title: Monte Volpe 2013 Sangiovese (Mendocino County)

description: This is an up-and-coming variety for the state. High-toned aromas of lime leaf and citrus are followed by a lean, almost faint but still but well-balanced palate with a thread of acidity running through it. Pair it with food to see it at its best.
title: Rôtie Cellars 2015 Grenache Blanc (Washington)

description: The aromas are bright, with notes of lime leaf, apricot, citrus peel, flowers and lime. It drinks off dry, with abundant stone-fruit flavors that provide plenty of pleasure.
title: Nine Hats 2015 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Light bodied and fresh, this has alluring scents of small red berry, aromatic herb and a floral note. The vibrant palate delivers tart red cherry, white pepper and a hint of thyme. Firm acidity and pliant tannins provide the easy-drinking framework
title: Nino Negri 2013 Quadrio  (Valtellina Superiore)

description: This three-acre parcel has produced a beautiful fruity wine. With red cherry and spice flavors, the wine is perfumed and juicy. Crisp acidity shoots through the attractive fruit to give a wine that is only lightly tannic and ready to drink.
title: Pascal Aufranc 2015 En Rémont Vignes de 1939  (Chénas)

description: This perfumed expression of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Merlot shows a great depth of complexity and deliciousness for the price. Firm, grippy tannin stars alongside dark cherry, currant, clove and tobacco, all along a softened layering of texture.
title: Taken Wine Co. 2014 Taken Red (Napa Valley)

description: Cherry, cassis and root beer aromas are appealing. In the mouth, this is wall-to-wall rough due to fierce tannins. Baked berry flavors are blocky and simmer away on a rugged finish.
title: Ricominciare 2010 Altísimo Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Named after the steeply sloping vineyard, the wine is cool, crisp with tight cherry flavors. It is lined with acidity and some tannins. The wine will need another few months to soften out and become richer.
title: Robert Perroud 2015 L'Enfer des Balloquets  (Brouilly)

description: This is an interesting medium-bodied wine from one of the oldest and largest wineries in the foothills. It is not heavy or rich, but has an appetizing dry flavor and firm texture. It will pair well with food since it has good balance.
title: Terra d'Oro 2014 Barbera (Amador County)

description: More restrained than the slightly fuller 2013, this Semillon is a bit quiet on the nose, but shows toasted hazelnut, white peach and melon notes on the palate. Give it another few month to smooth out the rough patches on the finish, but plan to drink up by the end of 2018.
title: Torbreck 2014 Woodcutter's Semillon (Barossa Valley)

description: Warm yellow apple, light custard and white peach combine for a creamy nose on this bottling from the Riboli family's new estate vineyard. The sip starts with a sizzle of acidity and then shows flavors of caramelized green apples and a touch of banana, proving both a tad tart and a tad rich.
title: San Simeon 2015 Stefano Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

description: This fruity, jammy and ripe wine is full of black-plum flavors. It has solid tannins and a dense structure along with layers of wood aging and fruitier acidity. Drink this wine now.
title: Sanguinhal 2010 Aragonez (Lisboa)

description: This light- to medium-bodied sparkler is a blend of 77% Chardonnay and 23% Pinot Noir. It's from an area not known for bubbles, but makes for a crisp, refreshing drink. Toasty notes blend easily with modest citrus, finishing almost dry.
title: Mad Fish NV Vera's Cuvée Méthode Traditionnelle Sparkling (Western Australia)

description: Dark shades of smoked nuts, char and dried, savory herbs mingle amidst ruddy black cherry and cranberry flavors in this bold, intensely structured Pinot Noir. It's a big, richly textured wine enveloping the palate in folds of dense black fruit. Fine but slightly bitter tannins mark the finish.
title: Pflüger 2014 Dürkheimer Trocken Pinot Noir (Pfalz)

description: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec is a steal, offering a robust touch of char on the front end aromatically before unleashing bright red fruit and soft tannin. Ultimately light bodied, it retains just the right amount of grippy tannin to give it some bite.
title: Picket Fence 2014 Top Rail Red (Sonoma County)

description: The shy nose offers subdued aromas recalling aromatic herb, underbrush and a balsamic note of camphor. The palate is rather lean, showing dried sour cherry, anise and mint alongside mouth-drying but not very persistent tannins. Drink through 2020.
title: Giacosa Fratelli 2012 Scarrone Vigna Madorlo  (Barolo)

description: Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon make up the majority of this wine, along with pinches of Syrah and Malbec. It shows aromas of candied strawberries, chocolate and coffee that lead to sweet but well-balanced red and black-fruit flavors. The balance is spot on.
title: Barnard Griffin 2014 Rob's Red Blend Red (Washington)

description: This shows more oak-driven sensations than you would expect from a wine aged in large casks, opening with aromas of oak, coconut, vanilla and an underpinning of ripe dark berry. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, espresso, chopped sage and licorice alongside rather austere, close-grained tannins.
title: Ioppa 2011 Balsina  (Ghemme)

description: This wine offers perfumed aromas of clove, blue fruit, orange peel, toast and wild flowers. The flavors show restraint, with fruit and barrel flavors lingering on the finish.
title: Kestrel 2012 Falcon Series Estate Syrah (Yakima Valley)

description: Aromas of raspberry and herb intermingle on the nose, which also shows a touch of reduction. The palate offers soft tart fruit flavors that provide appeal.
title: Kestrel 2012 Falcon Series Merlot (Yakima Valley)

description: Oaky toast, cedar and hint of meat add complexity and flavor to this light-bodied, mellowed wine, highlighted by soft, firm tannin and brooding blackberry.
title: Franciscan 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: As with several wines from Bourg, this has Malbec (20%) in the blend, a continuation of a long tradition. It adds maybe some extra tannins to this firm wine that is the chateau's top wine. Solid and dense, it is still maturing with black fruits and crisp acidity still right up front. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Genibon 2014 Cuvée Prestige  (Côtes de Bourg)

description: A selection from the oldest vines on the estate, this is a firm, ripe and concentrated fruity wine. Red cherries dominate the wine, lifted by the crisp edge of acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château de Javernand 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Chiroubles)

description: Named after the winemaker, Amélie Durand, this wood-aged wine is spicy and toasty without losing sight of the fruit. It has ripe blackberry fruit and acidity that will come to dominate the wood-aging flavors over the next few months. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château Doms 2012 Cuvée Amélie  (Graves)

description: Showing considerable new wood flavors, this is more vanilla and mint than fruit. That said, it does have the potential to bring out more of the black currant fruit of the vintage. As its juicy acidity softens, it will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château du Moulin Rouge 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: This mature wine, has lost youthful fruitiness and gained a more nutty, smooth and rich quality. There are touches of toastiness and almonds, with an aromatic aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Coteaux da Murta 2013 Quinta da Murta Arinto (Bucelas)

description: Saucy plum and wet-dog aromas improve ever so slightly with airing. This feels creamy and sticky, while basic flavors of cherry and plum finish with herbal hints and sweet notes of vanilla and cream.
title: Argento 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: In this wine, a red-black color and ripe, spicy aromas first grab the attention. Then cherry and black plum flavors spill out of the firm and dramatically tannic texture.
title: Butternut 2013 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This blend of Viura and Malvasia is mild, low on aromatic punch and suggestive of saline solution. This is friendly but flat in feel, with modest structure. Leesy flavors of peach and apple finish chalky and grabby.
title: Ostatu 2014 Blanco White (Rioja)

description: Hints of maple syrup and brown sugar in the aroma, ripe blackberry and strawberry in the flavor, and full body add up to a big, extroverted wine. It's not overly tannic, so is easy to enjoy in spite of the bold flavors.
title: Toad Hollow 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

description: Iron, raspberry and light cranberry notes greet the nose on this bottling. That sanguine element powers the palate as well, where iron and rust meet with turned earth flavors.
title: Inception 2013 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: As with most Del Rio wines, this is 100% varietal. Fruity and forward, it's a bowl full of peaches and apples. Flavors are light and fresh, without much substance. Drink up.
title: Del Rio 2013 Estate Grown Viognier (Rogue Valley)

description: Made from a majority of Cabernet Sauvignon, this bombastic blend also has Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petite Sirah. A bouquet of cinnamon and clove invites, before intense tar, tobacco and bittersweet tannins make way for super-sized oak and a taste of bacon.
title: Delectus 2012 Cuvée Julia Red (Knights Valley)

description: Candied slightly cooked strawberry and cherry notes permeate through this ripe ruddy off-dry rosé. Made from Pinot Meunier, it finishes with a whisper of dried savory thyme and lavender notes. Drink now.
title: Blümel 2013 Pinot Meunier Rosé (Rheinhessen)

description: There's an inkling of floral character on the nose of this otherwise robust, brooding and brawny vineyard-designate. It's overwhelmed by grippy tannins and a bitterness akin to tobacco. Along the way dark cherry and forest earth make an appearance—particularly pine and a whiff of tar.
title: FEL 2013 Hirsch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Soupy tomato, plum and green tobacco aromas feed into a pinched biting rubbery palate. This Merlot tastes roasted and oaky, with baked plum and berry flavors matched by clove and chocolate notes. A drawing tannic finish tastes stewy and woody.
title: Ferllen 2011 Reserve Merlot (Mendoza)

description: The oak is pronounced from the start of this full-bodied, slightly over-the-top white, which comes off as reduced among layers of caramel and almond. A hint of ripe cantaloupe, peach and apricot provides a sense of freshness on the finish.
title: Charthia 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Although less common than it once was, Malbec is still often part of the blend in red Bergerac. However, this pure Malbec is unusual. It's dark in color, with an almost medicinal aroma. The palate is pure black fruit with firm tannins to support the smoky blackberry flavors. Drink young for the fruitiness.
title: Château Laulerie 2013 Malbec (Bergerac)

description: The Malbec in the blend adds its tannins to this wine meant to drink young. The spice and wood aging are balanced with acidity and a juicy aftertaste. Drink from late 2016.
title: Château Bélingard 2014 Bélingard Rouge Red (Bergerac)

description: With fruit drawn from all over Burgundy, this is a light, bright and refreshing wine. It has light acidity, spice and apple flavors and a bright, tight aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2013 Colette  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: Fresh and fruity with a crisp mineral and textured character, this is a lively wine that's ready to drink. Acidity and a citrus zestiness give a refreshing lightness at the end.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2014 Periquita White (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is a light, fruity wine with lemon and apricot flavors and a citrus tang that gives a lift. It's attractive, fresh and with a ripe, warm aftertaste.
title: Vignerons de Mancey 2014  Mâcon

description: A blend of Viosinho and Verdelho, this a soft and ripe wine that has attractive pear, melon and gentle acidity. A light perfume from the Verdelho adds to the attractiveness of this fruity wine. It is ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas White (Douro)

description: This fresh wine shows fruit tones balanced by a light mineral note. It is bright with acidity and grapefruit flavors alongside a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Campelo 2014 Miranda White (Vinho Verde)

description: This wine shows unusual floral, clove and sage aromas. Flavors resembling boysenberry and black pepper come with a medium-full body and firm tannins. It's atypical for the variety but a good red wine.
title: Kimmel 2013 Four Blocks Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)

description: Chalky tannins make for a mouthcoating entry into this powerfully rich, dense and concentrated wine from the well-known region. All is surrounded by a trove of ripe blackberry fruit, clove and bittersweet chocolate.
title: Kirkland Signature 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: Aromas of raw oak, eucalyptus and gritty berry fruits are hot and leafy. This Tempranillo-based blend feels choppy with aggressive grating tannins. Flavors of baked roasted berry fruits are also herbal, green and leafy, while this finishes crisp, raw and tomatoey in flavor.
title: Marqués de Vargas 2007 Reserva Privada  (Rioja)

description: Dusty apple aromas come with a vanilla-like note of animal crackers. A plump but diluted palate shows mediocre wan flavors of nectarine and apple in front of a flat finish that's losing steam. Drink immediately or wait for a new vintage.
title: Martín Códax 2014 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

description: Shy honeyed aromas of tropical fruits wind up at banana. This feels fleshy and not direct, while soft powdery flavors of leesy melon and papaya finish with notes of oxidation, as if this is already starting to fade.
title: Luna Beberide 2014 Godello (Bierzo)

description: This wine was given quite a bit of time in bottle. It offers cranberry, olive and a sanguine touch of dried cherry. Medium in weight and oak, it finishes with tart acidity.
title: Halleck 2010 The Farm Vineyards Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The wine is still young, still shockingly full of acidity and black currant fruits that are backed by tannins. It needs time to calm down, to fill out with richer fruitiness. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2013 Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: The wine is all fruitiness, with attractive acidity and almond and lemon flavors. Made to be drunk instantly, it has the lightest texture, white fruit flavors and a fresh, crisp aftertaste.
title: Domaine Vincent Carême 2014 Spring  (Vouvray)

description: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Merlot comes across as simple and generic. None of the three components stands out, and the blend is diffuse and slightly sour.
title: Obsidian 2011 Molten Red (Oregon)

description: This has aromas of overripe black-skinned fruit, scorched earth and a funky whiff of barnyard. The rustic sensation carries over to the palate along with a bitter note. It lacks fruit richness while grainy tannins leave an abrupt, astringent finish. Tried twice and had the same notes.
title: Revello Fratelli 2011 Gattera  (Barolo)

description: Simple light aromas of vanilla and lees set up a round palate with ample acidic kick. For the most part, this is chunky and weighty, with apple and peach flavors, while mild bitterness in the form of peach pit closes this out.
title: Viña Galana 2014 Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

description: A lemon flavored wine that's crisp and fruity. The texture is soft with fruit and fresh acidity dominant. With its refreshing aftertaste, the wine is ready to drink now.
title: Terra Silvestre 2014 Arinto (Tejo)

description: This is a 100% varietal wine, aged for 20 months in French and Hungarian oak. Tart and plushy, it has a level of rusticity that serves it well. Thick tannins meet a smoky oaky core of wood and dried herb.
title: Luna 2014 Riserva Sangiovese (Napa Valley)

description: With a buttered-toast aroma, this rich wine is spicy, creamy and ripe. It is buttery, smooth and generously textured. It comes from the son of a Chablis producer who has set up his own negociant business. Drink this superripe wine now.
title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2016 Closerie des Alisiers Vieilles Vignes  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Light black cherry aromas meet with a bit of rose petal, vanilla and pie crust on the rustic nose of this bottling. It's easy sipping on the palate, where roasted red berries meet with hot earth and a touch of charred beef.
title: Midnight 2014 Nebula Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This leads with minty herbal aromas like juniper and eucalyptus. Upon airing, dark fruit notes emerge, along with some oak. On the palate, it's more rough than smooth, holding herbal black currant and chocolate flavors. By the time it finishes, its berry flavors are on par with its strong herbal notes.
title: Mil Piedras 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vista Flores)

description: Aromas suggesting black-skinned berry and almond unfold in the glass. The dense palate shows fleshy black cherry, baked plum and a hint of cinnamon alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2020.
title: Monte Zovo 2015  Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso

description: Delicate aromas of apple, nut and a whiff of acacia mingle together while the rather subdued, light-bodied palate shows suggestions of pear and citrus. An almond note gives it a pleasantly bitter close.
title: Montesole 2015  Fiano di Avellino

description: This opens with aromas suggesting prune and underbrush while the straightforward palate evokes blackberry jam, raisin and a hint of chocolate. It's already accessible, with supple tannins.
title: Santi 2015 Solane  (Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso)

description: A dash of Carignane contributes to the whole of this easygoing likable wine. Softly layered baked plum and prune flavors are given additional heft and roundness from a richer undertone of caramel and brown sugar.
title: The Federalist 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This has generic berry aromas, with a strawberry candy note. Its saturated palate hits with drying tannins, while clove and bitter chocolate flavors accent stewed berry notes. Oak and toast dominate the finish.
title: Valentin Bianchi 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: This is the first vintage of this estate-grown Tempranillo—a rare grape in the Willamette Valley. It's a bit high-toned and right on the edge of vinegary. Roasted flavors of charred red fruit and a hint of smoke come through on the finish. This is a love-it-or-leave-it wine with no middle ground.
title: Vidon Vineyard 2015 Explorer Tempranillo (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This opens with aromas of oak, blackberry and baking spice. The dense, taut palate shows black currant, toast and vanilla alongside tightly wound tannins. Drink through 2020.
title: Villa Canestrari 2014  Valpolicella Superiore

description: Vincent's Pinot Noirs are fermented with native yeasts in a mix of once-used and older barrels. This bottling opens with fresh strawberry and raspberry flavors, lemony acids, and an underpinning of wet stone. It's on the lighter side and was made (and priced) for everyday enjoyment.
title: Vincent Wine Company 2015 Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: This reserve-level Pinot Noir spent 17 months in neutral oak yet carries strong scents and flavors of vanilla and toast. Those elements accent a core of preserved strawberry fruit. If that hits the mark for your palate, you'll want to drink this while it's young and fresh.
title: Vista Hills 2015 Heritage Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Delicate aromas of black-skinned berry and baking spice introduce this easygoing red. The straightforward palate offers red cherry, cinnamon and a hint of white pepper alongside round tannins. Drink soon.
title: Albino Armani 2014 Egle  (Valpolicella Classico Superiore)

description: White blossoms, yeast, apple, and peach and something a little sweaty proceed towards a palate that is almost gritty in texture, with more floral and apple notes and the region's characteristic searing acidity.
title: Alkoomi 2016 Black Label Riesling (Frankland River)

description: Relatively elegant aromas of black currant, blueberry, loam, oregano and thyme show on the nose of this widely available bottling. The palate is simpler, with cocoa dust, black cherry, pepper and tannins that tighten into the finish.
title: Austerity 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This soft and creamy wine has a gentle mousse and ripe white-fruit flavors. Its open, rounded character and warm aftertaste make it ideal as an apéritif.
title: Bailly-Lapierre NV Paul Delane Réserve Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This opens with aromas of underbrush and black-skinned berry while the straightforward palate offers vanilla, black cherry and a touch of almond. It's easygoing, with round tannins. Drink through 2020.
title: Bellora 2015 Il Mastego  (Valpolicella Superiore)

description: Plummy flavors and a broad, soft texture make this wine taste ripe and plush. It blends lightly smoky and oaky nuances with butter and jam that accentuate an almost sweet character.
title: Beringer 2016 Founders' Estate Pinot Noir (California)

description: Aromas of white-fruit and yeast is mild on the nose. On the palate, this brut nature is lean and acidic, with a mouthfeel defined by lime juice and wet stone. Green-fruit flavors are slightly oxidized on a quick-fading finish with green-herb notes.
title: Castellroig NV Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: Half Barbera, half four other red grapes, this features a handsome black dog on the label. It's blood-black in the glass also, with plum, chocolate and leather flavors in equal proportion. Depending upon your tolerance for leathery reds, it may surprise or disappoint.
title: Cathedral Ridge 2015 Rhett's Red (Columbia Valley (OR))

description: Pleasant fig and pear flavors fill out this medium-bodied and rather subtly flavored wine. It tastes ripe enough, but not overly rich, has good concentration and an earthy component
title: Church & State 2014 Lost Inhibitions White (California)

description: Aromas of cedar, black-skinned berry and a whiff of tobacco lead the way. The firm palate shows ripe black cherry, vanilla and a hint of star anise alongside mellow tannins. Drink soon.
title: Corte Rugolin 2014 San Giorgio  (Valpolicella)

description: Soft and accessible, this opens with aromas of vanilla, mature blackberry and exotic spice. The mellow palate delivers ripe black plum, cinnamon and white pepper alongside lithe tannins.
title: Corte Rugolin 2014  Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso

description: This wine pulls from across the wider appellation to combine cool-climate grapes with warmer regions. Round and easygoing, it offers fleshy fine flavors of pineapple and peach, its oak integrated and unobtrusive.
title: Decoy 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Extreme lawn clipping and green bell pepper aromas show on the nose of this bottling, with slightly rounder hints of guava, passion fruit and struck flint also arising. It's a bit riper on the sip, with yellow pear, Key lime, rainy cement and wet hay flavors.
title: District 7 Wines 2016 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

description: Light and fruity, this gently creamy wine is cut with tangy acidity. This balance gives the wine a delicious, crisp present and the possibility of a few more years aging. It is all fruit, with no sign of wood, and will be ready from mid 2018.
title: Domaine d'Anaïs 2016  Mâcon-Villages

description: Crisp and simple, this is a bright, citrus-flavored wine. Acidity and a clean, clear character give it liveliness. The wine is all fruit with no sign of wood, so drink early from summer 2018.
title: Domaine de la Denante 2016  Bourgogne

description: Subtle aromas of baked plum and cinnamon set the tone. Mirroring the nose, the straightforward palate offers prune, mocha and clove alongside smooth tannins.
title: Domìni Veneti 2014  Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso

description: A heavy coating of oak dominates over mild fruit tones on the nose. This old-vine Garnacha Blanca is textured, with briny white-fruit and resiny oak flavors.
title: Edetària 2015 Selecció Old Vines Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)

description: Predominantly Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine shows a wonderful black-currant purity on the palate, along with intense, vibrant acidity. The background is all tannin, which speaks to its aging potential. This wine is the last vintage produced by Paul Pontallier, who was general manager from 1990 until his death in 2016. It's a memorable wine and one for aging. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Margaux 2015  Margaux

description: This magnificent wine brings together the great fruit of the vintage with a complex structure. The acidity, ripe tannins and the power of this dense wine are enormous, as is its aging potential. With that acidity and tannic structure, and with the perfumes from the Cabernet Franc, this wine will evolve slowly and with a measured pace. Drink from 2028.
title: Château Ausone 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: Made with 45% Cabernet Franc, this great wine offers a beautiful, rich and perfumed character. This is an exceptional vintage for this estate which incorporated into the blend fruit from parcels of the vineyard that would normally go into the second wine. It is packed with black-fruit flavors and broad tannins, with a background of juicy acidity and a firm structure. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Cheval Blanc 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: This is a great vintage from Lafite. The profile is rich in feel, with a seriously firm tannic structure. Solid, complex and with great authority, this Cabernet Sauvignon-dominant wine, is impressively dense in dark-fruit tones. It will age for many years. Drink from 2027, although that would almost be too soon.
title: Château Lafite Rothschild 2015  Pauillac

description: This is like drinking liquid black currants and blackberries. The wine has great intensity and richness from the superbly generous Merlot. The wood aging is still there as a hint in the background although the fruit and acidity dominate. Drink from 2026.
title: Château Pétrus 2015  Pomerol

description: This wine that comes mainly from a magnificent walled vineyard within sight of the Gironde estuary is structured and dense. Its tannins and firm character show its enormous aging potential. Powerful black fruits come from the 85% Cabernet Sauvignon in this rich, juicy wine. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Léoville Las Cases 2015  Saint-Julien

description: Generous, rich and powerful, this is a sumptuous wine. With just a slight preponderance of Cabernet Sauvignon, it has structure as well as clean, clear black-currant flavors. Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, it delivers an explosion of fruit as well as serious tannins. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Palmer 2015  Margaux

description: This is a hugely opulent wine, packed withblack fruits, rich tannins and great concentration. It is a gorgeous wine that's full of potential, with the dense, dark core showing how well this wine will age. Drink this complex wine from 2027.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2015  Pauillac

description: Among the Napa Valley's most crowning achievements in Cabernet, this vintage of Hillside Select is stunning, bright and beguiling in every way. Intensely layered, its interwoven flavors burst in black licorice, dark chocolate, pipe tobacco, gun smoke and garrigue. Spicy oak adds to the power and weight. Drinkable now, it will show even greater finesse in time; enjoy best 2023–2033 and possibly beyond.
title: Shafer 2013 Hillside Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: Since the first vintage in 1991, this wine and its vineyard have travelled far. Now close to the top of the classification tree in Saint-Émilion, this vintage shows the impressive nature of this powerful wine. With a good balance between acidity and black fruits backed up by tannins, the wine is powerful and stylish. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Valandraud 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: This quinta was created by the legendary Dona Antonia Ferreira in the 19th century and it is still owned by her descendants. While currently quite youthful, there is greatness in this wine. Its density of minerality, black fruits and rich tannins create a wine with huge aging potential. It's rich while always elegant, balanced and ready for a long life. Drink from 2025.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2015 Red (Douro)

description: Intoxicating scents of smoke, flint, dried mountain herb and woodland berry are just some of the multifaceted aromas you'll find on this dazzling Nebbiolo. It's extremely elegant, with a weightless intensity, delivering Marasca cherry, crushed strawberry, white pepper and tobacco framed in fine tannins. Vibrant acidity gives it impeccable balance while a flinty mineral vein energizes the finish. Some may find this almost too ethereal while lovers of finesse, complexity and balance will be enchanted. Drink through 2027.
title: Arpepe 2007 Sassella Riserva Rocce Rosse  (Valtellina Superiore)

description: Dominated by the two Cabernets—Sauvignon and Franc—this is a beautifully structured wine. Firm tannins and ripe black currants give a perfumed character that is ripe, dense and impressive. The wine has enormous potential, with great tannins and fruit. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Figeac 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: Almost entirely Cabernet Franc, this single-vineyard wine has a wonderful perfumed character. Firm tannins are fully integrated into the fruit, giving a structured yet balanced feel. Ripe and elegant, it will age well. Drink from 2027.
title: JCP Maltus 2015 Le Dôme  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Direct and concentrated, this wine is powered by tannins and a firm texture. Dense, it has the potential for plenty of fruit as it matures. That will take time, because this impressive wine is powered by its structure. Wait until 2028.
title: Château Haut-Brion 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: Now at 58 acres, this is a large vineyard for Saint-Émilion. Intense tannins and a powerful structure are the hallmarks of this concentrated wine. At the same time, it has great acidity and elegant black fruits. Together, this is a dense, rich wine with a long-term future. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Bélair-Monange 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: The tannins in this fine vintage of Latour are still enormous, dominating the black currant fruit. It has spice, tannins, impressive fruit and a pure, cool character. To be released in the mid-2020s, the wine is likely to age for many years. Enjoy from 2027.
title: Château Latour 2014  Pauillac

description: This wine is structured, powerful and ripe but also elegant and stylish. Juicy black fruits combine with a dry, structured core to give the wine both its richness and its future. Powered by its fruit and tannins, it has good aging potential. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Angélus 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: With its 90% Cabernet Sauvignon, the wine has super-ripe black-currant flavors encased in firm, smoky tannins and hints of wood. Showing the opulence of the vintage and the style of Saint-Julien, it will age for many years. The wine will certainly not be ready before 2026.
title: Château Ducru Beaucaillou 2015  Saint-Julien

description: Always one of the great white wines of the world, this vintage continues that reputation. With its richness, density and layers of fruit and acidity, this wine is powerful and beautifully ripe. The wood aging is just a hint in background. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Haut-Brion 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: Succulent fruits, rich tannins and juicy acidity are in perfect harmony in this wine produced from biodynamic grapes. It has a rich, velvet texture and dense structure, sumptuous and already balanced and delicious. However do not be fooled, this is a serious wine for aging. Drink no earlier than 2026.
title: Château Pontet-Canet 2015  Pauillac

description: It's always a cliché to compare wine to the nectar of the gods but there's little that comes closer than this. It's decadently sweet, offering layer upon layer of unctuous honey and stone-fruit nectar, yet exhilarating, fine and filigreed. The finish is endless and breathtaking. Delicious now but will hold for decades to come.
title: Robert Weil 2016 Kiedrich Gräfenberg Trockenbeerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Starting with the 2008 vintage, the firm's flagship bottling is now made without added dosage. It opens with aromas of yellow stone fruit, brioche and crushed stone that carry over to the elegantly structured palate, along with tangy tangerine and bright acidity. A refined perlage gives it a weightless concentration while a savory mineral note lingers on the bone-dry finish. In a word, it's gorgeous.
title: Ca' del Bosco 2008 Annamaria Clementi Dosage Zero Riserva  (Franciacorta)

description: Although this wine is ripe, it is the fruit that sings. Firm and rich, the tannins support the wonderful fruitiness. Its perfumed Cabernets give the wine great presence as well as freshness. It is ready for long aging. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Pavie 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine is rich with tannins and superb fruit. The blackberries and black plums are succulent and chewy, giving the wine an opulent, ripe character. This 18-acre vineyard, with 93% Merlot, has produced an impressive wine. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Trotanoy 2015  Pomerol

description: This wine is packed with ripe black fruit and structured by a dense, mineral texture. Generous fruit tones and plenty of tannic grip translate to a wine worthy of the cellar. Drink from 2025.
title: JCP Maltus 2015 Les Astéries  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This dense, rich wine is firm with solid tannins. Its texture and structure give it an opulent character that brings out tannins as much as the ripe black fruits. Powerful and concentrated it needs time to get its potential elegance in order. Then it will be a major wine, so it's worth waiting until 2027.
title: Château Calon Ségur 2015  Saint-Estèphe

description: This wine, rich and opulent, defines the terroir of this estate. It has a rich, dense character, powerful and concentrated. The juicy black fruits enhance the impression of generosity as well as concentration. Drink from 2027.
title: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is dense in expressive, dark fruit and solid tannins which give it a rich, enveloping feel. With its spicy score and crisp acidity, there is great potential for aging. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: If any wine from the Douro has a Bordeaux influence, it is this wine. Produced as part of a joint venture between the Prats family of Bordeaux and the Symington family of the Douro, this wine shows great attention to tannins and structure while allowing the black fruits to shine. It is a stylish wine, powerful while wearing that power lightly. Drink this wine, from a very good year, from 2022.
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2015 Chryseia Red (Douro)

description: Cherry-red in color, this rosé features aromas of cherry and white chocolate. It is surprisingly soft on the palate, with flavors of cherry, peach and citrus. Slightly chewy tannins make their presence known on a finish inflected with flavors of cranberry, thyme and sage.
title: Gotsa Family Wines 2015 Dry Unfiltered Saperavi Rosé (Kartli)

description: Aromas of toast, oak and yellow flower lead the nose. Aged in large casks and barriques, the linear, if somewhat lean, palate offers golden apple and lemon zest alongside tangy acidity.
title: Ca' Rugate 2015 Monte Alto  (Soave Classico)

description: This wine offers aromas of lemon blossom, orange zest and honeysuckle. In the mouth, flavors of pear, apple and white peach precede a crisp finish.
title: Bostavan 2015 Dor Traminer-Chardonnay White (Moldova)

description: This refreshing wine from the Seze family of Fronsac is light, crisp and packed with fruit. Crisp with citrus flavors it is ready to drink now.
title: Château Buisson-Redon 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Apple flavors dominate this attractive blend of seven grapes, including three aromatic varieties, that give the wine its perfumed character. So although it is young and with enough acidity, it is the hints of lychee and peppered pear that add interest to the wine. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Portada Winemaker's Selection Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Earthy spicy aromas of tea and leather frame herbal berry and cherry notes. This has a fresh jumpy palate and snappy flavors of spiced pie cherry, plum and oak-based vanilla. A bit of saltiness rises up on a juicy, racy finish.
title: Cono Sur 2015 Reserva Especial Pinot Noir (San Antonio)

description: Balanced acidity and fruit give this Lobre wine its immediate attraction. It has a bright character, the fruit and the acidity in harmony. Drink this ripe wine now.
title: Château de l'Aubrade 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A crisp blend of Sémillon, Sauvignon Blanc and Muscadelle, this is a ripe wine, showing the warmth of this vintage. It is lightly perfumed with apricot and red-apple flavors. The aftertaste is all about tangy fruit. Drink now.
title: Château du Moulin 2015  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: Oregon's recent overproduction of young Pinot Noir has opened the door for this easygoing, forward and fruity style. Clean and simple red fruits offer no subtle flavors—just a little boost to the finish from the supporting tannins.
title: Cow Bell 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Aromas of honeysuckle, exotic fruit and a whiff of Mediterranean scrub take center stage. The tangy palate offers grapefruit, peach and pineapple alongside crisp acidity.
title: Curto 2016 Poiano Inzolia (Terre Siciliane)

description: This concentrated, herbal wine has a good balance between the great fruit and the tangy, zesty texture. With its fruity character and spicy aftertaste, it's already a pleasure to drink.
title: Château le Grand Verdus 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Crisp and fruity, this wine is full of apple and citrus flavors. It also features a touch of wood and spice, with a creamy aftertaste from the light wood aging. Drink now.
title: Château Mont-Pérat 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a tight, mineral-textured wine. Crisp fruit keeps it bright, but the texture adds a more serious, structured note. Wait until late 2017 for it to come completely together.
title: Château Petit Moulin 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A sweet smell of honeysuckle and grapefruit candy permeates the nose of this bottling, along with cut honeydew melon and apple blossom. Sugary mandarin juice is the primary flavor on the palate, but it's properly offset by acidity a chalky texture.
title: Coquelicot 2016 Riesling (Los Olivos District)

description: This is a soft easy-drinking blend of Cabernet, Shiraz, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Cherry, vanilla and hints of mint mingle easily on the nose and palate, which offers a medium body and a slightly creamy texture. Drink it over the next year or two.
title: Bleasdale 2014 Langhorne Crossing Red (Langhorne Creek)

description: Snappy grapefruit and tangerine aromas are clean and crisp. That also describes the palate on this Maule Valley SB. Fairly intense flavors of lemon-lime and grapefruit cruise across a racy, unbroken finish.
title: Balduzzi 2016 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: The earthy berry and plum aromas in this full-bodied wine include cinnamon and spice notes. Its ripe black fruit comes with a tea-like note and a rubbery mouthfeel, finishing rugged with meaty black fruit and spice flavors.
title: Alegra 2014 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

description: A wine of moderate build and mouth-coating concentration, this shows a dusty plume of tannin and plum and soy flavors.
title: Antler Hill 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Petit Verdot (38%) takes the lead on this blend, followed by Cabernet Sauvignon (26%), Merlot (12%), Cabernet Franc (12%) and Malbec. The aromas come off as leafy and green, with notes of dates, flowers and spice. The palate is quite light and elegant, not having the heft to stand on its own. The extraction seems dialed way back.
title: Hightower 2013 Estate Red (Red Mountain)

description: Perfumed oak and funky earthiness permeate the nose and palate of this wine, with punchy cedar and bay notes. It lingers long on forest floor, pine and other woodsy components through its medium-bodied ripeness and structure.
title: Mount Veeder 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This is a sharp-edged wine with green-tinged fruits—apples and pears not quite ripe. It pushes accents of herb and stem forward, and will probably drink best with food rather than on its own.
title: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine is 80% Syrah, 10% Mourvèdre and 10% Grenache. It brings unusual aromas of sawdust, mushroom, Band Aid, dark fruit and spice. The palate is lush and full, showing warmth on the finish.
title: Gorman 2014 Old Scratch G-S-M (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This Cab Franc bears a “cool climate” designation, and that's confirmed on the nose, which is highly herbal and green, with a blast of eucalyptus and juniper. A raw grabby underdeveloped palate tastes of leafy plum and berry fruits, while the finish feels scratchy due to drawing tannins.
designation: Coastal Cool Climate Wine Single Vineyard
title: Lomas del Valle 2014 Coastal Cool Climate Wine Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Casablanca Valley)

description: This Tempranillo's oaky berry aromas are solid but standard. It shows moderate buttery oak and plum flavors, tasting mostly of creamy oak on a finish propped up by acidity.
title: Manuel Manzaneque Suárez 2014 Ea! Tempranillo (La Mancha)

description: The 2009 vintage was a hot one, so this wine's stewy, overripe aromas and deep, advanced color aren't shocking. In the mouth, it's generous with raisiny, ripe berry fruit, feeling undeniably heavy.
title: Gancedo 2009 Xestal Mencía (Bierzo)

description: This blend of Syrah and Garnacha feels blocky and rubbery. Floral raspberry and blueberry aromas come with baking spice notes, particularly cinnamon. Ripe raspberry flavors finish with a dash of chocolate and a touch of salt.
title: Las Colinas Del Ebro 2015 Syrah-Grenache (Terra Alta)

description: An earthy, leathery aromatic character carries over to the palate of this wine, joined by ripe plum flavors. The blend here is 53% Mourvèdre and 47% Syrah, feeling full-bodied, firmly tannic and ready for cassoulet.
title: Le Casque 2014 Adrian Red (Sierra Foothills)

description: Straw-colored in the glass, this wine has aromas of white and yellow peach, with flavors of passion fruit and pineapple. It's amazing that it is more than 10 years old. The wine has good mouthfeel and is well balanced with a crisp, clean finish. Drink now or hold for a few years.
title: Lion-Gri 2006 Golden Land Dry Chardonnay (Moldova)

description: Slightly smoky grilled-toast aromas lead into a plump medium-bodied wine filled with flavors of yellow plum, tangerine and lime. It's not particularly zesty or linear in a true cool-climate fashion, but steers clear of ripe tropical fruit, ending on a gentle note of citrus pith. Drink now.
title: McWilliam's 2014 Cool Climate Chardonnay (Australia)

description: Aromas of lemon-lime, jasmine and honeysuckle prepare the palate for crisp, clean flavors of lemon zest and lemon curd.
title: Minkov Brothers 2011 Le Photographe Rheinriesling Riesling (Thracian Valley)

description: Red-fruit aromas come with a hint of animal, something that's not uncommon to Bobal. An expansive palate is mildly abrasive, while chunky plum flavors end with heat and skins-driven bitterness
title: Bovale 2014 Bobal (Utiel-Requena)

description: This big, ripe, well-oaked and very firm textured wine could be paired with equally big proteins. It has generous blackberry and black-cherry flavors. Overt tannins give a drying sensation, especially on the finish.
title: Brooklyn Winery 2012 Malbec (Suisun Valley)

description: This wine packs a playful nose, with strawberry, plum blossoms, crushed cloves, cedar and a touch of vanilla proving quite inviting. The palate is light, ripe and drinkable, if not very complex, with flavors of strawberry jam, licorice and milk chocolate.
title: Danza del Sol 2012 Super Tuscan Sangiovese-Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)

description: Creamy aromas of custard give off a soapy smell. This feels citric, while nectarine and orange flavors are a bit funky. On the finish, this is more fresh and direct than flavorful.
title: Camps d'Estels NV Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: The name Tradition in Loire terms often means no wood aging. This wine is certainly all fruit: 75% Gamay and 25% Pinot Noir, from the small area of Chateaumeillant south of Sancerre. The grapes give a juicy, red cherry and berry-flavored wine that's fresh and light. After nearly four years, it is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Siret-Courtaud 2012 Tradition Pinot Noir-Gamay (Châteaumeillant)

description: This entry-level wine from Domaine Fouassier is produced on limestone soil, giving a crisp, bright and lightly herbal wine. It is clean and clear, packed with citrus and gooseberry flavors. The aftertaste continues the fresh, fruity character.
title: Domaine Fouassier 2014  Sancerre

description: The vineyard of the Giennois is close to the city of Orléans, making it the most northerly Loire vineyard. This wine with its cool, fresh character has a light tannic character and brings out red fruits as its biggest attraction. It has a fresh, crisp, juicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Emile Balland 2014 Les Beaux Jours Red (Coteaux du Giennois)

description: The 24-acre Domaine Curot is at Thauvenay close to the Loire. This wine is attractive and soft. Apples and ripe pears dominate, with a fresh citrus streak. It's ready to drink.
title: Eric Louis 2014 Domaine Curot  (Sancerre)

description: A medium build and managed acidity combine for a crowd-pleasing wine that will satisfy in melon, lime and vanilla. The oak is never obtrusive or unsupportive of the whole.
title: MacMurray Estate Vineyards 2014 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: From sandy soil above the banks of the Cher river, this wine has crisp citrus and clean, bright white berry and lime flavors. There's a refreshing herbal aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Jean-Michel Sorbe 2014  Quincy

description: This is a perfumed, fruity wine. Along with its fresh acidity, crisp apple texture and touches of lemon, it offers a tang of orange zest as well as touches of minerality from the gravelly soil of the vineyard. Drink now.
title: Jean-Michel Sorbe 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Reuilly)

description: This informal red opens with aromas of violet, berry and a whiff of sawdust. The simple, fleeting palate offers dried black cherry and a hint of dark spice alongside grainy tannins that lead into an astringent, abrupt finish.
title: Godiolo 2012  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Soft baking-spice notes mesh with vanilla, red currants, dark chocolate and cranberry on the nose of this bottling. There's a cinnamon and nutmeg spice to the palate, where hibiscus, more cranberry and red cherry also shows.
title: Blackburn Wine Company 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Quite ripe in style, this wine packs a bevy of white flower aromas, from jasmine to tuberose, as well as fleshy yellow pears. There is solid sizzle in the glass once sipped, but the honeysuckle prominence, ripe peach and powerful orange-blossom flavors dominate.
title: Robert Hall 2014 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: The wine is fresh, so crisp and fruity. Its red currant fruit and lively acidity are rounded out by a caramel flavor that gives richness. The aftertaste though is dry and packed with fruit. Drink now.
title: Roland Tissier et Fils 2014 Rosé (Sancerre)

description: Floral plum and horsey aromas comprise the nose on this multigrape blend led by Bobal. A grabby palate exhibits raw, tough tannins, while plum and berry flavors finish rugged.
title: Vicente Gandia 2014 Hoya de Cadenas 130 Anniversary Red (Utiel-Requena)

description: This delicious, sweet and fruit-driven wine smells like pineapple and honey. It tastes full bodied, very ripe and unctuous, and has a long, lingering finish. It will be great with salty cheeses and toasted nuts.
title: Three Pines 2013 Tierra Blanca Chardonnay (California)

description: This is the winery's first bottling of Malbec from this up-and-coming vineyard. Woodspice, cedar and mushroom aromas are followed by seemingly dried-out cherry flavors that trail toward the finish.
title: :Nota Bene 2012 Heart of the Hill Malbec (Red Mountain)

description: Unctuous and made in a robust style, this wine offers a taste of caramel apple and hazelnut, with the illusion of sweetened oak amid a persistent finish.
title: Herencia 2014 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Reduced and thickly concocted, this wine overpowers in big tannin and oak. The fruit presents a mix of cherry and cassis wrapped in dark chocolate, burly and a good fit for the power thirsty.
title: Hypothesis 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Matchstick sulfur and background red-fruit aromas lead into a simple palate that's wet and lively but doesn't offer a lot to latch onto. Generic citrus and cherry Lifesaver flavors finish with a note of briny salt.
title: Artadi 2014 Artazuri Rosado (Navarra)

description: Rich, thick, smoky and soft, this wine conjures all the adjectives that add up to brawny and big. This tastes akin to a Port with chocolate melted in.
title: Pezzi King 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: A perfumed wine, this offers fresh apple and light spice flavors and considerable acidity. It is light and fruity, with a crisp lemon-zest flavor at the end. The vineyard of the Giennois is close to the city of Orléans, making it the most northerly Loire vineyard. Drink now.
title: Emile Balland 2014 Le Beaux Jours Sauvignon Blanc (Coteaux du Giennois)

description: Produced from Pinot Gris, this is so crisp and fresh. It has light red currant flavors that give an intensely fruity character to this attractive wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Denis Jamain 2014 Rosé (Reuilly)

description: This crisp wine has a creamy background that presents an attractive blend of fresh apples with honey and lemon. It's a light, perfumed wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Cady 2014 Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

description: Light, fresh aromas of tomato and plum are gritty. This feels round for the most part, with rubbery tannins. Medicinal, slightly minty plum and berry flavors end with acceptable rawness and a latex note.
title: Finca del Castillo 2014 Tempranillo (La Mancha)

description: Light, creamy and fruity, this fresh, lightly mineral wine has plenty of fresh apple and citrus flavors. There is no suggestion of wood, and the wine is all about fresh fruit. Drink now.
title: Jacques Bourguigon 2013  Chablis

description: Very crisp and packed with fruit, this is an attractive, lightly mineral wine. It is fresh, full of green apples and lime, with a juicy apricot aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Joseph Mellot 2014 Les Milets Sauvignon Blanc (Reuilly)

description: Herbal and excessive in wood tannins, this has strong elements of jalapeño and pepper amidst a full-bodied expression of black plum and chocolate.
title: Troll Bridge 2010 Password Red (Napa Valley)

description: This jazzed-up wine has a slightly smoky, sawdust-like aroma and ripe, spicy oak flavors that taste almost sweet.
title: Solitary Cellars 2013 Tempranillo (Lodi)

description: Very ripe and fruity in character, this wine smells like cherries, raisins and spiced plums, and has a grippy texture from good acidity and moderate tannins for a little bite of astringency.
title: Foursight 2013 Charles Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Fresh green-pear notes appear everywhere and round out the slender palate. Lemon and lime freshness provide extra structure. Drink soon.
title: François Baur 2015 Herrenweg Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

description: Peach and apple aromas are soft and easy, maybe even a touch cidery. Overall, this is a standard but well-made Albariño, with flavors of nectarine and cider. Drink immediately.
title: Condes de Albarei 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

description: Young and fresh, Elk Cove's entry-level Willamette Valley Pinot is a well-made, fruit-forward expression of the grape. Hints of clove wrap around peppery berry and cherry fruit. It's a bright, appealing wine, drinking quite nicely already.
title: Elk Cove 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a bright focused wine with a taut sense of balance, and flavors that are both rich and tangy. Cranberry aromas meet dark chocolate flavors on a tightrope of good acidity and tannins.
title: Enotria 2012 Dolcetto (Mendocino)

description: This is an appealing, dry, and well-balanced wine, with everything in good proportions. It has lots of fresh cherry aromas, good and deep fruit flavors and a light but tasty layer of toasted, smoky oak.
title: Fetzer 2014 Eagle Peak Merlot (California)

description: Bright black cherry animates the aromas and flavors of this medium-bodied wine. It is firm in texture, not too complicated or overripe, but just nice and easy to drink.
title: Fields Family 2013 Estate Grown Syrah (Lodi)

description: This red blend from Moldova is composed of 70% Feteasca Neagra and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon. It has scents of black pepper, black plum juice and a whiff of jalapeño. In the mouth there are flavors of dried plum, cinnamon, clove and persistent sweet tannins in the finish.
title: Et Cetera 2013 Serendipity Red (Moldova)

description: A real evocation of fresh, crisp and crunchy apple delivers freshness and punch on the easy-drinking but fresh, clean and joyful palate. Drink this soon, if possible at a summer party where this slender wine will come into its refreshing own.
title: Famille Hauller 2015 Riesling (Alsace)

description: Strong blueberry and black-cherry aromas mesh with cedar spice and tobacco ash on this rather elegant nose. A balsamic blueberry reduction flavor shows on the palate, where fine-grained tannins also present smashed vanilla flavors.
title: Byington 2013 Alliage Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Made in an approachable style, light-bodied and yet showing an attractive level of richness, there's melon, oak and honey at this wine's core, accented by pretty floral notes of apple blossom and pie.
title: Cannonball 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Smoke seeps throughout this deeply earthen Auslese, lending a savory, mineral tone to the bright lemon and tangerine flavors. The palate is honeyed and concludes deftly with a tea-leaf astringency that lingers on the finish.
title: Bollig-Lehnert 2014 Trittenheimer Apotheke Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Round and juicy, this offers enticing scents of white flower, mature apple, citrus and pear that carry over to the palate along with honeydew melon and a hint of aromatic herb. Fresh acidity balances the ripe fruit flavors.
title: Donnafugata 2015 Anthilia White (Sicilia)

description: Slight notes of green pear hint at a fresh, lively and fruity palate. This is a light, easy summer wine of feather weight. Lemony freshness makes it ideal for a summer afternoon, with its freshly fruited finish.
title: Dopff & Irion 2014 Double Impact White (Alsace)

description: The slightest hint of baking spice hovers over fresh, tart but ripe apple notes. Something juicy and textured at the core makes you want to drink more.
title: Domaine Fernand Engel 2015 Renaissance Sylvaner (Alsace)

description: With just a touch of yellow fruits, this is a ripe, concentrated wine. It has something of the Chablis minerality that is combined with intense fruits and acidity. The wine is young but very drinkable now, although likely to age at least until 2020.
title: Domaine George 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)

description: The wine comes from a large 300 acre vineyard in the eastern Costa Serena region. Dominated by Niellucciu (aka Sangiovese), it brings out all the acidity of the grape, restrained by ripe raspberry and apple fruitiness. It is a light, bright and crisp wine.
title: Domaine Vetriccie 2015 Rosé (Corse)

description: Aromas of beeswax, acacia flower, honey and a waft of smoke drift out of the glass. The tangy, medium-bodied palate offers dried stone fruit, citrus zest and a note of honeyed mineral while bitter almond backs up the dry finish.
title: Di Meo 2012 F Selezione Alessandra  (Fiano di Avellino)

description: This is a fresh, juicy wine with acidity and bright red fruits. Yes, there are tannins but they support the lively, crisp strawberries and the spice that comes from the wood aging. The wine is developing fast and will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Bart 2014 Les Echezots  (Marsannay)

description: This is tight, tannic and offers red-currant fruits. It has a dusty texture along with layers of acidity, spice and hints of wood aging. The wine is fresh with bright fruitiness and good acidity. The tannins do suggest aging potential, so don't drink before 2019.
title: Domaine Collotte 2014 Champ Salomon  (Marsannay)

description: There is a good range of flavor complexity in this medium-bodied, soothing wine. It starts with a bit of grapefruit and lemon in the aroma, then adds a riper peach flavor that matches the supple texture.
title: City Winery of New York 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

description: This Slovenian red blend of 40% Cabernet Franc, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Merlot has aromas of raspberry, cherry and a touch of green bramble. In the mouth, there is balanced acidity with flavors of cherry pie and dried plums. The finish is persistent with grippy tannins.
title: Colliano 2012 Cuvée Red (Goriska Brda)

description: This is a ripe, red-fruit dominated wine with rich strawberry and cream flavors that are immediately attractive, With its balanced acidity, the wine is ready to drink now.
title: Château de Lardiley 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A good tannic edge to this Gonfrier family wine gives it structure and places it in the food category. With plenty of acidity, it is also refreshing, textured at the end with a lift of zesty lemon.
title: Château de Marsan 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This fruity wine has a refreshing citrus flavor. Lightly textured, it is lively and crisp. A mineral edge gives it tight structure, putting the wine into the food category.
title: Château des Antonins 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Tangy and fragrant, this gives off aromas of red berry, white rose and a whiff of carob. The vibrant palate doles out juicy red cherry, red raspberry, mineral and a hint of baking spice alongside crisp acidity. It finishes crisp and clean.
title: Curto 2015 Eos Nero d'Avola Nero d'Avola (Eloro)

description: Vanilla, cedar and plum notes benefit from a dusting of cracked pepper in this medium-bodied dry red. The tannins are supple to the point of creaminess, and the finish warm and spicy. Drink now.
title: 2 Up 2014 Shiraz (South Australia)

description: Pommard and Wädenswil clones make up this cuvée. Chunky fruit flavors of sour plum and cherry are on display, with decent penetration and moderate length. Drink now through 2022.
title: A Blooming Hill Vineyard 2014 Trouble Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Opaque and thick, this wine is robust, yet balanced—a study in cedar and pencil lead that drives into a dimension of dried herb. The savory components find companionship in fruitier notes of cherry and blueberry, before a tannic, oaky finish closes things out.
title: Artesa 2012 Limited Release Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Leathery, clipped, briary black-fruit aromas are heavily oaked and smoky. This feels like a bag of nails, with a sucking texture. Barrel-heavy flavors of charred blackberry and cassis are resiny and dry, with clove notes and pounding tannins. Hold as long as you wish; this can only benefit from more time in the bottle.
title: Astrales 2013 Christina  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Baked red cherry, caramel, black rocks and the slightest hint of dill and mint greet the nose on this blend of 34% Cabernet Sauvignon, 29% Merlot, 15% Cabernet Franc, 12% Petit Verdot and 10% Malbec. Black olive leads the palate, followed by blueberry, and the whole package manages to be both juicy and herbaceous.
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2013 Cellar Select Meritage (Santa Barbara County)

description: This innovative Cretan producer hits the mark with this pretty, fragrant white blend including the island's hallmark white, Vidiano. The nose is full of flowers, white peach fruit and rip citrus, while on the palate, an interplay of exotic fruit and minerality keep the wine focused but friendly. A great wine for spicy Indian cuisine or sushi.
title: Rhous 2015 White (Crete)

description: This fluorescent pink rosé is fairly full on the nose, with a grape skins character. Lively, balanced and lightly oily in feel, this delivers plum and citrus flavors prior to a finish that's pithy and tastes like ripe pink grapefruit.
title: Rio Madre 2015 Graciano Rosé (Rioja)

description: Orange-blossom aromas and lush, broad flavors like banana and pineapple make a good combo in this medium-bodied, soft and richly textured wine. It fermented in oval wood casks and aged eight months on the lees.
title: Navarro 2014 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

description: Malolactic notes and spice lead to plentiful stone-fruit flavors. Barrel notes provide accents.
title: Novelty Hill 2014 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Roussanne (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This unusual varietal wine has steely, mineral aromas and lively flavors like apricot and white peach, along with a relatively light body and lively acidity.
title: Rock Wall 2015 Fiano (Sutter County)

description: This is a ripe, tangy wine. Skin contact before and during fermentation gives an extra richness while also preserving the crisp creaminess of the grape. The extra aging has produced a ripe wine that is ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Santiago 2014 Reserva Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Lavish heaps of blackberries and cherries are accented by nuances of nuts, dried herb and black tea leaves in this composed red wine. Full bodied but balanced in acidity and fruit, it's substantial without overpowering. The finish lingers on velvety tannins.
title: Suhru 2012 Ember Red (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Bright aromas of vanilla, custard, flowers and peach lead to a creamy palate, filled with vanilla notes. The oak plays a bit too prominent of a fiddle but there are lots of good things going on.
title: Milbrandt 2014 The Estates Clifton Vineyard Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

description: While initially closed aromatically, time and aeration tease out subtle mineral, bramble and tangerine on the nose of this late-harvest Riesling. It's juicy and sweet, brightly concentrated with orange, mango and peach flavors. It might lack the intensity and penetration typical of Hermann J. Wiemer's style, but offers plenty of refreshment and vitality.
title: Hermann J. Wiemer 2014 Late Harvest Riesling (Seneca Lake)

description: Varietal Malbecs are an extreme rarity from this esteemed vineyard. This wine shows aromas of tar, plummy fruit and spice. The fruit flavors are generous yet reserved, trailing toward the finish.
title: Januik 2013 Champoux Vineyard Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: A pulsing core of dried plum and black-cherry flavors marks this buxom Petit Verdot. While bold and brawny, a balsamic edge and fine tannins lend subtlety. Its rich, mouth-filling silkiness clings pleasantly on the finish.
title: Sannino 2013 Spotlight Petit Verdot (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This wine is mostly Roussanne (58%) with the rest equal parts Marsanne and Grenache Blanc. The aromas of herb and peach are light and are followed by elegant lightly styled fruit flavors.
title: Sparkman 2014 Apparition White Wine White (Yakima Valley)

description: This is made from a field blend of Cinsault, Carignane, Grenache, Zinfandel and Viognier. Medium bodied and medium in acidity, it offers a dry, fulfilling tartness of orange, grapefruit and raspberry, remaining light and bright on the palate.
title: Spicy Vines 2015 Violet Rose Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)

description: The slightest hint of passion fruit highlights the rose-petal notes on the nose. The palate is fresh and friendly, poised with fruit and blossom and defined by a clean streak of lemon freshness that makes it both appetizing and moreish.
title: Domaine Fritz Schmitt 2015 Affenberg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: Fresh notes of juicy orange are the chief charm of this dry, fresh wine. The palate has an earthy aspect but comes with lip-smacking freshness. The finish is clean and dry.
title: Domaine Fritz Schmitt 2015 Vieilles Vignes Riesling (Alsace)

description: This is a small production wine from just about an acre of vineyard. It is attractively fruity, perfumed and with a fine balance between acidity and rich apple and pear fruits. Drink this refreshing wine now.
title: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2015 Roche Noire  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: This 100% Syrah rosé is extremely pale in color and offers dainty aromas of pink peony, cherry, strawberry hull and barely ripe peach. The pristine palate offers more of the same, with additional hints of melon rind and peach skin that lend some bitterness and texture to the finish. Well balanced and refreshing; drink now.
title: La Forge Estate 2015 Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: Earthy, minty, herbal black-fruit aromas blend with a note of grass. This wine feels plump and grabby, with hard edges. Modest but solid black-fruit flavors are toasty but short, while the finish offers blackened spice notes and grapy flavors as it dissipates.
title: La Gitana 2014 Old Vines  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Red-berry fruits and a full-bodied texture form the hallmark of this ripe wine. It has spice, a rich character that is generous and fruity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Louis Jadot 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Made with 95% Sangiovese and 5% Merlot, this has earthy aromas of dark berry, tilled soil and a whisper of violet. The straightforward, enjoyable palate offers black cherry, crushed plum and a hint of clove. Enjoy soon.
title: Lunadoro 2014 Prugnanello  (Rosso di Montepulciano)

description: Richly oaked, this full-bodied wine wraps sweet baking-spice flavors around mouthfilling ripe, plump fruit. It has a smooth texture and persistent fruit and cinnamon flavors that linger on the finish.
title: Leese-Fitch 2014 Pinot Noir (California)

description: While initially a bit smoky and closed, aeration awakens vibrant layers of citrus, white melon and peach in this zesty Grüner Veltliner. Dry with a crisp acidic backbone, it makes for a refreshing year-round apéritif. Drink now through 2018.
title: Hosmer 2015 Grüner Veltliner (Cayuga Lake)

description: Thick, honeyed apple wraps around aromas of Nilla Wafer in this full-bodied expression of the variety, perfumed with elements of peach and pear. Underlying acidity helps buoy the weight of the wine.
title: Imagery 2015 Pratt Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)

description: Part of a series that aims to express the character of a grape, this is a convincing interpretation of a fickle variety. It has red berry fruits, lit with acidity and with gentle tannins. Touches of spice from wood aging add interest without masking the fruit. Drink the wine now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Grand'Arte Pinot Noir (Lisboa)

description: Both grapes in this blend have gathered the natural freshness of the region, close to the ocean. This crisp wine is tightly textured with a ripe yellow and white fruit flavor. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 DFJ Alvarinho-Chardonnay White (Lisboa)

description: Purple flower, medicinal cherry, fudgy chocolate and some peppery heat dance in the nose of this fortified wine. The palate boasts a crushed-velvet texture and forward flavors of spiced black plum and cherry that carry through to the medium-length finish.
title: Diví Elegància NV Grenat Red (Rivesaltes)

description: Producer Jacky Gauthier has made a ripe wine that is full of black-cherry fruit. It has structure and acidity both suggesting the wine should age another few months to bring out its potential richness. Drink from 2017.
