title: Domaine de Colette 2015 Coteaux de Colette  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This nicely made, medium-bodied wine is fruity in strawberry with a hint of soy, its tannins soft, integrated and slightly expansive on the palate. Fruity, it was barrel-aged 10 months in French oak, 40% of it new and the rest neutral, allowing the grapes to speak.
title: McKahn 2014 Syrah (St. Helena)

description: All Malbec aged in neutral oak, this wine opens with pure, penetrating aromas of plum, cedar, mushroom, spice and high-toned herbs. The palate is elegant in style—almost delicate—with bright, tart fruit flavors. Will show best at the dinner table.
title: Savage Grace 2014 Côt Red Wine Dineen Vineyard Malbec (Rattlesnake Hills)

description: A youthful, light-bodied and exuberant expression of the variety, this shows raspberry, vanilla and currant flavors, with a tangy tartness of citrus on the palate. Oaky tannin comes through on the finish.
title: Camp 2015 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

description: With touches of botrytis, apricot and bitter orange flavors and perfumed sweetness, this is a textured wine that has plenty of the acidity of the year. It is ripe, still with its primary fruitiness intact. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Bélingard 2013 Réserve  (Monbazillac)

description: Made with 70% Sangiovese, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Merlot and 10% Syrah, this opens with aromas of black-skinned fruit, underbrush and baking spice. The straightforward palate delivers ripe plum, clove and a hint of rosemary alongside smooth tannins.
title: Cantine Bellini 2013 Mamb-o Dominante Red (Toscana)

description: Ripe and soft, this is a fruity wine with refreshing lemon and apple flavors. Its rich texture is balanced by good acidity—unsurprising since the grapes grow near the white wine vineyards of Meursault and Puligny-Montrachet.
title: Maison Champy 2015  Bourgogne

description: Ripe aromas of mature yellow apple and a balsamic note lead the nose along with a hint of candied lemon zest. The aromas follow over to the round, ready palate along with a note of bitter almond.
title: Marcello Turra 2015 Sassani  (Soave Classico)

description: The aromas are bright and generous, with notes of honeysuckle and canned peach. The fruit is so sweet on the palate, it drinks almost off dry, with abundant stone-fruit and floral flavors that linger.
title: Martinez & Martinez 2015 Tudor Hills Vineyard Viognier (Yakima Valley)

description: This is a smooth wine with gentle tannins and red berry fruit. It has juicy acidity and a slight toastiness from oak. With spice and acidity, it will be an attractive wine to drink from 2018.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2015  Beaune

description: Aromas of lemon, grapefruit and white flowers give way to flavors of white peach, honeydew melon and rose petal. This wine is soft in the mouth, with lingering acidity and a soft floral finish.
title: Dalton 2014 20th Anniversary Limited Edition 1/6600 White (Galilee)

description: This light-footed Sauvy is opens with attractive aromas of green melon, fresh-cut grass and lime leaf. The palate is bright and refreshing, with zippy acidity and a mouthwatering finish. Drink now.
title: Delaire Graff 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: A surprisingly accessible, fruity vintage Port for its mere three years of age, this has a touch of spirit underlying its ripe blackberry fruit and sweetness. Not from a generally declared vintage, it is already delicious and will be best from 2018.
title: Rozes 2013 Quinta do Pégo Vintage  (Port)

description: Faint scents of pressed flower and grass grace the yellow apple, green melon and lime peel core. The medium-weight palate is clean and easy, with flavors of apple and citrus that are attractive but fade quickly. Drink now.
title: Protea 2015 Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Tightly wound blueberry, black plum and barnyard aromas show on the nose of this Bordeaux blend. Presented with judicious acidity, the palate combines its fruit flavors with savory touches of smoked meat and licorice, finishing on a salted caramel note.
title: Hawk Watch Winery 2013 Meritage (South Coast)

description: Honeysuckle and jasmine punctuate the pretty aromas on the nose of this wine, which is tart and lemony on the palate. Intensely flavored, the oak is subtle and supportive.
title: Hawley 2015 Hopkins River Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: From vineyards owned by the Gagey family, this wine is ripe, easy to drink and full of fruit. Its strawberry and red cherry flavors are lifted by acidity and grounded in balancing tannins. It is made to be drunk young and will be ready from late 2017.
title: Louis Jadot 2014 Le Chapitre  (Bourgogne)

description: Golden honey and banana flambée aromas make for an inviting if quite rich introduction to this wine from Kamasutra-themed LXV. Baked apple and poached peach flavors meet with vanilla dust and salted caramel on the palate, which is rich and creamy with a balance of tension.
title: LXV 2015 Summer Satine Viognier (Paso Robles)

description: Ripe pear, melon and pineapple aromas lead the way, while the creamy-textured palate delivers more muskmelon and apricot, with a hint of ginger, suggesting a bit Viognier is in the blend. The finish is clean and refreshing. Drink now.
title: Léon Perdigal 2015 White (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Whiffs of dusty tobacco box and cedar accent roasted black-cherry and plum flavors in this light-bodied red blend. It's not a deeply concentrated wine but subtle earth and leaf complexities are elegant. The finish is marked by fine velvety tannins.
title: Hudson-Chatham 2014 Le Colonel North Creek Vineyards Red (Hudson River Region)

description: Here's an enjoyable straightforward white that offers aromas and flavors of ripe apple, peach and a hint of nectarine zest. A white almond note closes the finish.
title: I Stefanini 2015 Il Selese  (Soave)

description: This wine is brightly aromatic, with notes of fresh herb, kiwi and pineapple. The palate is full flavored, showing a sense of poise along with a tart finish. The concentration doesn't seem all there.
title: Seven Falls 2015 GPS Rosebud Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Wahluke Slope)

description: Aroma of baked plum, French oak, vanilla, coconut and espresso carry over to the densely concentrated, one-dimensional palate along with raisin, roasted coffee bean and evident alcohol. Astringent tannins leave a grippy finish.
title: Verbena 2012  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Thick, tannic and somewhat astringent, this wine blends 80% Cabernet Sauvignon with 10% Merlot, 6% Cabernet Franc and 4% Petite Sirah. Tar and tobacco flavors and a leathery mouthfeel give it a loud voice of powerful ripeness.
title: Terra Valentine 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)

description: The aromas and flavors in this blend of 55% Syrah, 24% Grenache and 21% Mourvèdre perfectly match its Wild West-inspired label: they're unabashedly smoky and pair with anything off the grill. Smoky strawberry, red plum and tanned leather notes lead to an easygoing palate of red fruit that's spiced with white pepper, roasting herbs and barbecued meat.
title: Vinum 2014 Wanted: Red Dirt Red (Paso Robles)

description: Dried apple and pear aromas meet with touches of oak, macadamia nut and wet cement on the nose of this bottling. Similar dried apple and pear flavors show on the palate, which is lifted by citrus pith and a touch of smoke on the finish.
title: Vinum 2015 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Fresh lemon and tangerine brighten slightly savory, pressed apple and pear flavors in this full-bodied Chardonnay. Zesty acidity and sharp tangy wood notes lend angularity to the midpalate and drive a brisk finish.
title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2014 Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

description: Aromas of gooseberry, guava and white peach are laced with hints of fresh-cut grass and subtle smoke. The palate offers straightforward citrus and green fruit tones, which are lifted by ample acidity and finish quickly on the brisk close. Drink now.
title: Durbanville Hills 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Durbanville)

description: 15% Alicante Bouschet gives this wine its dark color and rich, plummy texture. It has weight, ripe, bold fruit and soft tannins and is ready to drink.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Portas da Herdade Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Compost and pencil shaving scents meet reductive mushroom-like notes on the nose of this grippy, full-bodied wine that includes small amounts of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Bittersweet chocolate rounds out the finish.
title: Conn Creek 2013 Anthology Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Earthy red-berry aromas include a note of forest floor. A medium-bodied palate is centered on tight racy acidity, while this blend of Tempranillo and Cabernet Sauvignon tastes of red plum, mixed spices and cocoa powder. An edgy finish with spiced cherry and plum flavors is juicy and primed by raw acidity.
title: Enate 2012 Crianza Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Somontano)

description: This leads with bright aromas of orange blossom, just-ripe red apple and firm nectarine. The medium-weight palate offers ample acidic lift that complements the apple and citrus flavors. Though the finish is short, it's clean, and the wine is just so easy to like and drink. Enjoy now.
title: Excelsior 2016 Chardonnay (Robertson)

description: This is a second wine of Château Tournelles. Soft and generously ripe, it has attractive tannins that just give the bright fruit a support. The wine, a blend of Bordeaux grapes typical of this appellation, is ready to drink.
title: Château Tournelles 2014 Voluptabilis Red (Buzet)

description: Predominantly Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine shows a wonderful black-currant purity on the palate, along with intense, vibrant acidity. The background is all tannin, which speaks to its aging potential. This wine is the last vintage produced by Paul Pontallier, who was general manager from 1990 until his death in 2016. It's a memorable wine and one for aging. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Margaux 2015  Margaux

description: This magnificent wine brings together the great fruit of the vintage with a complex structure. The acidity, ripe tannins and the power of this dense wine are enormous, as is its aging potential. With that acidity and tannic structure, and with the perfumes from the Cabernet Franc, this wine will evolve slowly and with a measured pace. Drink from 2028.
title: Château Ausone 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: Made with 45% Cabernet Franc, this great wine offers a beautiful, rich and perfumed character. This is an exceptional vintage for this estate which incorporated into the blend fruit from parcels of the vineyard that would normally go into the second wine. It is packed with black-fruit flavors and broad tannins, with a background of juicy acidity and a firm structure. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Cheval Blanc 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: This is a great vintage from Lafite. The profile is rich in feel, with a seriously firm tannic structure. Solid, complex and with great authority, this Cabernet Sauvignon-dominant wine, is impressively dense in dark-fruit tones. It will age for many years. Drink from 2027, although that would almost be too soon.
title: Château Lafite Rothschild 2015  Pauillac

description: This is like drinking liquid black currants and blackberries. The wine has great intensity and richness from the superbly generous Merlot. The wood aging is still there as a hint in the background although the fruit and acidity dominate. Drink from 2026.
title: Château Pétrus 2015  Pomerol

description: This wine that comes mainly from a magnificent walled vineyard within sight of the Gironde estuary is structured and dense. Its tannins and firm character show its enormous aging potential. Powerful black fruits come from the 85% Cabernet Sauvignon in this rich, juicy wine. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Léoville Las Cases 2015  Saint-Julien

description: Generous, rich and powerful, this is a sumptuous wine. With just a slight preponderance of Cabernet Sauvignon, it has structure as well as clean, clear black-currant flavors. Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, it delivers an explosion of fruit as well as serious tannins. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Palmer 2015  Margaux

description: This is a hugely opulent wine, packed withblack fruits, rich tannins and great concentration. It is a gorgeous wine that's full of potential, with the dense, dark core showing how well this wine will age. Drink this complex wine from 2027.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2015  Pauillac

description: Among the Napa Valley's most crowning achievements in Cabernet, this vintage of Hillside Select is stunning, bright and beguiling in every way. Intensely layered, its interwoven flavors burst in black licorice, dark chocolate, pipe tobacco, gun smoke and garrigue. Spicy oak adds to the power and weight. Drinkable now, it will show even greater finesse in time; enjoy best 2023–2033 and possibly beyond.
title: Shafer 2013 Hillside Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: Since the first vintage in 1991, this wine and its vineyard have travelled far. Now close to the top of the classification tree in Saint-Émilion, this vintage shows the impressive nature of this powerful wine. With a good balance between acidity and black fruits backed up by tannins, the wine is powerful and stylish. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Valandraud 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: This quinta was created by the legendary Dona Antonia Ferreira in the 19th century and it is still owned by her descendants. While currently quite youthful, there is greatness in this wine. Its density of minerality, black fruits and rich tannins create a wine with huge aging potential. It's rich while always elegant, balanced and ready for a long life. Drink from 2025.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2015 Red (Douro)

description: Intoxicating scents of smoke, flint, dried mountain herb and woodland berry are just some of the multifaceted aromas you'll find on this dazzling Nebbiolo. It's extremely elegant, with a weightless intensity, delivering Marasca cherry, crushed strawberry, white pepper and tobacco framed in fine tannins. Vibrant acidity gives it impeccable balance while a flinty mineral vein energizes the finish. Some may find this almost too ethereal while lovers of finesse, complexity and balance will be enchanted. Drink through 2027.
title: Arpepe 2007 Sassella Riserva Rocce Rosse  (Valtellina Superiore)

description: Dominated by the two Cabernets—Sauvignon and Franc—this is a beautifully structured wine. Firm tannins and ripe black currants give a perfumed character that is ripe, dense and impressive. The wine has enormous potential, with great tannins and fruit. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Figeac 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: Almost entirely Cabernet Franc, this single-vineyard wine has a wonderful perfumed character. Firm tannins are fully integrated into the fruit, giving a structured yet balanced feel. Ripe and elegant, it will age well. Drink from 2027.
title: JCP Maltus 2015 Le Dôme  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Direct and concentrated, this wine is powered by tannins and a firm texture. Dense, it has the potential for plenty of fruit as it matures. That will take time, because this impressive wine is powered by its structure. Wait until 2028.
title: Château Haut-Brion 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: Now at 58 acres, this is a large vineyard for Saint-Émilion. Intense tannins and a powerful structure are the hallmarks of this concentrated wine. At the same time, it has great acidity and elegant black fruits. Together, this is a dense, rich wine with a long-term future. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Bélair-Monange 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: The tannins in this fine vintage of Latour are still enormous, dominating the black currant fruit. It has spice, tannins, impressive fruit and a pure, cool character. To be released in the mid-2020s, the wine is likely to age for many years. Enjoy from 2027.
title: Château Latour 2014  Pauillac

description: This wine is structured, powerful and ripe but also elegant and stylish. Juicy black fruits combine with a dry, structured core to give the wine both its richness and its future. Powered by its fruit and tannins, it has good aging potential. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Angélus 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: With its 90% Cabernet Sauvignon, the wine has super-ripe black-currant flavors encased in firm, smoky tannins and hints of wood. Showing the opulence of the vintage and the style of Saint-Julien, it will age for many years. The wine will certainly not be ready before 2026.
title: Château Ducru Beaucaillou 2015  Saint-Julien

description: Always one of the great white wines of the world, this vintage continues that reputation. With its richness, density and layers of fruit and acidity, this wine is powerful and beautifully ripe. The wood aging is just a hint in background. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Haut-Brion 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: Succulent fruits, rich tannins and juicy acidity are in perfect harmony in this wine produced from biodynamic grapes. It has a rich, velvet texture and dense structure, sumptuous and already balanced and delicious. However do not be fooled, this is a serious wine for aging. Drink no earlier than 2026.
title: Château Pontet-Canet 2015  Pauillac

description: It's always a cliché to compare wine to the nectar of the gods but there's little that comes closer than this. It's decadently sweet, offering layer upon layer of unctuous honey and stone-fruit nectar, yet exhilarating, fine and filigreed. The finish is endless and breathtaking. Delicious now but will hold for decades to come.
title: Robert Weil 2016 Kiedrich Gräfenberg Trockenbeerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Starting with the 2008 vintage, the firm's flagship bottling is now made without added dosage. It opens with aromas of yellow stone fruit, brioche and crushed stone that carry over to the elegantly structured palate, along with tangy tangerine and bright acidity. A refined perlage gives it a weightless concentration while a savory mineral note lingers on the bone-dry finish. In a word, it's gorgeous.
title: Ca' del Bosco 2008 Annamaria Clementi Dosage Zero Riserva  (Franciacorta)

description: Although this wine is ripe, it is the fruit that sings. Firm and rich, the tannins support the wonderful fruitiness. Its perfumed Cabernets give the wine great presence as well as freshness. It is ready for long aging. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Pavie 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine is rich with tannins and superb fruit. The blackberries and black plums are succulent and chewy, giving the wine an opulent, ripe character. This 18-acre vineyard, with 93% Merlot, has produced an impressive wine. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Trotanoy 2015  Pomerol

description: This wine is packed with ripe black fruit and structured by a dense, mineral texture. Generous fruit tones and plenty of tannic grip translate to a wine worthy of the cellar. Drink from 2025.
title: JCP Maltus 2015 Les Astéries  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This dense, rich wine is firm with solid tannins. Its texture and structure give it an opulent character that brings out tannins as much as the ripe black fruits. Powerful and concentrated it needs time to get its potential elegance in order. Then it will be a major wine, so it's worth waiting until 2027.
title: Château Calon Ségur 2015  Saint-Estèphe

description: This wine, rich and opulent, defines the terroir of this estate. It has a rich, dense character, powerful and concentrated. The juicy black fruits enhance the impression of generosity as well as concentration. Drink from 2027.
title: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is dense in expressive, dark fruit and solid tannins which give it a rich, enveloping feel. With its spicy score and crisp acidity, there is great potential for aging. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: If any wine from the Douro has a Bordeaux influence, it is this wine. Produced as part of a joint venture between the Prats family of Bordeaux and the Symington family of the Douro, this wine shows great attention to tannins and structure while allowing the black fruits to shine. It is a stylish wine, powerful while wearing that power lightly. Drink this wine, from a very good year, from 2022.
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2015 Chryseia Red (Douro)

description: Vineyard-designated wines from this appellation are rare, and this wine shows the promise of this site. There's no mistaking the variety, with its enchanting aromas of fragrant flower, smoked meat, chopped parsley, green olive and purple fruit. Flavors are supremely fresh and bright, showing a mixture of fruit and savory, with assorted herb notes intertwined throughout. An extended finish, filled with notes of olive, caps it off. It's beautiful on its own but should sing at the dinner table. Give it time to open up.
title: Kerloo 2015 Limited Release Upland Vineyard Syrah (Snipes Mountain)

description: You'll find enticing aromas of black-skinned berry, graphite and Mediterranean brush on this blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 40% Syrah and 10% Teroldego. On the intense palate, notes of tobacco, black pepper and a touch of cocoa add depth to a core of black currant. Velvety tannins provide elegant support. Enjoy through 2026.
title: Michele Satta 2013 I Castagni  (Bolgheri Superiore)

description: Aromas of red berry, dark culinary spice, wild mint and a whiff of new leather are textbook mountain Nebbiolo. The savory racy palate is loaded with finesse, delivering crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry, star anise and tobacco set against taut ultrafine tannins. A mineral note closes the finish while vibrant acidity gives it energy and balance.
title: Nera 2010 Sassella Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)

description: There's impressive aromatic depth to the nose of this winery's top-tier bottling, with black cherry, olive, wisteria, wet wood, juniper and bay leaf all present. These elements converge on the sip, where black plum, light licorice and loamy earth flavors are enhanced by hints of truffle, nutmeg and vanilla. The tannic texture is upright yet not sticky or in the way.
title: Pear Valley 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: A rich and dense wine, this is powered both by tannins and by wonderful ripe fruits. Its black fruit, firm tannins and concentration are sustained by the mineral texture from the schist (Xisto) soil. The vineyard, owned by João Nicolau de Almeida, one of the pioneers of red wine making in the Douro, is in the Douro Superior region in the east of the Douro. Drink this wine from 2021.
title: Quinta do Monte Xisto 2015 Red (Douro)

description: Made from organically grown grapes, this wine comes from the plateau north of the Douro river itself. It is a limited-edition wine, rich and tannic at this stage. Alongside all this structure, the wine also has ripe black fruits that are about to burst out, juicy, rich and with final acidity. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2014 Síbio Red (Douro)

description: This thoroughly delicious wine offers a lush mix of raspberry compote, cherry pie and a touch of lemon curd. The tannins are supple and generous, and the wine glides effortlessly through a yummy midpalate and on into a satisfying finish with a lick of buttery caramel.
title: Styring 2014 Signature Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: Winemaker Dominic O'Reilly worked for years under Ojai Vineyard Syrah master Adam Tolmach, so it makes sense that his take on this historic property would be so excellent. Aromas of deep black plum fruit are cut by game, tar and wild herbs. The palate shows fresh purple fruit and violets alongside cracked pepper, held up by a strong tannic backbone.
title: Topa Mountain Winery 2014 Bien Nacido Vineyard Reserve Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Made with Chardonnay and Pinot Nero, this offers delicate scents of wildflowers, orchard fruit and a whiff of baking spice. Racy, linear and refreshing, the crisp dry palate delivers Rennet apple, nectarine and a hint of ginger, while a graphite note adds depth. It's elegant, with small, continuous bubbles.
title: Villa Crespia NV Brolese Extra Brut Rosé  (Franciacorta)

description: Distinct tones of cherry pit and cinnamon-clove define the aromatics of this wine. It's a relatively full-bodied style of the variety from the east side of the appellation. Succulent and fleshy, it offers an array of salty, savory notes and is appealing in its velvety texture and roundness. Cola, warm baking spices and orange peel add to the complexity.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Lewis MacGregor Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine explores the gamy, cool-climate side of Syrah, sourced from the winery's estate vineyard just outside of the Santa Lucia Highlands. Roasted coffee, burnt toast, charred lamb, powdered cocoa and elderberry jam show on the nose, while a gamy flavor comes through even stronger on the firmly structured palate.
title: Wrath 2015 San Saba Vineyard Syrah (Monterey)

description: Those who like their Pinot on the savory and earthy side will enjoy this wine. Leading with the aroma of charred, salted meat, notes of bright red fruits and herbal bitters quickly follow along. The light-bodied palate is beautifully composed, offering a wealth of fruit and floral flavors, and a long, savory finish. Drink now–2025.
title: Dalrymple 2014 Pipers River Cottage Block Pinot Noir (Tasmania)

description: From a consistently great producer, the 2015 Pipers River offers a wealth of aromas: sunbaked earth, dried leaves, sea spray, cocoa nibs and just-picked forest fruit. The palate is light and elegant, with soft but structured tannins and a cinnamon spice tone. It's totally approachable now but could age another five to seven years if you can bear to wait that long. Drink 2023–2025.
title: Dalrymple 2015 Pipers River Pinot Noir (Tasmania)

description: Lifted, succulent tones of mango, peach and melon abound in this lip-smacking yet complex auslese. It's boldly concentrated in fruit but exceptionally fine and filigreed on the palate and shaded by nuances of crushed slate, blossom and salt. The finish is piercing and long marked by spine tingling lime acidity.
title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Müller-Burggraef) 2016 Berncasteler Lay Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Plumes of smoke and dark earth intensify tonic, lime and salty mineral notes in this nimble-footed auslese. It's a bracing, revitalizing wine, balanced by sweet-tart yellow peach and tangerine flavors that pierce through a long, nervous finish.
title: Günther Steinmetz 2016 Kestener Paulinsberg Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Vanilla, sea salt, red berries, florals, smoke and orange zest all swirl together in this silky smooth Pinot. The palate is simultaneously salty and tangy, with flavors of sea spray and dried cranberries and raspberries.
title: Holm Oak 2015 Pinot Noir (Tasmania)

description: This wine is a riot of strawberry preserves on the nose, while the palate is full bodied and detailed. It comes with a touch of lemon custard, hints of barrel toast, and an elegant texture.
title: J. Christopher 2015 Abbey Ridge Vineyard Unfiltered Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Pretty cherry candy flavors hold your attention here, balanced with perfectly ripened tannins. There's a light wash of milk chocolate and it finishes with cinnamon spice. In a stellar lineup of single-vineyard selections, the Shea is always surefire.
title: Ken Wright 2015 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: Layers of sweet, sun-kissed honeydew, grapefruit and tangerine flood the palate of this forward yet nuanced wine. There's a delightful cling of honey and nectar on the midpalate but it's counterbalanced neatly by strikes of lemon-lime acidity and an earthen minerality that lingers long on the finish. Drinks beautifully already but should improve further through 2035.
title: Maximin Grünhäuser 2016 Herrenberg Spätlese Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: Derived from an assortment of Dundee Hills vineyards, this pays tribute to the Jory soils of the AVA. Strong mineral accents keep a tight focus on brambly cherry flavors. The barrel aging, which was minimal given the wine's early release, adds just a touch of caramel.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Volcanic Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Across the river from the small town of Pinhão and some of the finest Port vineyards, this estate is well situated. This wine comes from 100-year-old vines and boasts great concentration and richness. It is dense and full of black fruits, ripe from a fine year in the Douro. It will age well; drink after 2021.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2015 Carvalhas Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: This wine comes from an estate owned by the Amorim cork family. Powerful, perfumed tannins and dense texture from the old-vine Touriga Nacional give a rich character to the wine. Big, bold red fruits are laced with acidity and packed with concentration. Drink this wine from 2021.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2015 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: This quinta, named after its cypress trees, has produced a firm and structured wine in this vintage. Tannins and a dry core give a great possibility for aging. It is rich and the black fruits will come through the structure. Drink this wine from 2021.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2013 Quinta dos Aciprestes Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: While lithe and lean in style, this dry Riesling builds in mineral intensity on the palate. Lime, lemon and green apple flavors are vivaciously fresh, fringed by hints of candlewax and blossom. The finish is long, steely and linear.
title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2016 Scharzhofberger Trocken GG Riesling (Mosel)

description: Roasted aromas of wet campfire, black pepper and roasted lamb crust meet with a pickled boysenberry scent on the nose of this bottling, the first time that this winery has made two estate Syrahs. (Hillside is the other.) The palate shows a strong lift from tarragon and mint, but the gamy quality is powerful as well as is the spice, with Szechuan peppercorn and kung pao beef flavors.
title: Stolo 2015 Creekside Estate Syrah (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Mossy forest floor, pine needle, juniper and black pepper aromas show against a backdrop of elderberry on the extremely compelling nose of this bottling by Ernst Storm from a vineyard to the northwest of the Sta. Rita Hills. The palate shows much more of that foresty spice, as well as tapenade, wild berries, bay leaf and thyme.
title: Storm 2015 Duvarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: In most years, Alabaster blows you away with its power, concentration and depth of flavors. In 2014, a mediocre year in much of Northern Spain, this is still excellent. Blackberry, cassis and creosote aromas are toasty, while this is flush in feel and severely tannic. Blackberry, mocha and coffee flavors finish with creamy oak and chocolate notes along with meaty tannins. Only 100 cases produced; drink through 2030.
title: Teso La Monja 2014 Alabaster  (Toro)

description: Very pure notes of red cherry fill the nose. The same pure fruit is framed by bright, luminous freshness on the palate, which echoes in flavors of cherry, pepper and licorice. An aromatic, fresh and vivid Pinot made with a light touch.
title: Trimbach 2015 Personnelle Réserve Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Light in color, this wine offers beguiling aromas with notes of fire pit, flower, stem, potpourri, black raspberry and smoked meat. Ethereally light and enchanting, it's texturally rich and flavorful, with a warm finish—a delicious example of this site and variety.
title: Two Vintners 2015 Claire Boushey Vineyard Grenache (Yakima Valley)

description: Beautifully inviting in aromas of caramelized biscuit, vanilla wafer and baked apple, this is a creamy and lush white wine, full bodied and highly ripe in style. A lovely hit of tangerine-laced acidity keeps it fresh and fleshy.
title: V. Sattui 2015 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Alluring aromas of bread crust, nectarine zest, berry and orchard fruit take center stage on this compelling sparkler. Made entirely with Pinot Nero, it's all about elegance, offering wild cherry, brioche, citrus and mineral alongside fresh acidity and tangy acidity. An ultrarefined perlage carries through to the dry succulent finish.
title: Ca' del Bosco 2008 Vintage Collection Dosaggio Zéro Noir  (Franciacorta)

description: This is a perfumed wine, rich in tannins and with a good balance between the Merlot and Cabernet Franc in the blend. Ripe black fruits and velvet tannins give the wine elegance and charm. It is juicy and ripe, with a background of firm structure set against a crisp final texture. The wine will develop well; drink from 2025.
title: Château La Conseillante 2015  Pomerol

description: Solid tannins mark this still very young wine. At the same time, the fruit is rich and well proportioned. Black currants dominate the fruity spectrum, giving the wine richness as well as great potential. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Latour-Martillac 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: Densely tannic, this wine displays considerable power and concentration. With 84% Merlot it exhibits jammy, rich black-plum and blackberry fruit and powerful tannins. This is an enormous wine, still very firm. Drink from 2026.
title: Château l'Évangile 2015  Pomerol

description: Enticing scents of scorched earth, cassis, new leather, vanilla, truffle and Mediterranean brush abound on this classy red. The full-bodied youthfully austere palate is still tightly wound but already shows mature black cherry, raspberry preserve, licorice and grilled herb set against a backbone of firm fine-grained tannins. Give it time to fully develop. Drink 2022–2030.
title: Campo alle Comete 2015  Bolgheri Superiore

description: Densely structured and firm, this wine has weight, rich black fruits and great concentration. The tannins are still considerable, with obvious potential. This estate is now on top form. Drink this impressive wine from 2026.
title: Château Clerc Milon 2015  Pauillac

description: The tannins and richness that are a part of this vintage in Pomerol are very present in this wine. It is dense, packed with dry, firm tannins. At the same time, the fruit is rich with berries and black currants, showing the potential balance of this concentrated wine. Drink from 2026.
title: Château Latour à Pomerol 2015  Pomerol

description: Smoothly textured, this fruity wine offers acidity and ripe apricot flavors. The zesty, mineral texture will allow it to develop well, promising of great fruit and texture in the future. Wait until 2024.
title: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: This powerful wine has great structure, fine and elegant tannins, and ripe black fruits. It wears its heart on its sleeve. The concentration doesn't take away from the juicy fruit and wealth of complex flavors. A wine with a great future, it won't be ready to drink before 2026.
title: JCP Maltus 2015 Vieux Château Mazerat  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Perhaps the best vintage of Compostella to date, the 2015 vintage is a blend of 40% Cabernet Franc, 32% Cabernet Sauvignon, 13% Merlot, 11% Petit Verdot and 4% Malbec. It showcases a beautiful elegance and herbal edge in waves of cigar tobacco and blackcurrant leaf, with a grounded fruit core of blackberry, plum and cassis. Additional notes of leather and German chocolate cake lend depth and intrigue, while the finish exhibits a masterful evolution between all these components with each sip. Well-structured and superbly balanced, it boasts gripping tannins and ample acidity to frame the ripe fruit. A beauty that should mature masterfully, drink 2023–2033.
title: Mvemve Raats 2015 MR de Compostella Red (Stellenbosch)

description: Justina is the top wine for this estate, a mellifluous melding of berries and cherries, with a hint of peach. The acids are ample but never intrusive, and bring a rather delicate flavor of lemon oil. Exemplary in every way, this is drinking beautifully but may be cellared for up to a decade.
title: Alloro 2015 Justina Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: You'll find aromas of ripe berry, exotic spice, scorched earth, violet and balsamic notes on this generous fragrant red. The structured savory palate delivers crushed raspberry, succulent red cherry, star anise and tobacco alongside decisive but refined tannins. It's balanced, with fresh acidity.
title: Arpepe 2009 Sassella Ultimi Raggi  (Valtellina Superiore)

description: Already with a wonderful old-gold color, this aromatic wine with its fruit, acidity and touch of spirit is bone dry, but presents a rich texture. The typical intense acidity is right there as well as lemon peel, wood, spice and concentration. This wine, aged in wood and bottled in 2017, is ready to drink.
title: Blandy's 2000 Colheita Single Harvest Verdelho (Madeira)

description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this full-bodied red opens with aromas of wild berry, exotic spice, aromatic herb and a whiff  of fragrant blue flower. It's elegant and structured, with a youthful tension that underscores juicy wild cherry, raspberry compote, cinnamon and a hint of pipe tobacco. Fresh acidity lends balance while fine-grained tannins provide polished support. It's already tempting but will develop even more complexity with cellaring. Drink 2018–2033.
title: Boscarelli 2013 Il Nocio  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: The firm tannins in this wine are dense and concentrated, ripe rather than dry. The fruit and juicy acidity give the wine richness and crispness at the same time. It has a great future. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Carbonnieux 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is a little austere, while showing good aging potential. It has spice, acidity and the weight of fruit as it develops. With its juicy berry flavors still submerged by the firm tannins, it will take its time. Wait to drink until 2025.
title: Château de Fieuzal 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is dense with superripe tannins. It has rich black-plum and berry fruits along with an opulent texture typical of this wine in good vintages. Along with its power, the wine has great acidity to keep the aftertaste crisp and fruity. Drink from 2024.
title: JCP Maltus 2015 Le Carré  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Jim Barry's top wine and one of Clare Valley's most renowned, the 2012 doesn't disappoint. Enchanting, complex aromas of purple beets, mocha, strawberry leaf, raspberries, figs and dates continue on the palate, all cloaked in savory, powdery tannins and a structure that sets it up for many years of aging. Drink 2019–2037.
title: Jim Barry 2012 The Armagh Shiraz (Clare Valley)

description: This is one of the top vineyard selections in this vintage, among a select group, notable for its outstanding focus and concentration. Still compact, its purple fruits are lightly spiced and deftly balanced; leaving little doubt that further improvement is just around the corner. Drink now through 2035.
title: Ken Wright 2015 McCrone Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: The nose is intense and heady, combining unlikely but harmonized elements of white currant, fresh white mushroom, honey, pear and lemon zest. The palate then majors on fresh, pure and fluid pear juiciness. There is a textural element and overtones of beeswax reinforced by more lemon zestiness. A very complex, very alive and facinating wine. This is mouthfilling, long and intense, utterly full-flavored but resolutely dry.
title: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2013 Harmonie R White (Alsace)

description: This particular block selection is focused upon old-vine Pommard grapes, and the result is a layered and deeply focused wine that continually evolves once poured. It's a delicate explosion of textures and flavors, berry and cherry, wet stone, cola and caramel. Though it will surely age beautifully over a decade or longer, if you give it ample aeration and attention, it drinks quite nicely already.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Durant Vineyard Bishop Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: The vineyard cannot be disclosed, but there's nothing mysterious about the flavor, which pins the meter on the yum factor. Juicy huckleberry flavors come wrapped in mineral-drenched acids. Made from 100% Pommard grapes, this marries Old World complexity to pretty purple fruits. As with many Patricia Green wines, the oak aging is a minor player, while the ripe fruits and individual terroirs are expressed in riveting fashion.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Mysterious Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Wet river rocks and mineral oil juxtapose zesty tangerine, pomelo and grapefruit in this lavish yet composed dry Riesling. It's clingy and plush in mouthfeel yet vibrantly balanced in acidity, with an unctuous and rippling finish. It's stunning already for its youthful fruit and electric acidity, but sure to improve further through 2035.
title: Robert Weil 2016 Kiedrich Gräfenberg Trocken GG Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Dried sagebursh, wild cherries, rose petals and baked soil aromas make for a compelling blend of savory and sweet on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard on the eastern side of the appellation. A chalky texture and front-to-back acidity presents flavors of ripe boysenberry and black raspberry as well as clove, black pepper and other intriguingly dark spices.
title: Storm 2015 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Long associated with the Graham's name, this quinta makes impressive Ports. This hugely tannic and equally hugely fruity Port has a dry backbone as well as potentially rich black fruits. Acidity and a dry edge give structure to this dense wine. Drink from 2028.
title: W. & J. Graham's 2015 Quinta dos Malvedos Vintage  (Port)

description: Truffle, flint and wild berry aromas mingle with pipe tobacco and a whiff of new leather on this radiant red. On the savory precise palate, licorice and white pepper underscore a juicy core of red cherry and cranberry alongside a flinty mineral vein. Polished tannins and fresh acidity provide impeccable balance. Drink through 2032.
title: Arpepe 2012 Sassella Stella Retica  (Valtellina)

description: Fresh Asian pear, lemon blossoms and honeysuckle make for an enjoyable nose on this bottling from a very coastally influenced vineyard just east of Santa Maria. The acidity on the palate is super racy and vibrant, carrying flavors of chalk and lime pith that sizzle long and deep.
title: Whitcraft 2016 Presqu'ile Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Spice, toastiness and tight acidity mark this young wine. It is edgy at the moment, dominated by a strong minerality that will soften with age. This promises to be a rich, concentrated wine as it matures. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Bouscaut 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: Big tannins and superripe fruit give this wine its powerful character. Acidity, black fruits and a rich structure add to the sense of power. The wine is rich, showing lush fruits as well as the tannin. It needs some serious aging. Drink from 2027.
title: Château la Fleur-Pétrus 2015  Pomerol

description: Deliciously aromatic, this wine is tight and structured but holds great promise. Acidity and citrus flavors balance with the perfumed character of the richer fruits and the touch of wood from the barrel aging. Drink this structured wine from 2023.
title: Château Latour-Martillac 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is a riot of strawberry preserves on the nose, while the palate is full bodied and detailed. It comes with a touch of lemon custard, hints of barrel toast, and an elegant texture.
title: J. Christopher 2015 Abbey Ridge Vineyard Unfiltered Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Pretty cherry candy flavors hold your attention here, balanced with perfectly ripened tannins. There's a light wash of milk chocolate and it finishes with cinnamon spice. In a stellar lineup of single-vineyard selections, the Shea is always surefire.
title: Ken Wright 2015 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: Layers of sweet, sun-kissed honeydew, grapefruit and tangerine flood the palate of this forward yet nuanced wine. There's a delightful cling of honey and nectar on the midpalate but it's counterbalanced neatly by strikes of lemon-lime acidity and an earthen minerality that lingers long on the finish. Drinks beautifully already but should improve further through 2035.
title: Maximin Grünhäuser 2016 Herrenberg Spätlese Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: Derived from an assortment of Dundee Hills vineyards, this pays tribute to the Jory soils of the AVA. Strong mineral accents keep a tight focus on brambly cherry flavors. The barrel aging, which was minimal given the wine's early release, adds just a touch of caramel.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Volcanic Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Across the river from the small town of Pinhão and some of the finest Port vineyards, this estate is well situated. This wine comes from 100-year-old vines and boasts great concentration and richness. It is dense and full of black fruits, ripe from a fine year in the Douro. It will age well; drink after 2021.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2015 Carvalhas Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: This wine comes from an estate owned by the Amorim cork family. Powerful, perfumed tannins and dense texture from the old-vine Touriga Nacional give a rich character to the wine. Big, bold red fruits are laced with acidity and packed with concentration. Drink this wine from 2021.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2015 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: This quinta, named after its cypress trees, has produced a firm and structured wine in this vintage. Tannins and a dry core give a great possibility for aging. It is rich and the black fruits will come through the structure. Drink this wine from 2021.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2013 Quinta dos Aciprestes Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: While lithe and lean in style, this dry Riesling builds in mineral intensity on the palate. Lime, lemon and green apple flavors are vivaciously fresh, fringed by hints of candlewax and blossom. The finish is long, steely and linear.
title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2016 Scharzhofberger Trocken GG Riesling (Mosel)

description: Roasted aromas of wet campfire, black pepper and roasted lamb crust meet with a pickled boysenberry scent on the nose of this bottling, the first time that this winery has made two estate Syrahs. (Hillside is the other.) The palate shows a strong lift from tarragon and mint, but the gamy quality is powerful as well as is the spice, with Szechuan peppercorn and kung pao beef flavors.
title: Stolo 2015 Creekside Estate Syrah (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Mossy forest floor, pine needle, juniper and black pepper aromas show against a backdrop of elderberry on the extremely compelling nose of this bottling by Ernst Storm from a vineyard to the northwest of the Sta. Rita Hills. The palate shows much more of that foresty spice, as well as tapenade, wild berries, bay leaf and thyme.
title: Storm 2015 Duvarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: In most years, Alabaster blows you away with its power, concentration and depth of flavors. In 2014, a mediocre year in much of Northern Spain, this is still excellent. Blackberry, cassis and creosote aromas are toasty, while this is flush in feel and severely tannic. Blackberry, mocha and coffee flavors finish with creamy oak and chocolate notes along with meaty tannins. Only 100 cases produced; drink through 2030.
title: Teso La Monja 2014 Alabaster  (Toro)

description: Very pure notes of red cherry fill the nose. The same pure fruit is framed by bright, luminous freshness on the palate, which echoes in flavors of cherry, pepper and licorice. An aromatic, fresh and vivid Pinot made with a light touch.
title: Trimbach 2015 Personnelle Réserve Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Light in color, this wine offers beguiling aromas with notes of fire pit, flower, stem, potpourri, black raspberry and smoked meat. Ethereally light and enchanting, it's texturally rich and flavorful, with a warm finish—a delicious example of this site and variety.
title: Two Vintners 2015 Claire Boushey Vineyard Grenache (Yakima Valley)

description: Beautifully inviting in aromas of caramelized biscuit, vanilla wafer and baked apple, this is a creamy and lush white wine, full bodied and highly ripe in style. A lovely hit of tangerine-laced acidity keeps it fresh and fleshy.
title: V. Sattui 2015 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Drake Whitcraft is becoming a master at weaving a wide array of sensory experiences into very light wines. This starts with candied pomegranate, fennel bulb and cracked white pepper on the nose, then hits the palate with bright snappy red fruits, heavy peppery spice and a penetratingly bright acid profile. It goes down easy, but with complexity.
title: Whitcraft 2016 Stolpman Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

description: This is a blockbuster wine, full bodied and ripe, yet able to hold its considerable power in check. Its well-integrated oak and sizable structure give it weight and breadth, as well as age-worthy intrigue. Red currant, cedar and cigar box mark the flavor profile. Enjoy best 2024–2034.
title: Whitehall Lane 2014 Millennium MM Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: Winemaker Sabrine Rodems manages to tame the richness of this vineyard while retaining its hedonistic joy. Aromas of rose, pomegranate, hibiscus, rhubarb and dark spice lead into pillowy flavors of strawberry, raspberry and clove. This wine feels light and racy yet full of body and flavor.
title: Wrath 2015 Boekenoogen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A blend of 85% Chardonnay and 15% Pinot Nero, this offers enticing scents of brioche and yellow stone fruit. The elegant, focused palate delivers golden apple, bread crust, pomegranate and a mineral note alongside a refined perlage and vibrant acidity.
title: Fratelli Berlucchi 2013 Freccianera Nature  (Franciacorta)

description: Tangy, savory and elegant, this bright, silky sparkler offers inviting aromas and flavors of Golden Delicious apple, tangy tangerine drop, white peach, mineral and herb. A creamy mousse lends even more finesse while cream-filled brioche lingers on the finish.
title: Bonfadini NV Carpe Diem Satèn  (Franciacorta)

description: Packed with the fruit of the vintage, this wine is bright and crisp. Its acidity and pure black-currant flavors are delicious, juicy, the tannins now sitting easily in the background. The wine, which comes from a specific parcel, is developing well and will be released after 2020. It should be drunk from 2023.
title: Château Latour 2014 Les Forts de Latour  (Pauillac)

description: The wine, with its rich tannins and fruit, comes from this impressively restored estate run by the Mau family. Already packed with black fruits and juicy acidity, it has the structure and concentration to age well. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Preuillac 2015  Médoc

description: Paso Robles winemaker Tyler Russell applies that region's rich style to Sta. Rita Hills fruit for massive effect, great for lovers of ripeness and density. Aromas of baked vanilla cake, black cherry, loamy soil and star anise leap from the glass. Then the palate delivers loads of blackberry compote, licorice and clove, letting it all hang out yet bolstered by bright acidity and firm lavish tannins.
title: Cordant 2015 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Pomegranate, carnation, dried cranberry, potpourri, baked earth and vanilla cookie all come to the fore on the nose of this light but expressive wine from the historic vineyard. Stewed red cherry and cranberry arise on the palate alongside thyme, peppercorn and the slightest hint of game.
title: Dolin 2013 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This deep violet-red colored wine has a nose of cassis, lavender and anise. It is surprisingly soft on first sip, with tannins that gradually increase in power while showcasing flavors of black cherry, dark plum, cranberry, fennel bulb and a touch of mint. The slightly grippy finish offers pronounced notes of cherry and orange zest.
title: Hayotzer 2014 Winemaker's Choice Virtuoso Cabernet Sauvignon (Galilee)

description: This flagship bottling is still a whopper of a wine. This vintage, a blend of 73% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Cabernet Franc and 12% Merlot, offers barely ripe black cherry, green peppercorn and charred fennel on the nose. The palate is loaded with both savory and ripe flavors, from roasted black plums and charred beef to oregano and dill. Very complex and chalky in texture.
title: Justin 2014 Isosceles Red (Paso Robles)

description: Firm and focused, this young wine has miles to go. It opens with bright raspberry and cherry fruit, then puts on bulk in the midpalate, adding lovely orange-peel highlights. Drinking well this young, it has the structure and depth to add many more layers over the next decade or longer. Drink now through 2030 and beyond.
title: Ken Wright 2015 Abbott Claim Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: There is a certain high-toned intensity to many of Ken Wright's 2015s, which amps up the young fruit. Here the dominant flavors are ripe strawberry, vivid and layered against firm ripe tannins. There's a touch of coffee and dark chocolate running through the finish. For reasons unknown, this new cuvée bears the old Ken Wright label design.
title: Ken Wright 2015 Hirschy Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: This radiant savory mountain Nebbiolo opens with enticing scents of wild berry, flint, smoke and a whiff of alpine herb. It's elegant and focused, delivering crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry, tobacco and star anise alongside taut refined tannins and bright acidity. It's already tempting but will develop even more complexity over the next several years or more. Drink 2020–2032.
title: La Perla Marco Triacca 2012 La Mossa  (Valtellina Superiore)

description: Enticing scents of yellow stone fruit, acacia and brioche show this wine's Chardonnay pedigree. A refined beading and tangy acidity lend elegance and balance to flavors of creamy yellow pear, apple and lemon. A hint of fennel graces the finish.
title: Le Marchesine 2009 Secolo Novo Riserva Dosage Zero  (Franciacorta)

description: Concentrated tangerine and candied lemon-peel flavors are juxtaposed by complexities of savory earth and smoked nuts. While off dry and sprightly, there's a lusciousness that builds on the midpalate that extends into a long, lavishly fruity finish.
title: Maximin Grünhäuser 2016 Abtsberg Superior Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: This huge, dense and firmly structured bottling absolutely begs for time in the cellar to allow the primary characteristics to mellow and greater elegance and nuance to unfold. Currently, it's an absolute bruiser, with boatloads of plush, ripe black berry and plum characteristics that are coupled with seductive notes of campfire, vanilla bean, Thin Mint, woodspice and licorice root. The assertive tannins produce a bold, extremely firm texture that is in equal measure to the superbly rich and concentrated fruit. Secondary notes of pencil shavings, violets, pipe tobacco and char unfold beneath the fruit, and suggest even further evolution and grace to come with time. Drink 2026–2038.
title: De Toren 2015 Book 17 XVII Red (Stellenbosch)

description: While this wine is rich, it has a classical demeanor, with fine tannins that support but never dominate the ripe black fruits. Full of juicy acidity, it offers black currants and some fine, firm tannins at the end. This will take some time to mature, and the wine will not be ready to drink before 2027.
title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2015  Saint-Estèphe

description: Full of black-currant flavor, this firm wine has structure and a rich texture. Its bolstering tannins and vibrant acidity mark out an age-worthy selection. Spice tones and a dry core set the stage for a slow development into an even more complex and fulfilling wine. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: Almost completely Merlot, this is a rich wine but one that goes towards great elegance. The style is smooth, with soft tannins, although the wine is also fresh and almost salty with the acidity and juicy black fruits. Its tannins presage a long-term future. Drink from 2026.
title: Château Pavie Decesse 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: The second wine of Château Ausone, this is a great bottling in its own right. Powerful tannins merge into equally fine black fruits. The tannins and a complex mix between ripe fruit, acidity and spice go together into an impressive wine for aging. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Ausone 2015 Chapelle d'Ausone  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Sweet tangerine, pineapple and mango pulsate through this piercing, feather-light wine. It's an exhilarating sweet sip accented by savory nuances of musk and white truffles. Expansive yet thrilling and spry, the finish meanders endlessly. Drinks beautifully now but should hold gorgeously for decades to come.
designation: Scharzhofberger Beerenauslese #25 Grosse Lage Gold Kap
title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2011 Scharzhofberger Beerenauslese #25 Grosse Lage Gold Kap Riesling (Mosel)

description: While exceptionally sheer, almost diaphanous in texture, this sprightly, sumptuous Riesling offers penetrating layers of honey, melon and pineapple nuanced by spice, hay and crushed earth. It's a spine tingling, concentrated wine, with an endless, rippling finish. Delightful already but sure to hold for decades to come.
title: Robert Weil 2016 Kiedrich Gräfenberg Beerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: This beautifully golden-colored, oak-aged wine is bone dry, with the intense acidity working with an orange-marmalade character. Together they give a mature wine that is ready to drink.
title: Blandy's 1968 Sercial (Madeira)

description: Concentrated and with tight, mineral fruitiness, this wine is potentially ripe and rich, with citrus and orange peel crispness. The wine will be rich, rounded and packed with fruit, but it will take time. Drink from 2023.
title: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: Dense and concentrated, this wine is fully structured and also has great fruit. It is dense, showing the ripeness of both tannins and fruit in this vintage. It will power through its development to be a very fine wine from 2025.
title: Château Pape Clément 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: Spice and ripe fruit aromas lead into a wine that has both richness and a crisp, fruity herbal character. Acidity shines through, giving the wine a tangy, mineral edginess. It will be a delicious fruity wine. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine de Chevalier 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: From a spectacular Douro quinta, this wine is structured with dark tannins and rich with black-currant and berry fruits. The acidity, dry core and firm texture testify to the wine's aging ability. Drink this wine from 2021.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2015 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This dazzling sparkler hits all the right marks. It opens with heady aromas of citrus, bread crust and lemon pastry while the vibrant palate delivers juicy tangerine, Rennet apple and an energizing mineral note alongside an elegant, continuous perlage. Made from 60% Chardonnay and 40% Pinot Nero with no added dosage, it boasts a pristine quality and a pure, crisp finish.
title: Barone Pizzini 2013 Naturae  (Franciacorta)

description: Bottled in 2017, this wine aged in old oak for 60 years. It still has all the sweetness you would expect from a Bual Madeira while also having that old wood, almost golden character. Acidity balances the opulent fruit. Drink this wine now.
title: Blandy's 1957 Bual (Madeira)

description: This wine has a wonderful citrus character, fresh lemons and limes going with the mineral texture. It is crisp while also structured, bright with acidity and zesty with lemon and orange. The aftertaste is herbal, crisp and bright. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Carbonnieux 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a rich style of white, in keeping with the rich vintage. Its acidity and tight texture are paired off with the apricot and ripe pear fruitiness. Spice from wood aging adds an attractive background. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Couhins 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine with its dense and dusty tannins has considerable power as well as concentration. The small 10-acre vineyard has produced a wine packed with both tannins and luscious black fruits. Acidity complements all this richness with its own freshness and balance. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Hosanna 2015  Pomerol

description: Sturdy and structured, this wine offers beautiful tones of ripe blackberry and black cherry, with a dark streak of chocolate. It's primed and brightened by snappy acids, and flows gracefully into a pleasingly creamy finish highlighted by smoke and toast.
title: Domaine Serene 2014 Mark Bradford Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Demure notes of lemon and crushed mineral on the nose contrast an exuberant palate full of pink grapefruit and hibiscus nectar. It's a gorgeously silky, concentrated dry Riesling, with a firm mineral backbone and electric acidity that need time to meld. Hold until 2020 as it's likely to improve well through 2030.
title: Fritz Haag 2016 Brauneberg Juffer Sonnenuhr Trocken GG Riesling (Mosel)

description: First produced in 1991, this wine was a pioneer in the new generation of red wines from the Douro. It is firm with tannins and the strong minerality typical of the Douro. It has weight despite its low alcohol and tense fruitiness. Drink this complex wine with great aging potential from 2020.
title: Niepoort 2015 Redoma Red (Douro)

description: The best bottle in a stellar lineup of the winery's first 2016 releases, this marries old-vine elegance to lush aromatics, with entwined notes of walnuts, raspberries, thyme, rosewater and citrus. It's a long-lasting, beautifully integrated wine, made with grapes from some of the oldest blocks in the vineyard.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Medici Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This stunning sparkler is all about precision, finesse and purity. It opens with enticing scents of white spring flower, crushed stone, lemon pastry and hazelnut. The aromas carry over to the chiseled palate together with creamy yellow apple, tangerine zest, brioche and mineral notes alongside an elegant perlage. Vibrant acidity gives it balance and structure.
title: Ca' del Bosco 2013 Vintage Collection Dosage Zero  (Franciacorta)

description: Balanced and fragrant, this impressive sparkler offers alluring scents of yellow stone fruit and an inviting whiff of brioche. A blend of 80% Chardonnay and 20% Pinot Nero, it's elegantly structured and focused, delivering flavors of yellow apple, white peach, bread crust and crushed stone framed in bright acidity and elegant perlage. A vanilla note lingers on the bone-dry finish. It's extremely well balanced and refined.
title: Berlucchi 2010 '61 Nature  (Franciacorta)

description: Ripe and spicy, this is a smoothly textured wine. Its wood aging and creamy texture are rich, opulent and generous. With tangy acidity in the background, this dense wine is already impressive. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Fieuzal 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: Rich, already attractive, this wine sums up the whites in this vintage. With its opulent character and great fruit, it is rich, tangy and lightly herbal. It is a very complete wine and will be delicious from 2023.
title: Château Pape Clément 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: This excellent wine from a steep terraced vineyard offers beautiful aromas of lavender and violet that segue to a palate replete with black fruit, black pepper and anise tones. Each flavor seems especially well defined and they layer together harmoniously on a velvety texture that provides good support for all that concentration. Best after 2020.
title: Halcón 2015 Tierra Petite Sirah (Yorkville Highlands)

description: The name of this release goes back to the first red wine made by Niepoort in 1990. The wine was made with long old-barrel aging and was not bottled until 2017. Tannins are important to this rich wine; so is the powerful black fruit. They offer an mineral- and fruit-driven wine that still needs to age. Drink from 2020.
title: Niepoort 2013 Robustus Red (Douro)

description: Made by the Symington family, a major producer in the Douro, this wine comes from one of the region's legendary estates. With 16 months in wood, the wine has been smoothed and its fruit polished to give an opulent wine with plenty of tannic structure. Rich blackberry flavors have a strongly mineral texture that will allow this wine to age well. Drink from 2022.
title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2015 Red (Douro)

description: This wine is ripe, rich and generous. It brings out the almost-sweet character of the fruit in this vintage. At the same time, the tannins are firm and support all this fruitiness. The wine will develop well. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine de Chevalier 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine offers a compelling nose of pretty florals and spicy forest-floor aromas. Dense on entry, it lingers in flavors of orange, cherry and rhubarb, with textured tannins and an undercurrent of a stony, mineral character.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Calegari Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Instantly gratifying, this wine starts off ripe, focused and compact, with raspberries and pie cherries galore on the nose. Let it breathe and it offers complex acid-driven tones of pineapple and orange peel. Barrel aging shows from start to finish, with rich, toasty aromas and streaks of butter and vanilla cookie. It's delicious from first sniff to last sip.
title: Domaine Serene 2014 Winery Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Made from the original 150 year-old vines—of which just 800 remain—this wine is made only in the best years. The 2012 is a heady mélange of blue and purple fruits, raspberry leaf, beets, coffee and wet leaves. The medium-bodied palate is approachable now with its silky, sexy tannins, plush fruit and a complex, superlong finish, but this will age beautifully for many years to come. Drink now–2027.
title: Kilikanoon 2012 Attunga 1865 Shiraz (Clare Valley)

description: This wine, from a selected parcel of the Ducru-Beaucaillou vineyard, is packed with both tannins and great fruit. Its structure promises aging while its concentration and black fruits are already impressive. This is a rich wine but one that has the classic elegance of Saint-Julien.
title: La Croix Ducru-Beaucaillou 2015  Saint-Julien

description: Pretty blossom, guava and pink grapefruit notes abound in this gorgeously perfumed, dry Riesling. It's lively and fresh, but maintains a creamy lusciousness on the palate. Concentrated and zingy, it lingers through a long finish marked by murmurs of astringency. Drinks beautifully already but should improve through 2030 and hold further.
title: Maximin Grünhäuser 2016 Abtsberg GG Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: Demure notes of white blossom, pineapple and lemon amass power and ripeness on the palate of this dry, medium-bodied Riesling. Silken and finely textured, it offers penetrating pink-grapefruit and yellow-peach flavors highlighted by zippy streaks of lemon-lime acidity and a cool, crystalline finish.
title: Maximin Grünhäuser 2016 Herrenberg GG Riesling (Mosel)

description: Superrich and undeniably flavorful, this stand-out wine achieves fine balance despite the huge tannins. It has an utterly dark color that stains the glass, wonderful aromas of crushed raspberries and black cherries, and deep fruit flavors that weave through tones of dark chocolate and mint. The mouthfeel is notably dense but somehow gentle. Best from 2020–2030.
title: Portalupi 2015 L. Venturi Vineyards Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

description: Fresh Asian pear, lemon blossoms and honeysuckle make for an enjoyable nose on this bottling from a very coastally influenced vineyard just east of Santa Maria. The acidity on the palate is super racy and vibrant, carrying flavors of chalk and lime pith that sizzle long and deep.
title: Whitcraft 2016 Presqu'ile Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Truffle, flint and wild berry aromas mingle with pipe tobacco and a whiff of new leather on this radiant red. On the savory precise palate, licorice and white pepper underscore a juicy core of red cherry and cranberry alongside a flinty mineral vein. Polished tannins and fresh acidity provide impeccable balance. Drink through 2032.
title: Arpepe 2012 Sassella Stella Retica  (Valtellina)

description: Fragrant blue flower, wild herb, pipe tobacco and black-plum aromas waft out of the glass. Elegant and concentrated, the smooth delicious palate delivers juicy black cherry, raspberry preserve and licorice offset by well-knit, velvety tannins. Drink through 2025.
title: Boscarelli 2013 Sotto Casa  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Made entirely with Pinot Nero, this well-structured sparkler boasts enticing aromas of red berry, crushed herb and brioche. The bright tangy palate delivers Marasca cherry, pomegranate, juicy nectarine and bread crust alongside an elegant perlage. It's well balanced, with bright acidity.
title: Ca' del Bosco 2008 Annamaria Clementi Rosé Riserva  (Franciacorta)

description: The estate is situated on the slope opposite Angélus. This wine's tannins are firm but well integrated into the crisp Merlot fruit. The depth and complexity of this wine will allow it to age well. Drink from 2026.
title: Château Bellevue 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: Initially toasty on the nose, this wine offers a pleasant black-fruit core which shows good  oak integration. Its juicy black-currant flavors are just beginning to show on the structured palate, and as it fills out, the flavors will be seamless. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Bouscaut 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine's beautiful tannins are complemented by the ripe black fruits. Together they give a wine that is succulent, rich and firmly structured for long aging. Black currants, blackberries and intense crisp acidity come together in this intense wine. Drink from 2026.
title: Château Margaux 2015 Pavillon Rouge  (Margaux)

description: This rich, ripe wine has a tropical-fruit character as well as touches of herbal acidity. It is tangy and strongly mineral, with great fruitiness and structure. This is a wine for aging, so don't drink before 2023.
title: Château Olivier 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: Rich, ripe, and elegant, this wine comes from a separate parcel of Léoville las Cases that is treated as a distinct wine. With fine, dusty tannins and juicy acidity, it offers both richness and black currants from the Cabernet Sauvignon. It needs to age and should be ready to drink from 2025.
title: Clos du Marquis 2015  Saint-Julien

description: This quinta, situated in the heart of the Port vineyards, always forms the backbone of Dow's Ports. It makes a densely textured wine, powerful and with immense dusty tannins. These are backed by ripe black fruits, a good balance between sweet and dry, with a good shot of acidity. This complex Port needs to age for many years. Drink from 2028.
title: Dow's 2015 Quinta do Bomfim Vintage  (Port)

description: This is winemaker Dianna Novy Lee's debut sparkling wine, blending 56% Chardonnay and 44% Pinot Noir and then aging the wine on the lees for three years before release. It impresses from first sip, showing acid-driven raciness and a core of green apple, lime zest and biscuit flavors that linger. It'll serve well as a delicious aperitif or fitting companion for the table.
title: Flaunt NV Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Flowery, fragrant aromas of spring blossoms and pink grapefruit belie the power and intensity found on the palate of this bold, steel-touched Riesling. While dry and medium bodied in style, ripe citrus and crisp stone-fruit flavors penetrate deeply. The finish is long, marked by cool strikes of steel and lime acidity.
title: Fritz Haag 2016 Brauneberger Juffer Trocken GG Riesling (Mosel)

description: Deep and hearty aromas of black currant, caramel, lilac and a touch of roasted oak show on the dense nose of this wine. It is massive on the palate, but with appropriate balancing factors of entrenched acidity and chalky, sticky tannins that hold up the rich flavors of vanilla, black-plum skin and blackberry sauce.
title: Justin 2014 Focus Syrah (Paso Robles)

description: Owned by the Wrights, this beautifully proportioned wine is supple and tasty, with berry, cherry and blue plum. The barrel aging adds a dusting of cocoa, and the tannins, ripe and still a bit stiff, add notes of ground coffee.
title: Ken Wright 2015 Canary Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Rich tannins and concentration are driven both by ripe black fruits and a strongly mineral texture in this wine. The tannins have been smoothed by wood aging, but that's deceptive. Although the silkiness suggests early drinking, the firmer core suggests aging. Go for aging, because this will be an even more impressive wine from 2021.
title: Niepoort 2015 Charme Red (Douro)

description: Pure Touriga Nacional, planted in a single vineyard on granite soil, this wine is dense, luscious and rich. With generous black fruits underpinned by firm tannins, it is concentrated. The balance with acidity and powerful fruits is impressive and will allow the wine to age well. Drink from 2022.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2014 Monte Meão Vinha dos Novos Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: Forward, pristine fruit and mineral intensity align in this penetrating, complex dry Riesling. It offers luminous yellow peach, nectarine and grapefruit flavors offset by dazzling lemon-lime acidity and a firm strike of steely minerality. The palate is creamy and expansive yet finishes with laser-edged precision. Beautiful already but should continue to improve through 2035 and hold further.
title: Schloss Johannisberger 2015 Silberlack Trocken GG Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Toasty blackberry and cassis aromas are classic for Ribera, while the firm, compact palate is structured but not fiercely tannic. Flavors of spiced blackberry, plum and fig finish with the right interplay between fruit and oak. Drink through 2028.
title: 12 Linajes 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Big, potent and deeply concentrated, this holds nothing back with its rich, ripe black-cherry-compote flavor. Lavender overtones lead into more expressive layers of vanilla, black tea and Kahlúa. It is intense and lingering.
title: Abacela 2014 Reserve South East Block Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

description: With its proportion of Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine has an elegant profile, while the Merlot reflects the natural opulence of the vintage. Acidity, concentration and black fruits are all there, along with the tannin that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2026.
title: Château Certan de May de Certan 2015  Pomerol
winery: Château Certan de May de Certan

description: Spice and citrus aromas make this wine immediately attractive. It offers ripe fruit and intense acidity along with layers of toast and spice. Its richness will carry through as it ages, and it will be best drunk from 2023.
title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: This marks the first full vintage of this wine with the same winemaking team as Château Ausone. It shows great promise with supple black fruits, ripe tannins and intense acidity. The wine will age well with its firm structure as well as great acidity and crispness at the end. Drink from 2025.
title: Château la Clotte 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: Dense tannins and rich black fruits mark out this ripe wine. Its tannins are cushioned by the concentrated but generous black fruits that were organically grown. The wine has great purity as well as structure. Drink from 2024.
title: Château la Vieille Cure 2015  Fronsac

description: This second wine of Lafite comes from young vines and wines selected during the blending. The result is a wine with the structure and nobility of the Lafite character but one that will age more quickly. It has great layers of black-currant fruits and acidity, with firm tannins as a background and rich potential. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Lafite Rothschild 2015 Carruades de Lafite  (Pauillac)

description: A closed nose offers a hint of cherry. The palate follows with a balance of pure cherry, firm tannin and bright freshness graced with a touch of dark peony. This is understated, light-bodied but wonderfully elegant and has a habit of growing on you slowly and stealthily. This has a long and lovely resonance.
title: Domaine Ostertag 2016 Fronholz Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This higher-end, elegantly packaged bottling delivers depth, starting with a well-woven, unique nose of baked strawberry, cinnamon, juniper, peppercorns and tobacco. Those elements converge on the palate alongside sandalwood, Montmorency cherry and vanilla, bolstered by a soft but steady acidity.
title: Donati Family Vineyard 2014 Family Reserve Grenache (Paicines)

description: There's a lifted, vibrant impression to the nose of this impressive, well-crafted wine. It's a pleasant surprise, as it lends levity and definition to the notes of black cherry, crushed purple flowers, licorice root and earth. The mouthfeel is plush and mouthfilling, yet not oppressively so, with ample acidity and structured but velvety tannins. The rich, ripe and robust palate leads into a long finish. It promises a long life of beautiful evolution ahead, maturing to reveal greater nuance and elegance, so cellar through 2030.
title: Kanonkop 2014 Black Label Estate Wine Pinotage (Simonsberg-Stellenbosch)

description: The 2013 Attunga expresses aromas of blueberries, baking spices, coffee and tarragon. It's currently very youthful, with rich, plush fruit and big fine-grained tannins, but structurally it's set up for a long and beautiful life. Drink 2020–2037.
title: Kilikanoon 2013 Attunga 1865 Shiraz (Clare Valley)

description: Bright and fresh aromas of pomelo pith, grapefruit flesh, guava skins and tangerine souffle show on the nose of this top-tier Chardonnay by veteran Rick Longoria. Clean and crisp flavors of mandarin pith and a crushed marble minerality give backbone to the richer touches of macadamia nut, cashew and the slightest kiss of buttercream.
title: Longoria 2015 Cuvée Diana Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Batuta, named after the baton used by an orchestral conductor to blend various musical instruments together, has splendid structure and fruit.
