It is richly textured with dense tannins as well as layers of black fruits. It holds fruit from three north-facing vineyards on the south bank of the Douro, giving the wine elegance and potential. Drink from 2020.
title: Niepoort 2015 Batuta Red (Douro)

description: This monumental wine is one for the ages—or at least for 15 years. A deep color is followed by gorgeous aromas of rose, dark chocolate and blackberry syrup. The mouthfilling, ripe fruit flavors are concentrated, bolstered by thick, powerful tannins that give it a mouth-puckering astringency. The firmness sets this wine up for a long life. Best from 2022–2032.
title: Parducci 2015 True Grit Reserve Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

description: The new sparkling wine project from Trisaetum is off to a spectacular start. This 100% Chardonnay sparkler is refined and detailed. It keeps a lid on the excessive fruitiness and brings in the minerality, toast and overall finesse of the finest Old World examples.
designation: Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut Methode Champenoise Estate Grown
title: Pashey 2014 Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut Methode Champenoise Estate Grown Sparkling (Ribbon Ridge)

description: The Weber vineyard, originally planted in 1978, shows well with bold bright black-cherry fruit, amplified with lemony acids and flavors of lemon meringue. The lingering midpalate leads gracefully into a smooth, lusciously fruity finish.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Weber Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Aromas of struck matches and smoke are pronounced initially but dissipate into elegant mineral complexities on the palate of this intensely fruity kabinett. Juicy tangerine and grapefruit flavors are sweet and zesty, edged by a bracing fringe of astringency on the finish.
title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2016 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Kabinett Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: A beautifully pure topnote of black cherry sings on the nose, followed by peony and cinnamon. The palate is luminous in a dark cherry flavor. This wine is profound and concentrated but nothing weighs it down. Drink 2018–2028.
title: René Muré 2016 Clos St Landelin Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This shows beatutifully aromatic notes of fresh Cox Orange Pippin apple, jasmine and rose. The palate brims with these same notions, made bolder by pure, lively lemon freshness. The streamlined palate has a pithy, zesty edge that makes you want to drink more. This is a lovely, concentrated, grown-up Muscat of unusual power. The finish is bone-dry, a little salty and lingering.
title: René Muré 2016 Steinstuck Muscat (Alsace)

description: Soft and alluring, this wine opens in bursts of rose petal and black tea, with plenty of baking spices accenting its core of cherry, blueberry and rhubarb. As the wine mellows on the finish, it show a velvety texture of round, supple tannins.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Foss Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This deep ruby wine offers a bouquet of blackberry, cassis and a slight touch of bell pepper. The full palate is bolstered by opulent tannins, offering flavors of black cherry, black currant and vanilla, with fennel, black pepper and a hint of spice on the finish.
title: Recanati 2014 Reserve David Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Galilee)

description: Extremely light in color in the glass, this bottling of a 40-year-old vineyard block is an old vine masterpiece, starting with aromas of crisp, underripe raspberry, tart carnation and orange rind aromas. It's fresh, light, lovely and very quaffable on the palate, where pomegranate juice is sprinkled with dried oregano and a pinch vanilla dust. The acidity is clean and balanced.
designation: Block Q Old Vine Bien Nacido Vineyard
title: Scar of the Sea 2015 Block Q Old Vine Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: There's a purity to the black fruit, cocoa, espresso and wisteria aromas on the nose of this bottling from a small dry-farmed vineyard 2,100-feet up in the mountains. The zesty palate throws potpourri and white pepper together with fresh boysenberry and elderberry, making for a uniquely flavored wine, redolent with dried purple flowers.
title: Scar of the Sea 2015 House Vineyard Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is half barrel fermented and half fermented in stainless steel. It's gritty and expansive on the luxurious palate and well-made, offering layers of apple, pear and melon with a tease of anise on the lengthy full-bodied finish.
title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2015 Arcadia Vineyard Chardonnay (Coombsville)

description: This is a sexy, elegant, light-on-its-feet beauty from one of Tasmania's most highly respected producers. The nose is a heady blend of cinnamon bark, bright red berries, salt and garrigue, while the palate is crunchy and sappy. A picture of drinkability combined with complexity and superb winemaking.
title: Tolpuddle 2015 Pinot Noir (Tasmania)

description: Wakefield's top wine offers enchanting aromas of mocha, milky coffee, vanilla, licorice and sun-ripened raspberries and blackberries. It's texturally plush, with a fair amount of richness, silky tannins and well integrated oak. This should age with exceptional grace. Drink 2019–2027.
title: Wakefield 2013 The Pioneer Exceptional Parcel Release Shiraz (Clare Valley)

description: A whiff of white flowers, then a crush of ripe fruit, and the wine opens with tangy lemon, grapefruit and peach flavors. Notes of citrus rind add depth and the acids strike just the right chord.
title: Amalie Robert 2016 Our Muse Viognier (Willamette Valley)

description: This 11-acre property, centered on an ultramodern winery, is the most northerly estate in Margaux. The wine, with its blend of dark tannins and juicy black-currant fruit, is rich, with impressive concentration and minerality. With weight and a firm core, the wine will age well. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Bellevue de Tayac 2015  Margaux

description: This is a structured wine, beautifully perfumed with richly tannic black fruits. It comes from a large 111-acre estate in the village of the same name. Made to age with firm tannins and layers of sumptuous fruit over firm wood aging, the wine will mature slowly. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Cissac 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: This dense and impressively ripe wine comes from a Sorge family estate in the northern part of the Margaux appellation. With black fruits and generous tannins, it is a big wine with considerable richness. This complex wine will age. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Deyrem Valentin 2015  Margaux

description: This wine comes from a 50-acre crus bourgeois estate in the middle of some of the greatest crus classés estates. The terroir is impressive, giving a rich, structured wine with good concentration, ripe tannins and a sumptuous bed of black fruits. The wine is likely to age well; drink from 2025.
title: Château Fonbadet 2015  Pauillac

description: A touch of orange zest, honeysuckle and rose petals make for a gently aromatic opening. On the palate it is the sheer concentration of flavor that hits you, there seems to be a force of life straining to break free, which swishes across the dry palate in rich flavors of orange zest and florals. This is a vivid, arresting wine which is lovely now but sure has mileage. Drink 2018–2028.
title: Domaine Ostertag 2016 Fronholz Muscat (Alsace)

description: Stark, electric acidity bolsters this intensely steely yet deeply fruity off-dry Riesling. It's a cutting, spine tingling wine pulsating with staccato hits of white grapefruit, stone fruit and citrus flavors. The finish is gossamer and sheer yet endless.
title: Egon Müller 2016 Scharzhof Riesling (Mosel)

description: Made with the traditional blend of Sangiovese, Colorino and Canaiolo, this opens with aromas of pressed violet, woodland berry, menthol and dark culinary spice. The supple full-bodied palate delivers juicy morello cherry, black raspberry and star anise accompanied by fresh acidity and polished tannins. Drink through 2023.
title: Il Conventino 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: The Carter is a complex, even rugged wine, replete with layered flavors of herb, black cherry, cola and a touch of molasses. The tannins are as smooth as river rock, with appealing mineral and rock flavors following right behind.
title: Ken Wright 2015 Carter Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Far from simply fruity, this is a complex and sophisticated wine that shows how distinctive the grape variety can be. It relies on savory, minerally flavors that have wonderful subtlety and reserve. With each sip it settles a little deeper on the palate, lingering for a long finish buoyed by underlying acidity.
title: Lava Cap 2016 Viognier (El Dorado)

description: This new offering from John Kinney's tiny, consistently high-performing winery is big and muscular—very ripe and full bodied, generously laced with butter, toasted oak and almond flavors on a particularly creamy texture but not going over the top. Only about six barrels were made so it's rare, but worth a search.
title: Occasio 2016 Del Arroyo Vineyard Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: While pristine pink grapefruit, pineapple and peach flavors are crisp and concentrated, this lacy, textured auslese is more a showcase of intensely layered minerality. Invigorating and fresh, it offers deeply embedded veins of salt, dusty slate and smoke that reverberate through a long, honey-kissed finish. Drinks beautifully already but should improve from 2021.
title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Müller-Burggraef) 2016 Berncasteler Doctor Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Tight-grained tannins lie beneath a sleek, sophisticated structure of ageworthy complexity in this old-vine wine made from grapes planted in 1959. Intensely layered, it shows wisps of currant, pencil shavings and anise—seasonings for a lush backdrop of brambly blackberry. Enjoy 2023–2033.
title: Grgich Hills 2013 Old Vine Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)

description: Estate-grown fruit—principally Pinot Noir with 8% Chardonnay—goes into this impressively complex sparkling wine from Trisaetum. It's rich and deep, showing both power and finesse. A fine bead and light details of cocoa, coconut and cream bring exceptional complexity.
designation: Cuvée Extra Brut Methode Champenoise Estate Grown
title: Pashey 2014 Cuvée Extra Brut Methode Champenoise Estate Grown Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

description: Wild red berry, tilled soil, violet, new leather and a whiff of sandalwood slowly unfold on this fragrant red. The structured savory palate delivers dried black cherry, pomegranate, white pepper and clove framed in polished, fine-grained tannins. A hint of coffee lingers on the close. Drink 2020–2025.
title: Poliziano 2015 Asinone  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: A selection made both of grapes in the vineyard and wines in the winery, this rich wine has power and density as well as superb fruits. The well-judged oak aging melds well with the dark fruits and acidity, while the tannins give strength and aging potential. Drink from 2021
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2015 La Rosa Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a well-made, small-production wine from the producer's home estate. Inviting in perfumed oak, pencil and cedar, it has brawny power that remains elegant in the glass, with persistent acidity and layers of cassis and cinnamon.
title: Tierra Roja 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: The style of Warre's Ports tends to dryness, and this fine quinta vintage is no exception. It's dry, but the rich fruit forms a great counterbalance. Dense, still young and bursting with perfumed blueberry fruits, the wine has great promise. Drink from 2027.
title: Warre's 2015 Quinta da Cavadinha Vintage  (Port)

description: This powerful wine is big, bold and rich. It has serious tannins along with superripe Merlot. The acidity and the berry flavors are almost buried in the structure. It will develop into a rich, balanced and dense wine. Drink from 2026.
title: Château Bellevue-Mondotte 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine is dense, complex and with great tannins. It is powerful and rich, packed with black fruits. Good acidity gives the wine its freshness, its black-currant fruit and its potential longevity. Rich and with great aging potential, this is becoming a major wine in its own right rather than just a second wine of Cos d'Estournel. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2015 Pagodes de Cos  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: Deep, brooding scents of black plum, cherry and cassis form the soul of this beautiful, richly concentrated wine. Plenty of licorice, cigar-box spice and bittersweet cocoa ride atop the fruit core, while notes of green peppercorn, leather and tobacco flesh out the midpalate and flourish on the finish. The crushed-velvet texture offers ample tannic grip and balancing acidity to keep everything in harmony. While it's hard to resist now, this should shine from 2023–2028.
title: De Toren 2015 Fusion V Red (Stellenbosch)

description: Aromas of mature black-skinned berry, baked plum, mint and violet mix with whiffs of dark culinary spice. The ripe chewy palate doles out raspberry jam, fleshy black cherry and licorice set against firm, polished tannins. The juicy fruit flavors deftly support the hefty alcohol. Drink through 2022.
title: Dei 2012 Bossona  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Musk and earthen complexities of smoke and struck flint meld into sun-kissed yellow cherry and tangerine in this seductive, complex kabinett. It's ethereal and sheer yet boldly penetrating, with a piercing lemon-lime finish. Delicious already but sure to improve through 2022 and hold well beyond.
title: Egon Müller 2016 Scharzhofberger Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: This gorgeous, radiant sparkler opens with enticing aromas of ripe orchard fruit, pressed wild flowers and cream-filled brioche. Elegantly sparkling, the bright palate delivers Golden Delicious apple, tangy lemon drop, Alpine herbs and minerals alongside tiny continuous bubbles. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors and lends impeccable balance.
title: Fratelli Berlucchi 2010 Casa delle Colonne Brut Riserva  (Franciacorta)

description: Just a shade off dry in style, this feather-light dynamo offers bold, concentrated stone fruit and blossom tones, enveloped in rich, penetrating swathes of smoke and earth. It's a gorgeously complex wine, with spine tingling acidity and a delicate, lilting mouthfeel that extends endlessly on the finish. Drinks beautifully already but concentrated and structured enough to improve well through 2030.
title: Günther Steinmetz 2016 Wintricher Geierslay GW Riesling (Mosel)

description: Bright red fruits, sappy acids and citrus highlights combine here. The supporting tannins are ripe and toasty, with a slightly grainy mouthfeel. Suggestions of coffee grounds add further interest to the finish, which expands gracefully as it breathes. This is a wine still pulling itself together and clearly built to expand and improve with further bottle age. Drink now through 2030.
title: Ken Wright 2015 Bryce Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: Lovely black-cherry fruit is the highlight here, with aromatics that elevate the fruit with high-toned intensity. The wine is cloaked with chocolate from barrel aging, and detailed with coffee grounds, graphite and loam.
title: Ken Wright 2015 Freedom Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Hints of honey, caramelized sugar and ripe tangerine on the nose contrast a palate that's lean and bracingly mineral here. While light bodied and lean, zesty white grapefruit and tart pineapple flavors are piercing and persistent. Tasted in 2017, it's still a taut, nervous wine that needs time to meld. Hold till 2020.
title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2016 Kaseler Nies'chen GG Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

description: This is an excellent example why so many go crazy for Pinot Noir. The wine exudes a nourishing warmth that transports you to a cozy country kitchen, with bouquets of drying flowers and currants hanging from the rafters, szechuan beef sizzling in the stir fry, earthy sumac in the spice bowl and smoke from the dying embers of a campfire wafting in through the windows. It's silky and open enough to drink now, but should continue to age well through 2025.
title: Shaw and Smith 2014 Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)

description: This is a lovely light-bodied wine with serious intent and sophistication. Pear puree and apple skin mingle effortlessly along a plane of gravelly rocky mineral complexity that will show well with a variety of meals.
title: Blue Rock 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Linear and elegant, this vibrancy of this sparkler belies its age. It opens with enticing scents of wild flower, orchard fruit, a hint of hazelnut and a whiff of pastry. The palate shows complexity, depth as well as freshness, delivering Golden Delicious apple, apricot, toasted bread crust and a hint of tangerine zest. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors while an elegant mousse lends finesse.
title: Ca' del Bosco 2007 Cuvée Annamaria Clementi  (Franciacorta)

description: The terrific texture and wealth of detail makes this truly exceptional. Citrus, mineral, candied pineapple and a hint of honey all combine in a long, dense and bright-tasting wine. In the spirit of Oregon's finest Rieslings, it's both sweet and tart, with a lively inviting mouthfeel.
title: Alloro 2016 Riesling (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Lusty black-fruit aromas are earthy, oaky and smooth, exemplifying an excellent Ribera del Duero. A palate with pulsing acidity tempers rich flavors of blackberry, chocolate and vanilla. Creamy oak and some fire on the finish guarantee that this will evolve nicely through 2028.
title: Astrales 2014  Ribera del Duero

description: The estate vineyard, now about 15-years-old, delivers spicy black-cherry fruit deftly set against dark toasty barrel flavors. Just one-quarter new French oak was used, but winemaker Mo Ayoub is a barrel master who mixes and matches the oak like a painter mixes his or her colors. There's a strong streak of coffee, and it finishes with light accents of forest mushrooms.
title: Ayoub 2015 Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This structured elegant sparkler boasts aromas and flavors of brioche, dried yellow apple, citrus and mineral. It's vibrant and focused, with bright acidity and a persistent refined perlage. Notes of toasted almond and dried herb close the finish. It's still quite young and will develop even more complexity over the next several years.
title: Bellavista 2008 Vittorio Moretti Extra Brut  (Franciacorta)

description: This finely perfumed wine has a percentage of Cabernet Franc in the blend giving elegance as well as contrasting well with the ripe, jammy Merlot. This generously structured wine is smooth, juicy with red fruits and acidity. It will age well over the medium term. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Calon Ségur 2015 Le Marquis de Calon Ségur  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: Produced close to Saint-Estèphe, this Merlot-dominated wine is powerful and dense. Great black fruits and juicy acidity contrast with firm tannins and the ripe texture from wood aging. This rich wine will age well. Drink from 2024.
title: Château d'Hanteillan 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: The rich wood and fruit of this wine already show good balance. The estate, owned by Bordeaux negociant Dourthe, is now on excellent form with this structured wine offering concentration and long-term aging. The tannins and the dry core from roughly equal proportions of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot and a pinch of Petit Verdot promise great potential. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Le Boscq 2015  Saint-Estèphe

description: Ripe and creamy, this white wine from the Margaux vineyards is full of apple, grapefruit and tangy orange fruit. It also has a good structure with its touch of toast and spice. The wine is clean, clear, very pure and with great balance. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Margaux 2015 Pavillon Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: The fifth vintage from this estate since its purchase by the Barton family of Léoville Barton in Saint-Julien, this is a generous, structured wine. It has ripe black fruits in profusion that are held together by the serious layer of tannins. Rich and concentrated, the wine will age for many years. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Mauvesin Barton 2015  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: The second wine of Château Valandraud, this is rich, spicy with great fruit and firm tannins. The wood aging is still showing but it will soon integrate better with the ripeness of the rich fruit. This wine has weight, plenty of black fruit and acidity. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Valandraud 2015 Virginie  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Coming from the Rocks District, this offers expressive aromas of potpourri, fresh chopped parsley, orange peel, green olive, smoked meat, fresh flower and wet stone. These lead to plush, palate-coating fruit and savory flavors. Olive and charcuterie notes linger on the finish.
title: Proper 2015 Estate Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: The result of a joint venture between the Bergqvist family of Quinta de la Rosa and winemaker Jorge Moreira, this wine comes from vines in the Douro Superior region. Rich and dense with black fruits, it is structured and still young. Its intensity and ripe fruits show the warm, dry nature of the vineyards in the region. Drink this concentrated wine from 2019.
title: Quinta das Bandeiras 2015 Passagem Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A striking wine, this brand has long been an advocate for Cab Franc in South Africa, and the skill and experience of winemaker Bruwer Raats absolutely shines here. Plush and attractive, yet well defined, it opens with herbal aromas of green peppercorn, tobacco leaf, bark and a touch of pressed iris that weave throughout the ripe blackberry, cherry and currant fruit. Medium-plus in weight, it boasts a crushed-velvet texture and slightly creamy impression, framed by structured tannins and superb acidity to balance. The long finish offers an exercise of evolution, from ripe fruit to fresh earthy tones and finally dried ash and spice. It's hard to resist now, in all its complex, layered glory, but this will mature well through 2028.
title: Raats Family 2015 Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)

description: This is a stunning example of a wine that's fresh and light yet loaded with flavor. Buoyant aromas of black raspberry juice, dried fennel and wet slate lead onto a palate of snappy, slightly sour pomegranate, white pepper and sumac. The texture is equally complex, while the finish brings additional flavors of candied cherry and strawberry.
title: Gary Farrell 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This wine is deeply striated with tones of licorice, coffee, tobacco and black tea. The palate offers the blackest of black fruits, sanguine tones, cured meat and coffee, taking Southern Oregon Syrah to the next level.
title: Abacela 2014 Reserve South Face Block Syrah (Umpqua Valley)

description: This wine is currently a baby, wanting more time to completely form and express itself with full potential. The nose is shy at first, needing some airing to coax out notes of singed fynbos, greengage and white melon rind. The palate offers a bit more fruit expression, as waves of citrus peel, Asian pear and dried apple skin are framed by a chalky minerality and just a hint of nutty stone-fruit pit. A sea-breeze salinity graces the driven, precise finish. Drink 2020–2028.
title: Alheit 2015 Magnetic North Mountain Makstok Chenin Blanc (Olifants River)

description: This is a lovely wine from a fine appellation, on the outskirts of the town of Napa. Rose, cassis and cherry-strawberry accent a chiseled structure of finely honed acidity and a succulent core that will equally please a crowd and connoisseurs.
title: Ancien 2015 Mink Vineyard Pinot Noir (Coombsville)

description: There's a very prominent gamy quality throughout this wine, which starts with aromas of roasted lamb, charcoal, creosote and animal pelt. The palate takes that feral quality even deeper, with hints of Worcestershire sauce, dried lamb and peppery spice. Great for Northern Rhône lovers.
title: Archium 2015 Faction Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Rose petal, wild berry, graphite and crushed aromatic herb lead the way. Reflecting the nose, the fresh linear palate offers strawberry, sour cherry, white pepper and a savory saline note. Bright acidity and polished tannins provide graceful support. Drink through 2027.
title: Arpepe 2012 Grumello Rocca De Piro  (Valtellina Superiore)

description: Initial cola and root-beer aromas precede floral berry scents. A strict palate is firm but avoids crushing weight. Narrow plum, currant and berry flavors are focused and framed by roaring tannins. This is still young and tough, but with great potential; drink from 2019–2035.
title: Bodegas Alejandro Fernandez 2012 Pesquera Reserva Tinto  (Ribera del Duero)

description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot, this offers enticing scents of red and black-skinned berry, fragrant purple flower and a whiff of Mediterranean scrub. On the fresh, elegant palate, polished tannins support cassis, plum and raspberry alongside culinary spice notes.
title: Campo alle Comete 2016 Rosso Stupore  (Bolgheri)

description: This wine comes from a 10-acre estate that is run by the same team as the much larger Château Larose Trintaudon, helping explain its quality and the richness. It has broad tannins, ripe blackberry fruit and a generous, succulent character. It should be aged further so drink from 2024.
title: Château Arnauld 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: Produced by the team of Calon Ségur, this wine is stylish and elegant while also full of the Saint-Estèphe tannic structure. Fresh and fruity, it is also firm and tannic. Drink this spicy, juicy wine from 2025.
title: Château Capbern 2015  Saint-Estèphe

description: Owner Philippe Raoux has created both a major sculpture park and a series of impressive vintages at this estate at the western end of Margaux. This vintage is one of the best yet, rich and vibrant with great fruits and solid tannins. It needs serious aging, so drink from 2025.
title: Château d'Arsac 2015  Margaux

description: Firm and tannic, this wine's rich structure is balanced by a concentrated blackberry flavor and bright acidity. Drink from 2026.
title: Château Duhart-Milon 2015  Pauillac

description: This 22-acre vineyard with over 90% Merlot has given an intense wine with minerality as well as layers of dense fruit. The powerful tannins never dominate the fruit, giving richness, structure and an excellent potential. Drink from 2025.
title: Château la Grave 2015  Pomerol

description: Dominated by Merlot, this is an opulent wine. Even if its tannins are very present, the swathes of ripe blackberry fruits dominate in this rich wine. It has the great fruit of the year, generous and backed by acidity. Drink this fine second wine from 2026.
title: Château Léoville Las Cases 2015 Le Petit Lion  (Saint-Julien)

description: This wine is smooth, with a cream-chocolate texture that's rich and dense. Velvety tannins opulently balance with the superripe fruit. This is not a shy wine, everything is right out front. Drink from 2026.
title: Château Monbousquet 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: Black fruits and rich tannins give this wine concentration. It relies on juicy black-currant fruits as well as attractive acidity, but with the background of a structure that promises a wine ready to drink in a few years. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Moulin Saint-Georges 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine has great fruit, rich tannins and attractive acidity. Round and with ripe spicy flavors, the wine already has good balance. Its acidity and crisp final fruitiness suggest a wine that will mature easily and gently. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Olivier 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is light and fruity, with attractive acidity and a crisp texture. Black-currant flavors and balanced tannins keep it elegant and delicious. It is crisp, fresh and likely to develop over the medium term. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Soutard-Cadet 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: While each of Dalrymple's Pinots are distinctly different, they're all equally delicious. The Coal River will appeal to those funk lovers, with notes of earth, horse saddle, wet leaves, dried currants, orange rind and bitters. The medium-bodied palate is less funky, offering soft tannins and no harsh edges.
title: Dalrymple 2014 Coal River Pinot Noir (Tasmania)

description: This wine is equal parts Grenache and Mourvèdre (co-fermented), finished off with Syrah and aged in neutral French-oak puncheons. The aromas are fascinating, with notes of fresh savory herbs, capers, sea salt, white pepper, bacon fat and mixed fruit. The flavors are plump and appealing, mixing fruity and savory tones that lead to a pepper and olive finish. It's a standout interpretation of this vineyard.
title: Damsel 2015 The Fates Boushey Vineyard Red (Yakima Valley)

description: The top wine from De Ponte, this gets 60% new French oak and a full 15 months in barrel prior to bottling. Those flavors come up quickly, putting a lush vein of butterscotch right down the center. The tangy marionberry fruit is a perfect complement, keeping it fresh and luscious, and suggesting that it will drink optimally for the next decade.
title: De Ponte Cellars 2014 Baldwin Family Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Charred hickory and cured bacon waft from the glass, overriding but not completely overpowering the lush, fruity center. Waves of velvety tannins brush across the palate, lending structure to the ripe black cherry, blackberry and mashed plum-flesh flavors. Final hints of tree bark, licorice root and black tea unfold on the medium-length finish. It's delicious now, but should evolve well from 2021–2028.
title: De Toren 2015 Z Red (Stellenbosch)

description: This starts out dense and tight, with compact seams of smoke, char, espresso and cacao, sprinkled with dashes of sea salt. It moves into a thick core of mulberry, red currant and black cherry fruit, set in a frame of polished tannins, hitting a faintly green note as it fades.
title: Domaine Serene 2014 Fleur de Lis Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This black wine is rich, earthy and chocolaty on the nose, with fully toasted aromas of blackberry and cassis. A massive palate with tannins as heavy as cinderblocks features saturated flavors of blackberry, black coffee and chocolate. A malty, smoky, woody finish is anything but shy. Drink from 2020–2030.
title: Emina 2012 Atio  (Ribera del Duero)

description: With a slight nose of noble reduction, this seductive wine offers a wealth of balanced flavor and body, shining in tones of nuts, fennel, vanilla and mango. The oak is measured and supportive, never getting in the way, allowing the acidity to pierce through the fruit.
title: Grgich Hills 2014 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Deep ruby to the eye, this wine has a nose of dark plum, bramble fruit and thyme. A sense of brightness is ever-present on the palate, with flavors of cherry, cassis, butterscotch, fennel and white pepper. Smooth tannins play on the tongue and then linger just beyond the black-cherry finish, with a touch of caramel.
title: Hayotzer 2014 Lyrica G-S-M (Galilee)

description: This young wine comes up quickly with strawberry fruit, ripe and dotted with white pepper. There are hints of parsley, and impressive midpalate concentration. With all of Ken Wright's wines, which are released quite young, the odds strongly favor additional development and improved complexity with another few years of bottle age.
title: Ken Wright 2015 Bonnie Jean Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: A stunning wine, this opens with scents of golden straw, honeydew rind, firm nectarine and fresh honeycomb that all carry through to the medium-weight mouth. The palate boasts a flinty, mineral texture and bright acidity that lends verve and precision to the notes of toasted apple, spiced orange rind and pressed yellow flowers. Hints of fresh herbs and minty fynbos grace the enduring finish. It sure is delicious now, but try this stunner from 2020–2028.
title: Mullineux 2015 Granite Chenin Blanc (Swartland)

description: Aromas suggesting steeped prune, dark culinary spice, new leather, tobacco and balsamic notes lead the nose. The aromas follow over to the firmly structured palate along with raisin and licorice, while tightly knit fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity provide the austere framework. A smoky mineral note lingers on the finish. Drink 2019–2026.
title: Nera 2011  Sforzato di Valtellina

description: This new release, a limited production wine from this estate, is named after Tim Bergqvist, the patriarch of the family that owns this property. The wood aging has given richness, almost creamy sweetness to the ripe fruits. The attractive slight oxidation adds complexity to what is already a fine wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2015 Tim Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Almost black in color, this rich, unctuous wine at first seems smooth. Ripe black-plum and jammy berry fruits are ripe and dense. Behind that generous exterior, firm tannins and a dense structure will allow the wine to age well. Drink after 2026.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2014 Vintage  (Port)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: This wine is richly layered, offering a density of brick, toasty char and dusty rock flavors and aromas—a muscular showing from a warm vintage. Black pepper, leather and dried herbs provide additional complexity around a full-bodied core.
title: Trinchero 2014 BRV Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This wine is already showing characteristics of age, but in all the best ways. This offers heady aromas of dried flowers, cinnamon bark, beef stir fry and sumac yet the palate is full of savory, sinewy tannins and a tonic character, ending on a long, dried cherry finish. It's easy to fall under this wine's spell.
title: Wicks 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)

description: Lots of herbs, dried red currants and cranberry compote aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which has an earthy, gamy undercurrent. The palate tastes like it has more age on it, which is a good thing for now, with flavors of charred wood, damp forest floor, dried fruit and allspice, all riding a squeaky texture.
title: Wrath 2015 115/667 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Tangy, savory and elegant, this bright, silky sparkler offers inviting aromas and flavors of Golden Delicious apple, tangy tangerine drop, white peach, mineral and herb. A creamy mousse lends even more finesse while cream-filled brioche lingers on the finish.
title: Bonfadini NV Carpe Diem Satèn  (Franciacorta)

description: Vibrant and delicious, this structured sparkler opens with heady scents of ripe orchard fruit and baked bread. The intense palate delivers Rennet apple, tangerine zest, chopped herb and a hint of toasted almond alongside bright acidity and an elegant perlage. It finishes juicy and bone dry.
title: Bosio 2009 Girolamo Bosio Riserva Pas Dosé  (Franciacorta)

description: The ??? Pinots from Ayoub are made with fruit sourced from such excellent sources as Arcus, Renegade Ridge and Winderlea. Here, as elsewhere, the barrel management is as important as the fruit, putting a concise frame of toast around tight well-defined red-berry and black-cherry flavors. Streaks of cola and coffee add further interest through a lingering finish. Drink now to 2030.
title: Ayoub 2015 ??? Vineyards Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: A very intriguing hint of nettle plays along with the orange and mandarine zest aromas, creating a perfumed whiff of utter freshness. On the palate it is apple and orange ripeness that create a sort of dry, juicy richness and concentration. This is an unusual but utterly seductive Muscat.
title: Boeckel 2016 Midelberg Muscat (Alsace)

description: This rich, dense vintage Port is produced by Niepoort. It has immense tannins as well as layers of ripe fruit. The concentrated texture, powerful dry core and the richness of the wine promise good aging. Drink from 2028.
title: Broadbent 2015 Vintage  (Port)

description: This elegant wine is both ripe and structured. It has weight and richness, both absorbed by the generous black fruits and good acidity. This 29-acre property, one of a number to use the name of the Poujeaux sub-sector of Moulis, has made a wine that will age well. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Branas Grand Poujeaux 2015  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Blackberry perfumes and rich tannins play their parts in this dense, firm wine. Fruit and a dry core cut with acidity give it great potential. The richness and spice are leavened by the juiciness of the aftertaste. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Brillette 2015  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: One of the properties owned by the Chanfreau family of nearby Fonréaud, this 14-acre estate has produced a structured, toasty wine. Its high proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon gives it plenty of juicy black currants as well as fruit tannins. The wine needs to age and should be drunk from 2025.
title: Château Caroline 2015  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Biodynamically grown, the grapes from this estate offer structure, concentration and a delicious balance between fruit and tannins. The wine has a serious side, with its dense texture and a straight line of pure black fruits. Drink from 2025.
title: Château la Marzelle 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: This is a rich wine with generous tannins and, more importantly, generous black fruits. It has a soft texture, the tannins fine and well integrated into the juiciness. It will be a delicious, fruity wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2015 La Chapelle  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: Produced from a Domaines Fabre parcel of old vines, this wine is rich, firm and concentrated. Wood aging has left its mark of toast and spice without losing the generous fruits. It is an elegant wine, full in the mouth and with great balance between all its elements. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Laride 2015 L'Iris de Laride  (Haut-Médoc)

description: From the southern part of the Haut-Médoc, this Tessandier family wine is a richly structured blend with Cabernet Sauvignon dominant. It has a dry, firm and densely tannic structure along with ripe and potentially generous blackberry fruit. The combination will allow this dark, firm wine to age well. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Maucamps 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: From a grand estate, whose owners also have vines in Margaux and Moulis, this wine is well proportioned and dense. Rich tannins and concentration are just part of what will become a generous, full wine. With great black-currant fruit and acidity to match, this structured wine will need to age. Drink from 2024,
title: Château Paloumey 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: In the same family since 1840, this estate lies in the north of the Médoc. In this vintage, it has produced a balanced wine, full of fruit as well as a core of tannins. It is likely to age well, its fruitiness promising much while those tannins will keep the wine firm and structured for a few more years. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Vieux Robin 2015  Médoc

description: This deep garnet colored wine has aromas of strawberry, black cherry and fennel. Opulent tannins offer a rich mouthfeel, providing a backdrop for flavors of black cherry, black currant, mocha, pencil lead and lavender that wrap up in a cranberry finish.
title: Covenant Israel 2015 Syrah (Israel)

description: Aged in neutral French oak, this has aromas that start out brooding but intriguing, with notes of raw meat, mineral, dried herb, crushed flower and huckleberry. The palate is earth-shaking in its richness and intensity, coating the palate with waves of fruit flavors. It hits the gong hard but maintains a lovely sense of balance.
title: Efeste 2015 Emmy Stone Tree Vineyard Mourvèdre (Wahluke Slope)

description: This wine erupts from the glass, with aromas of brown sugar, candied pineapple, dried orange rind and flower. Flavors are viscous, intense and rich, with a mango-filled finish that sails. It's the perfect end to any evening.
title: Gård 2014 Ice Wine Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Dark violet in the glass, this wine has aromas of blackberry, black cherry and vanilla. Flavors of black plum, blueberry, vanilla, clove and pipe tobacco are set into a framework of silky tannins that reed into a smooth cherry finish.
title: Golan Heights Winery 2014 Yarden Petit Verdot (Galilee)

description: Thrilling lime acidity and smoky, savory mineral tones meld beautifully in this delicately off-dry feinherb kabinett. It's finely textured and nimble but crisp yellow peach and apricot flavors penetrate firmly on the palate. The finish is lingering and silky, marked by hints of spice, struck flint and pollen. A fascinating wine that's likely to improve. Drink from 2020.
title: Günther Steinmetz 2016 Brauneberger Juffer Kabinett Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)

description: The faintest touch of mocha and vanilla play enticingly on the dark-cherry nose. The palate is full of ripe red cherry, has a glossy, luscious sheen of oak, but handles it very well. A more international style but still with all the hallmark freshness and brightness of Alsace. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Henri Schoenheitz 2015 Herrenreben Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This is a densely packed, powerful and ripe wine from a tremendous site in the heart of the appellation. Black cherry, dark chocolate and coconut shavings make for a rich impression on the velvety palate, with plenty of toasted oak for support. This wine will do well in the cellar. Enjoy from 2024–2034.
title: Heritance 2014 Beckstoffer Georges III Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: Grenache (69%) takes the lead on this wine, followed by Mourvèdre (26%) and a pinch of Syrah. Aged in neutral French oak, it offers aromas that aren't yet ready to reveal their charms on first pour. Notes of spice, herb and black pepper evolve into smoked meat and raspberry accents over time. The palate is swoon-worthy, with soft, supple fruit and savory flavors that lead to a persistent finish. The sense of purity dazzles.
title: Kerloo 2015 Majestic Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The merest hint of mandarin peel plays on the nose. This is heightened on the slender, dry palate which seems to have a pithy depth of citrus peel and the airy lightness of a cloud of mandarin. There is ample freshness here as well as elegance and persistence. The finish is off-dry and long.
title: Kuentz-Bas 2015 Trois Châteaux Muscat Ottonel (Alsace)

description: At first, this wine smells a bit burnt. But airing allows this gran reserva to show mature aromas of grilled beef, dry leaves and spice. Hard tannins make for a rubbery mouthfeel, but savory flavors of leafy plum and berry fruits bring it around. A finish with baked fruit and chocolate flavors concludes this classical Rioja. Drink through 2025.
title: Larchago 2008 Pagos de Tahola Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Blackberry aromas are deep and ripe, with woodsy side notes. A powerful palate is sinewy but not overly rugged or tannic. Blackberry and toasty flavors of chocolate and brown sugar smolder across a strident finish; drink through 2022.
title: Los Frailes 2014 Sinergia Cabernet Sauvignon (Valencia)

description: Tangs of lime and salt penetrate through delicately sweet layers of grapefruit and tangerine in this pristine, laser-edged Riesling. It's spine tingling yet honeyed by a long, intensely mineral finish.
title: Maximin Grünhäuser 2016 Herrenberg Superior Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, cedar and underbrush lead the nose on this savory blend of Merlot, Syrah, Cabernet and Sangiovese. The chewy palate delivers black-currant jam, mocha and star anise alongside polished, velvety tannins. Drink through 2027.
title: Michele Satta 2014 Piastraia  (Bolgheri Superiore)

description: Rounded black currants and a hint of prune mix with chocolate and black pepper on the nose of this very rich and powerful bottling from Paso Robles. The palate is thick and gooey with pepper spice cutting through the black-plum-cake flavors. Firm tannins and enduring acidity hold everything in check.
title: Nelle 2015 Syrah (California)

description: Blackberry and prune aromas are smoky and suggest hoisin or barbecue sauce. This Monastrell-Garnacha blend is a bit drawing and wiry on the palate, while flavors of toasty oak, blueberry and savory plum are bold. Oak character dominates a clampy, grating finish. Drink through 2023.
title: Pago Casa Gran 2015 Casa Benasal Crux Red (Valencia)

description: Full body and lots of toasted oak character give this reserve-style wine plenty of impact in the aroma, flavor and finish. Tempting scents of toasted almonds, vanilla and grilled baguette lead to concentrated pear, butter and cream on the palate, while the texture is powerful and velvety.
title: Rubino Estates Winery 2015 Landmark Collection Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Red cherry, rust, cinnamon, vanilla and wet herbs make for a crisp and compelling nose on this bottling by winemaker Tim Slater, who manages to elicit cooler climate properties from a warmer region. A wide array of herbs, including thyme, oregano, marjoram and sage, decorate the firmly structured hibiscus, red currant and cranberry backdrop. The acid goes deep into the finish.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Clara Valley)

description: This is a mouthwatering, succulent kabinett chock full of sweet-tart guava and white grapefruit flavors. It's silken and sweet yet elegantly spry and mineral. Delightful now but likely to hold well through 2026.
title: Schloss Saarstein 2016 Schloss Saarsteiner Kabinett Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: This ripe, wood-aged wine is packed with rich black fruits as well a firmly tannic structure. The dense character of this wine and its dry core promise aging. It comes from vineyards in the Douro Superior region, which is becoming the place to be for Douro red wines. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Symington Family Estates 2015 Altano Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Chewy and intensely herbal, this bold, powerfully built wine is bittersweet in tobacco and cigar box elements. The fruit leans into dark cherry and cassis, with a dusting of cocoa powder seasoned seductively throughout.
title: Trinchero 2014 Mario's Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Made entirely with Chardonnay, this opens with aromas of yellow stone fruit, Spanish broom, toasted nut and a whiff of sage. The aromas follow over to the palate along with mature golden apple, bread crust, ginger and dried citrus zest alongside an elegant, persistent perlage. Fresh acidity lifts the dry finish.
title: Villa Crespia NV Dosaggio Zero  (Franciacorta)

description: Exhibiting all that one could hope from a coastal site, this wine offers earthy rose petal aromas around a tightly wound core of forest and tea. Structured tannin provide a framework for secondary characteristics to develop in the glass, from cranberry and orange peel to Asian five spice.
title: Talisman 2014 Wildcat Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a light, ethereal and hugely satisfying wine, delicately layered and soft in texture. Huckleberry, Asian five spice and forest floor figure prominently along a succulent persistence of acidity and salty freshness.
title: Whistler 2014 Estate Grown Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This single-vineyard wine is rock solid, with punchy black-cherry fruit, a streak of mineral and a sprinkling of coffee grounds. Clean earth and graphite add more complexity, and the tannins—ripe and sturdy—provide a perfect foundation. The wine was aged for 17 months in one-third new French oak, and should drink well into 2028.
title: WildAire 2015 Fairsing Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: This is an inaugural blend of 75% Merlot and 25% Cabernet Franc made by Dan Petroski of Larkmead for the new producer. The grapes come from vineyards located near the winery in Oak Knoll. Dried herb de Provence aromas invite one in to mingle with aspects of cedar, pencil and red currant, the style subdued and soft. Layers of quiet power and oak lie beneath the fruit.
title: Ashes & Diamonds 2014 No. 1 Grand Vin Merlot-Cabernet Franc (Oak Knoll District)

description: Candied black cherry, rosebuds, violets and a minty tobacco quality all show on the nose of this countywide blend by Bruno D'Alfonso. It commands attention on the palate, showing black currant, blueberry, black-pepper-crusted beef and candied violet flavors, balanced by strong acidity.
title: Badge 2014 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Roasted cocoa, espresso cream and caramel provide richness to the nose of this Cabernet Sauvignon-led blend, but there's also bright black raspberry fruit and hints of pepper and fennel to give complexity. The palate starts with a zip, which dissipates into flavors of lilac, blueberry and anise seed.
title: Bishop's Peak 2014 Elevation Red (Paso Robles)

description: The 70% of Merlot in the blend of this wine gives it richness and ripe red-berry fruits. The tannins, dusty and spicy, are a blend of the wood aging and the structure of the Cabernet Sauvignon. Ripe and juicy, the wine is packed with fruit and likely to age well. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Anthonic 2015  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Ripe, and densely textured, this wine shows an impressive, rich balance between fruit and tannins, with a dry core and broad black fruits that have great intensity. This wine, with 12 months in wood, conveys spice, concentration and excellent potential. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Biston-Brillette 2015  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: With its fine fruit, and balanced acidity, this is a rich, structured wine. Its black-currant fruit is juicy and crisp, with a firm. dry background. The wine has good potential, opening to generous fruitiness as it ages. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: Made by the same winemaking team as the top estate of Château Ducru-Beaucaillou in Saint-Julien, this wine comes from a long-time Borie family estate. The wine, with its layers of rich blackberry fruits and firm, dusty tannins, is concentrated, dark and certain to age well. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Fourcas-Borie 2015  Listrac-Médoc

description: Run by the Nony family, this 17-acre estate has produced a generous, rounded wine dominated by black fruits. The barrel aging has enhanced the black-currant flavors and the acidity. All these elements are coming together in a full wine that will age well. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Labat 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: A dense wine with great fruit, this has a velvet texture and great elegance. There is structure of course from the firm tannins that stay in the background, while the main thrust of this wine is its great blackberry fruit. It will age and should be drunk from 2025.
title: Château Lalande-Borie 2015  Saint-Julien

description: This wine is dense and packed with tannins. Its weight and smoky character balance against the generous black currants. Juiciness and acidity go together with the generous structure. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2015 Le Petit Mouton  (Pauillac)

description: This rich wine comes from a historic estate in Listrac, dating to the 18th century. It offers tannins and a dry core as well as dark black fruits and acidity, giving the wine its structure and potential longevity. The wine will develop slowly and will be ready to drink from 2025.
title: Château Saransot-Dupré 2015  Listrac-Médoc

description: Old vines on the estate, close to the ancient city walls of Saint-Émilion, produce this smoothly ripe wine. It is broad, generously rich with black fruits. The toast from wood aging will integrate with time. Wait until 2024 for this impressive wine to be ready to drink.
title: Clos des Menuts 2015 L'Excellence  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Klipsun, Kiona, Bacchus, Red Willow and Sagemoor vineyards. Aged in half-new French oak, it offers aromas of dried leaf, cocoa, cigar box and barrel spice that lead to focused, slightly compact cherry flavors. Firm, tightly wound tannins provide support. It needs time in the cellar to stretch its legs, and will be best after 2021.
title: Efeste 2014 Big Papa Old Vines Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Aromas reminiscent of bread crust, nut and orchard fruit carry over to the vibrant linear palate along with pomegranate and citrus zest notes. Bright acidity and a lively elegant perlage provide support and energy.
title: Fratelli Berlucchi 2010 Casa delle Colonne Zero  (Franciacorta)

description: Woodland berry, dark culinary spice, tilled earth and new leather aromas combine with whiffs of aromatic herb on this fragrant graceful red. The vibrant palate is all about balance and finesse, offering strawberry, red cherry, star anise and a hint of white pepper balanced by bright acidity and polished tannins. If you love extreme elegance, this is for you. Drink through 2024.
title: Gracciano della Seta 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Inky red-violet in color, this wine offers aromas of black currant and blueberry. It fills the palate with flavors of cassis, blackberry, juniper and anise. Mildly stiff tannins recede into a bright finish, laced with touches of iodine and smoke.
title: Hayotzer 2014 Special Edition Cabernet Sauvignon (Galilee)

description: Deep garnet to the eye, this wine has a nose of lingonberry, raspberry and a touch of rosemary. Soft tannins provide a framework for flavors of tart cherry, strawberry, clove and chocolate, with a touch of smoked meat. The pleasing finish provides a lingering sense of brightness on the palate.
title: Hayotzer 2014 Virtuoso Merlot (Galilee)

description: The 40% new French oak seems just right, putting a toasty frame around robust black-cherry fruit. There's a spicy zip to the back-half flavors, and a clean lingering finish with highlights of mocha and smoke.
title: Iota Cellars 2014 Pelos Sandberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: A robust and flavorful Chardonnay, this exhibits superb balance between the ripe fruit, woodspice and vibrant acidity. Notes of baked apple, clove-spiked orange, toasted hazelnut and peach pit abound on the nose and palate, with added hits of citrus pith, honeysuckle and lemon verbena that add grace and elegance. It's medium in weight, with a lightly textured grip and lively acidity that lifts the sweet-spiced finish. It's hard to resist now, but should mature well through 2023.
title: Jardin 2015 Nine Yards Chardonnay (Stellenbosch)

description: This is a smoky and herbaceous version of the variety, with big, bold flavors of black cherry, blackberry and cured meat. Powerfully built in brawny tannin, it finishes soft and seductively.
title: Jarvis 2013 Estate Grown Cave Fermented Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: This wine has a classic nose of pencil shavings, cedar and ripe black plum, following through on the palate in similar fashion. Full bodied and highly concentrated, it layers in flavors of cherry compote and dark chocolate.
title: Joseph Carr 2014 Revelist Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: From the winery's Mountain Terrace Vineyard 1,700-feet up, this is a floral, subdued and brightly woven red wine. Vanilla and milk chocolate flavors provide a richness and likability, with a pronounced bite of oak and tannin on the finish.
title: Ledson 2014 Estate Vineyard Merlot (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

description: This wine has inviting caramel-apple aromatics, which follow along a subdued palate of ripe texture and oak. A brightness of orange blossom and tangerine add freshness and vibrancy to the lush fig-filled surroundings, dotted in nutmeg.
title: Martinelli 2015 Bella Vigna Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Heady aromas of sun-kissed mango, peach and melon are cut by blades of steel and stone in this captivating kabinett. It's delightfully spry in texture, offering loads of crisp-tart yellow peach and nectarine flavors highlighted against streaks of lime acidity. The finish is fresh and mineral-laden.
title: Maximin Grünhäuser 2016 Abtsberg Kabinett Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: This reserve-level best-barrel blend spent 16 months in 40% new oak. It's dark, chewy and toasty, with black cherry, black coffee and dark chocolate all in the mix of flavors. A solid and substantial wine, it drinks well young and may best be consumed over the next five years.
title: Megan Anne 2015 Black Love Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Ripe berry aromas with a touch of root beer are lush and soft. That is not the case on the palate, which is tight in the middle and scratchy along the edges. Blueberry and black-currant flavors are a touch minty, while this wine displays chocolate and lemon-peel notes on a tough, pulling finish. Drink through 2030.
title: Monteabellón 2012 Finca Matambres  (Ribera del Duero)

description: This is a stainless steel bottling done right. Citrusy aromas of lime peel, orange pith, just-ripe Asian pear and a flash of sweet butter show on the nose. The texture is phenomenally grippy on the sip, where flavors of crushed chalk meet with yuzu zest, nectarine and white peach, remain brisk throughout. Pink-grapefruit zest carries the finish.
title: Morgan 2015 Metallico Unoaked Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Enticing scents of bread dough, ripe white peach and chopped herb mingle together on this. Firmly structured and bone dry, the quenching linear palate offers yellow apple, citrus zest and a white pepper note set against crisp acidity and an elegant perlage.
title: Mosnel NV Pas Dosé  (Franciacorta)

description: The Quartz is a bit flashier than Mullineux's other soil-specific bottlings, with pronounced notes of roasted apple skin, orange oil, pressed yellow flowers, juicy pear and even a hint of fresh guava. The palate is full and opulent, though deftly balanced by vibrant acidity and a lingering flavor of spiced-pear tart. Drink now–2026.
title: Mullineux 2015 Quartz Chenin Blanc (Swartland)

description: This is based upon a single Dijon 115 clone, and delivers potent ripe black-cherry flavors. It's a full-throttle bottle, textural and lightly touched with dried seaweed. The barrel aging adds a welcome touch of chocolate to the powerful tannic finish.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Durant Vineyard Madrone Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This bright, big and mouthfilling wine was fermented with wild yeast, which seems to infuse it with a dollop of mystery. Ultraripe lemon and grapefruit come with a hint of marshmallow and plenty of toasted-peanut flavors. It finds a smooth runway and coasts gently to a gliding stop, with those toasty flavors still resonating.
title: Ponzi 2015 Avellana Vineyard Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Based at Quinta de Roriz in the Douro, this wine is produced by a joint venture between the Prats family of Bordeaux and the Symington family of the Douro. Made as a second wine to Chryseia, it is soft and rich, with great tannins and ripe fruit. Black currants and acidity go together with a young, dry core. Drink from 2020.
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2015 Post Scriptum de Chryseia Red (Douro)

description: The texture of this wine balances tannins and ripe black fruits. The perfumes and the crisp acidity come through strongly. These elements make for a dense wine, with a dry core and a rich surround. It will be best from 2026.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2015 Vintage  (Port)

description: Based on old Tinta Roriz vines, this elegant wine is ripe and densely structured, with good balance between red fruits and juicy acidity. It is a wine to age for several more years. Drink from 2021.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2015 Referência Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: New leather, baked plum, truffle and fruitcake aromas rise up from the glass. It's rounded and full bodied, with velvety tannins that underscore fig, steeped prune, cinnamon, graphite and chewing tobacco. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors. Drink through 2023.
title: Nino Negri 2013 Sfursat Carlo Negri  (Sforzato di Valtellina)

description: Yellow flower, bread crust, ripe orchard fruit and graphite scents mingle together in the glass. It's loaded with finesse, offering Golden Delicious apple, peach and tangerine zest balanced by bright acidity and a refined perlage.
title: Ronco Calino 2010 Brut  (Franciacorta)

description: All Dijon clones from the Alloro vineyard, this tightly wound effort mixes tree-fruit flesh and skin flavors in a compact balanced wine with some good years of life ahead. There's a pleasing nuttiness resonating through the finish, from a small percentage that was fermented in new French oak. Give it an extra year or two in bottle and it should open up nicely.
title: Alloro 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This lovely wine shows its dark side throughout, mixing black fruits with strong flavors of black coffee. Barrel aging, just under a year in one-quarter new French oak, brings up flavors of dark chocolate and chicory. It's delicious and substantial, ready for drinking over the next half decade or longer.
title: Ayoub 2015 Memoirs Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Demeter-certified biodynamic grapes go into the making of this light and delicate wine—a fine example of coastal cooling. Layered in earthy rose petal and cardamom, it shows length and breadth around a quiet core of tart rhubarb and pomegranate.
title: Benziger 2015 Signaterra La Reyna Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: A blend of 90% Chardonnay and 10% Pinot Nero, this refined sparkler opens with heady aromas of white wild flower, citrus and a whiff of bread crust. On the lively palate, fresh acidity brightens creamy white peach, Golden Delicious apple and lemon drop. A brioche note wraps up the finish.
title: Berlucchi NV '61 Brut  (Franciacorta)

description: Bright and savory, this refreshing, polished sparkler boasts alluring aromas of juicy raspberry, wild cherry, baking spice and a whiff of bread crust. The inviting aromas follow over to the vibrant palate along with a continuous refined perlage. A tangy candied nectarine note closes the finish.
title: Berlucchi NV '61 Rosé  (Franciacorta)

description: Coming from one of the state's top Syrah vineyards, this offers high-toned aromas of potpourri, red and blue fruit, sage, bacon fat, iron and spice. These lead to supple, restrained smoked meat and red-fruit flavors, stretching out on the finish. It brings a sense of elegance, taking some time to get going before strutting its stuff.
title: Betz Family 2015 La Serenne Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)

description: Bright and delicately scented, this elegant sparkler evokes aromas of spring wild flower, white stone fruit and crushed herb. The bright palate offers Rennet apple, Anjou pear, pastry cream and tangy lemon drop. It's balanced with fresh acidity while a silky mousse lends finesse.
title: Bonafidi NV Nobilium Brut  (Franciacorta)

description: Exotic spice, pressed violet and woodland-berry aromas create an inviting bouquet. The linear elegant palate delivers tart cherry, strawberry, licorice and white pepper while bright acidity and firm refined tannins provide balance and support. A note of orange zest closes the finish. It's still young so give it time to fully blossom. Drink 2019–2028.
title: Boscarelli 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: In the opulent, concentrated school of thought this wonderful luxurious-tasting wine is shaped by very ripe fruit flavors and generous helpings of suave oak. Flavors run from marzipan to honeysuckle and poached pears, and a nicely viscous texture fills the mouth and helps the finish linger.
title: Cedarville Vineyard 2016 Estate Viognier (El Dorado)

description: Gentle ripe, red cherry makes for an appetizing opening on the nose. The same fruit is vivid on the smooth and fluid palate where freshness gives wonderful direction. The tannins exercise their fine grip with elegance. This has lovely depth, elegance and resonance.
title: Domaine Charles Frey 2015 F Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This wine is a blend of Merlot (61%) and Cabernet Franc. High-toned aromas of black raspberry, plum, black licorice, herb and barrel spice lead to plush, plentiful red- and black-fruit flavors. It brings a very pretty sense of styling along with a lengthy finish. Give it some time to open up.
title: Efeste 2014 Nana Willow Vineyard Red (Yakima Valley)

description: Intense aromas of dusty slate and flint show prominently but there's also plenty of ripe, penetrating yellow-peach and nectarine flavors waiting to burst through. High toned acidity and a fine, filigreed texture mark the midpalate. It's a complex, faceted wine that should meld further from 2021–2030.
title: Fritz Haag 2016 Brauneberger Juffer Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: A dark color and charred, lemony black-fruit aromas announce a wine that's loaded with hard-pounding oak and tannins. This wine tastes super-toasty, blackened and slightly burnt, with black-fruit flavors at the center. This will work best if quality oak applied in abundance is your thing; drink through 2028.
title: García Figuero 2014 Viña Viejas  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Truffle, new leather, menthol, star anise and red berry are just some of the aromas you'll find on this perfumed red. Made with 95% Sangiovese and 5% Canaiolo, the medium-bodied palate offers juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry compote and licorice set against fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.
title: Gracciano della Seta 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Notes of white grapefruit, apple and pear are obscured in layers of smoke, dark herb and mineral, but with a few years in the cellar, these intense earth and mineral complexities should soften and meld. This is a spine tingling, concentrated and complex wine that's worth waiting till 2021 to uncork.
title: Günther Steinmetz 2016 Brauneberger Riesling (Mosel)

description: Own-rooted Pommard clone Pinot Noir, planted in 1972, is the focal point for a wine rich in texture and detail. The mix of black fruits carries highlights of coffee and char, from aging for 20 months in a small percentage of new French oak. The finish sneaks up on you and lingers gracefully. As with all the Holloran wines, clarity and balance are first and foremost.
title: Holloran 2014 Le Pavillon Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Pristine lime and grapefruit tones are flourished by spring blossoms in this invigorating dry Riesling. Spry and racy, it offers a crush of fresh citrus flavors that dart and skip like laser beams on the palate. The finish is lean but meandering. Drink now through 2035.
designation: Johannisberger Auf der Höll Trocken Erste Lage
title: Johannishof 2016 Johannisberger Auf der Höll Trocken Erste Lage Riesling (Rheingau)

description: This is round and pretty, and seems, at least for now, to be a bit more accessible than some of the more compact and ageworthy 2015 single-vineyard selections from Ken Wright. Drink it up soon, and enjoy the light touches of orange peel and cinnamon highlights.
title: Ken Wright 2015 Tanager Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: This six-acre Malbec vineyard is one of a handful planted in Bourg and Blaye where the grape now ripens more easily than in the past. This Bordeaux view of the grape is rich, with warm tannins and black fruit along with acidity and spice. This powerful, ripe wine from Tutiac's single-variety, single-parcel range should age, so drink from 2020.
title: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2015 Lieu-Dit Ter Pointe  (Côtes de Bourg)

description: This is the third release of a wine from a new venture by Niepoort into the Dâo region. Made from 100-year-old vines, it celebrates two local grapes, Baga and Jaen, which dominate the blend. It is structured, firm and has intense fruit as well as tannins. The wine is young, fruity, elegant and has a good future. Drink from 2021.
title: Niepoort 2015 Conciso Red (Dão)

description: Still young, with sharp barrel flavors, this will need another year or two of bottle age to fully smooth out. Punchy, tart apple and peach fruit is bright and toasty, with a touch of brioche. Give it that extra bottle age, and drink after 2020.
title: Phelps Creek 2015 Lynette Chardonnay (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: Fragrant woodland berry, blue flower and cake spice aromas mingle with a balsamic menthol note. The concentrated but almost weightless palate offers juicy raspberry, fleshy black cherry, espresso and star anise alongside polished supple tannins.
title: Poliziano 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Smooth and showing primary bready flavors, this has a concentrated core of apple and quince, with plenty of barrel flavors. Roasted peanuts, lemon zest and a touch of salted caramel come up, but this young wine really needs another year or two in bottle to show its best.
title: Ponzi 2015 Aurora Vineyard Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Zesty, aromatic notes of lemon and tangerine carry the nose. The palate then bursts forth with ripe citrus: tangerine, orange and mandarin. This off-dry version of Sylvaner may be unusual but it is a triumph of balance. The concentrated, zesty freshness of citrus is countered by the ripeness of the fruit on a very light, fresh, concentrated and compelling palate. This is intriguing and irresistible.
title: René Muré 2016 Cuvée Oscar Sylvaner (Alsace)

description: Dominated by dark-colored, dense Alicante Bouschet, this is a rich wine. Its tannins are still up front, although watch for the rich black fruits as they develop. Aged in wood, it has vanilla and spice flavors that enhance the ripe fruit of the wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Ribafreixo 2014 Gáudio Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a small-production wine from a former French soccer player. It is soft, with great fruit and a rounded texture. Generous while also dense, it's powered by firm tannins. Drink this ripe wine from 2025.
title: Sol Béni 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine is all Cinsault from Olsen Vineyard. Aged in neutral French oak, it's resplendent with aromas of raspberry jam, potpourri, plum, flower and garrigue. The palate is transparent in style with elegant but rich red-fruit and plum flavors that lead to a lengthy, warm finish.
title: Two Vintners 2015 Make Haste Cinsault (Yakima Valley)

description: Dense aromas of strawberry, mace and vanilla combine for an alluringly rich experience on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Notes of clove, allspice and gingerbread rise on the palate, where the background tones of mulberry and elderberry jam prove elegant and interesting.
title: Velvet Bee 2013 Bentrock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Secondary characters of smoke, soy sauce and dried leaves take the fore, with dried strawberries and flowers chiming in. There's a roundness and softness to the palate, which embraces more autumn forest characters amidst nicely structured tannins. Drink now–2025.
title: Wicks 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)

description: This wine is spicy, savory and dense—a full-bodied wine from the sparkling wine producer which farms throughout the appellation. Buzzing acidity lies beneath a hearty helping of black cherry, strawberry and cola.
title: WindVane 2015 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Plush and candied aromas of red cherry compote, rum butter, vanilla and mulling spice show on the nose of this bottling. Opulent cherry and rhubarb flavors mix with dark spice, bay leaf and tarragon on the palate, all riding a compelling texture with sizzling acidity.
title: Wrath 2015 KW Ranch Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a dense wine, packed with black fruits and rich tannins. The dominance of Cabernet Sauvignon gives the wine its ripe, juicy black-currant flavors and good acidity. This 56-acre estate has made a wine that will age well. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Clauzet 2015  Saint-Estèphe

description: This wine comes from an historic 700-acre estate in the southern Médoc that's home to vines, forests and stallions. The wine is ripe and full of black currants from its majority of Cabernet Sauvignon. Rich and packed with generous fruit, the wine shows the progress the property has made in recent years. It still holds plenty of tannins, so age further and drink from 2023.
title: Château de Malleret 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: Powered with tannins and dense black fruit, this parcel from the Simard vineyard fully justifies its separate bottling. This wine is ripe, structured and firm, with layers of black fruit and rich tannins. The finish brings out all the fruit of the vintage. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Haut-Simard 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: The estate recalls the Pontac family, once one of the largest landowners in Bordeaux, who built this grand 16th-century hunting lodge. Today's wine is well balanced with ripe tannins, juicy red fruits and acidity. The 60% Merlot gives a full, generous character, although the tannins need time to soften. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Pontac Monplaisir 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a supple and sexy version of a notoriously tannic wine. It has a deep dark color, enticing dark chocolate and blackberry aromas and a thick layer of berries and black cherries on the palate. Tightly meshed tannins give it plenty of pucker power, and mean that this wine can age for quite a while. Best from 2020 to 2025.
title: Concannon 2014 Reserve Polo Field Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

description: Clean aromas of cinnamon, dried rose petals and tight raspberry fruit make for a very pretty nose on this lighter delicate style of Grenache. The palate is quite fresh, with cherry, cranberry, orange rind, dried ginger, cracker pepper and sumac flavorings combining for a very refreshing, elegant bottling.
title: Crawford Family 2015 Kimsey Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

description: This wine exhibits a beautifully pristine, precise and elegant character. It opens with delicate scents of apple flesh, orange blossom, saline and just a hint of toasted, earthy spice. That briny, mineral seam continues to shine on the palate, dancing through the fresh fruit flavors and leaving a lip-smacking kiss on the finish. A stunner now, this will continue to evolve and mature well through 2022.
title: Crystallum 2015 The Agnes Chardonnay (Western Cape)

description: This wine offers aromas of black, cherry, raspberry and violet. The tannins are barely noticeable at first, slowly building as flavors of cherry, cassis, violet and chocolate-covered espresso bean make their way across the palate. Hints of spice and cherry are evident throughout the prolonged finish.
title: Dalton 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Galilee)

description: Utilizing Pommard clones planted in 1990, this exceptional wine has a nose-tickling funky note, providing a rich composty accent to juice loaded with raspberry and cherry fruit. It's detailed and textural, a truly engaging wine which goes well beyond the fruit to add the sort of complexity not often found in this price range.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Balcombe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Thick, firm tannin is pronounced in this reserve-level wine. Coconut and vanilla-seasoned oak rides along a roadway of dried herb, clove and blackberry as the texture softens and teases in complexity.
title: Pride Mountain 2014 Vintner Select Merlot (Sonoma County)

description: This impressive single-quinta wine is packed with fruit and plenty of the firm tannins. Ripe, perfumed and with touches of sweetness, it will age well. Drink from 2027.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2015 Vintage  (Port)

description: With its north-facing aspect, this vineyard is just right for red wines rather than Port. A cool character comes through even in ageworthy wines such as this. Firm tannins mix in with the juicy red fruits and crisp aftertaste. Wood aging adds spice and rounds out the wine. Drink from 2021.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2014 Quinta dos Aciprestes Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Cool, intensely mineral tones of slate and river rock permeate from nose to finish. It's dry on the palate but elegantly fruity, offering notes of crisp stone fruit, tangerine and lime. Piercing acidity leads a long, thrilling finish. It's a lovely wine already but likely to show even better from 2019.
title: Robert Weil 2016 Kiedricher Trocken Ortswein Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Tasty, spicy oak nuances give a great lift to this frankly heavy, massively built wine that is very full bodied and has a thick layer of chewy tannins. Hints of toasted walnuts, cinnamon and nutmeg weave through dark chocolate, blackberry and espresso flavors that are concentrated and deep.
title: Rubino Estates Winery 2015 Riserva Collection Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

description: Bright and forward on the nose, this leads with attractive scents of lemon custard, verbena and grilled pineapple. The palate is plush and round, yet not overdone, boasting lush flavors of toasted apple and citrus oil that linger on the close. Bright acidity keeps the weight in check and lends a mouthwatering sensation on the finish. Time will encourage added depth and complexity, so consider drinking 2020–2024.
title: Rustenberg 2015 Five Soldiers Chardonnay (Simonsberg-Stellenbosch)

description: Again in 2015 this offers reserve-level density and extra complexity, with the added bonus that it's the winery's biggest production Pinot. Winemaker Tony Rynders loads it with appealing cinnamon, caramel and milk chocolate components from aging in half new French oak. This is all nicely integrated into a base of fresh raspberry fruit. Tasty and ready for near-term drinking.
title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2015 Pinot Noir

description: Dusty mineral tones juxtapose pristine lime and lemon in this zesty, steely wine. While dry and light footed, it has an expansive, juicy richness that's satisfying through a long finish.
title: Schloss Saarstein 2016 Alte Reben Riesling (Mosel)

description: A little reserved at first, with time this opens up to reveal notes of pressed fynbos, dandelion, fresh straw, apple blossom and crushed mineral that grace the just-ripe apple and green-melon core. Surprisingly round and mouth-filling, that weight is countered by a stunningly vibrant seam of citrusy acidity and spiced tones of allspice and nutmeg. Final notes of grilled apple skin and pie crust dance on the lingering finish. Drink now–2026.
title: The Blacksmith 2015 Vin Blanc Chenin Blanc (Swartland)
