description: This is an intensely youthful blend of 48% Cabernet Sauvignon, 21% Syrah, 21% Cabernet Franc and 10% Malbec. Concentrated flavors of black cherry, blackberry, cured meat and black licorice are well wrapped within a cocoon of toasted oak and firm tannins. Enjoy 2025–2030.
title: Viader 2015 Estate Limited Edition Red (Napa Valley)

description: Z'IVO's Pinot Blanc is an obscure clone called Gouges, after the Burgundy winery that first isolated it. It's exceptionally dense, textural and racy, with scents and mouthfeel close to Chablis, with the same underlying minerality. Oyster shells and sea-breeze accents come with tart melon fruit and a touch of lime zest.
title: Z'IVO 2013 Pinot Blanc (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: All Dijon clones from the Alloro vineyard, this tightly wound effort mixes tree-fruit flesh and skin flavors in a compact balanced wine with some good years of life ahead. There's a pleasing nuttiness resonating through the finish, from a small percentage that was fermented in new French oak. Give it an extra year or two in bottle and it should open up nicely.
title: Alloro 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Blackberry, leather and plum aromas are inviting. This wine is full and lush on the palate, with grippy tannins. Oaky berry flavors are accented by spice and chocolate notes, while the finish brings pronounced coffee and mocha flavors. Drink through 2025.
title: 12 Linajes 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

description: This reserve has the same detail and overall finesse as the regular estate bottling, but here there's an extra dollop of black fruits. Overall, the 12-barrel select is a bit bigger and fruitier, but much in the same style.
title: Alloro 2015 Estate Riservata Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Rich, ripe and downright succulent, this offers pinpoint fruit flavors of grapefruit, apple and melon, with a broad streak of vanilla cream. The length is a bit surprising, sneaking up as the wine breathes open. Though just 10% was aged in new barrels, there is a pleasing toasty frame around the finish.
title: Ayoub 2016 Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

description: A must-get for those attracted to obscure grapes, this cool vintage bottling of a northern Italian variety by Marisa Beverly (assistant winemaker at Au Bon Climat, and Jim Clendenen's niece) shows cranberry, strawberry, dried plum, baked earth and sumac-cinnamon spice on the nose. The palate offers strong loamy minerality right away, then settles into dried sage, peppery spice and tangy but dense dark fruits.
title: Bevela 2011 Matela Le Bon Climat Vineyard Teroldego (Santa Barbara County)

description: This wine comes from part of the Angélus estate that is not classified, as well as wines that are not considered right for Château Angélus. The result is an accessible, ripe wine packed with red fruits, soft tannins and attractive, juicy acidity. The wine will be ready to drink from 2024.
title: Château Angélus 2015 Carillon d'Angélus  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This wine, under the same ownership as Margaux estate Mongravey, is a well-structured blend with 70% Cabernet Sauvignon. The 100% new-wood aging gives the wine an intensely toasty, dry character at this young stage. But the great black-currant and berry fruit is developing as well. Drink this rich wine from 2024.
title: Château de Braude 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: Packed with black fruits and dense tannins, this is a rich wine with a fine future. This is full bodied and structured in feel, with a dry, spicy core of tannins. With its deep concentration, this wine will do well with time in the cellar. Drink from 2025.
title: Château du Cartillon 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine is ripe and structured. With the high percentage of Cabernet Sauvignon (48%), typical of Figeac, the black-currant fruit and pure, clean acidity shine through. As a second wine, it is soft, the tannins likely to develop quickly. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Figeac 2015 Le Petit Figeac  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This is an impressively structured and balanced wine from Patrick Meynard. Rich black fruits are nourished by the spice and toast of wood aging for 14 to 18 months.Dense and juicy, this ripe wine likely will age well. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Lalaudey 2015  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Produced under the same management as Château Larose Trintaudon, this wine is rich, smoky and packed with blackberry fruits. Its warm, ripe character contrasts with the juicy fruitiness and firm backdrop of tannins, giving a wine with potential. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Larose Perganson 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: This estate, based in the Gironde port village of Lamarque, has produced a richly textured, chocolate and bitter-cocoa-flavored wine. That is only a problem at the moment, because ripe black-currant fruits are developing under the structure to give density, concentration and a serious wine as it ages. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Malescasse 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: Evenly balanced between Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this wine, with its eucalyptus perfumes, is structured and shows its wood aging as well as fruit. With firm tannins and still young, it needs to age. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Château Pey de Pont 2015  Médoc

description: Big, ripe and packed with tannins, this is a dense wine. The concentration is palpable, rich with black plum and berry fruits. This powerful wine with its great tannins and fruit needs to age. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Sansonnet 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: Generous in its ripe Merlot, this wine is sumptuous and full bodied. Although there are plenty of tannins, they give just the right structure to this wine. From a 74-acre property that is named after the small village of Pez, the wine is rich and will age well. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Tour de Pez 2015  Saint-Estèphe

description: A classic blend of 80% Sangiovese, 10% Canaiolo and 10% Colorino, this fragrant, almost ethereal wine is all about finesse. It opens with earthy aromas of woodland berry, tilled soil, truffle, violet and new leather while the elegant palate delivers succulent Marasca cherry, crushed strawberry and baking spice. Bright acidity and polished tannins provide balance and refined support. Drink through 2028.
title: Contucci 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: This is a whopper of a Pinot Noir, seen through the eyes of a Paso Robles winemaker. Dark and thick in the glass, it shows black cherry, clove and allspice on the nose. The massive palate offers blackberry and boysenberry flavors, with spicy gingersnap notes giving balance.
title: Cordant 2015 Kessler Haak Vineyards Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This Grenache is a little older than the typical release, and that gives it some extra depth. Aromas of cranberry sauce, baking spice, rose petals, hibiscus and carnations are nose-tickling. The palate is loaded with spice cake, gingerbread and rounded, slightly sour red-cherry flavors, altogether soft and pleasing.
title: Curran 2012 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

description: Close to some of the top Margaux vineyards, this estate regularly produces some fine wines. This bottling is beautifully structured, firm with tannins and also generous with black fruits. A high percentage of Merlot gives a particularly ripe and juicy wine that will age over the medium-term. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Cambon la Pelouse 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: From vineyards surrounding the medieval moated castle, this wine is well balanced, rich and yet structured. It has great blackberry fruit and dry tannins for aging and it's coming together well. Drink from 2022.
title: Château d'Agassac 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine is firm, almost classically Pauillac in its black currants and acidity. The tannins are present behind the bright fruit and crisp texture. This wine has a dry core that will need to soften. Drink from 2025.
title: Château d'Armailhac 2015  Pauillac

description: This is a beautifully balanced, rich wine. A core of fine tannins is surrounded by ripe blackberry fruits. The wine seems accessible now, but those tannins will allow it to age well. It will be better to wait until 2022.
title: Château les Ormes Sorbet 2015  Médoc

description: Ripe and densely textured, this is a plush, full-bodied wine. With swathes of rich black fruits and some firm tannins, it has good potential. The richness contrasts with the black-currant acidity that gives this otherwise dense wine a bright, crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Lestage Simon 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: Purchased by Olivier Decelle, who also owns property in Saint-Émilion and a negociant business in Burgundy, this estate is producing impressive wines. This bottling is richly structured while preserving all the ripe blackberry fruits and intense acidity. Drink this wine from 2023.
title: Château Maurac 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine, full of dusty dry tannins as well as ripe black-currant fruit, blends equal proportions of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Its richness comes from the full fruitiness as well as the dry core that will allow the wine to age. It needs time and should not be drunk before 2024.
title: Château Pontoise Cabarrus 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: Dark and dense, this wine has good aging potential, with black fruits as well as a dry core of tannins. Minerality shows through in the texture of the wine. It is rich and generous, reflecting the vintage. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Quintus 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: Made with organically grown Pinot Nero, this vibrant sparkler has subtle aromas of wild berry, crushed herb and an apple orchard in bloom. Structured and elegant, the savory palate delivers tart red cherry, raspberry compote, baking spice and a hint of brioche set against bright acidity. Small continuous bubbles provide the refined perlage.
title: Corte Bianca 2011 Rosé  (Franciacorta)

description: Showing its age well, this pure expression of Negroamaro immediately engages the nose with aromas of concentrated berries, wild herbs and a hint of hoisin sauce. Round in feel, with structured acidity and supportive, fine-grained tannins, the palate offers a wealth of vitality in fresh red cherry, cranberry and streaks of granite. Savory herbs and earth tones linger on the finish. This is in a sweet spot now, so drink soon.
title: Cosimo Taurino 2011 Patriglione Negroamaro (Salento)

description: The nose is very shy but gives the slightest promise of ripe, red fruit. Red cherry appears in full splendor on the palate, edged by racy, exciting freshness and superfine but crunchy tannins. The body remains slender but there is a sensuous, warm core of ripe fruit. Lovely now but will develop over the coming five years. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2016 Réserve Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This is fresh, aromatic and primary in cherry aromas. The same luscious, generous fruit also dominates the juicy palate. There is freshness to balance this abundance but this is hedonistic and fruit driven to the core, with a cinnamon undertone. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2016 Strangenberg Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: The nose offers lovely touches of stone, fern and white pepper, with the freshness of green apple. There is something pristine about this wine, something light, clear and utterly moreish. The finish is clean and dry.
title: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2016 Grand A du Petit Léon Sylvaner (Alsace)

description: While feather light and ethereal in texture, there's an abundance of plump, juicy yellow cherry, guava and even strawberry fruitiness here. It's unabashedly forward and fruity yet racy and fresh. The finish lingers on a lovely floral tone.
title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Müller-Burggraef) 2016 Berncasteler Doctor Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Hints of caramelized sugar, pollen and orange peel glaze this succulent, lip-smacking Riesling. Its delicate sweetness is bolstered by sunny squirts of orange and yellow peach, but balanced neatly against a solid backbone of lime acidity. A deeply penetrating spätlese with a long burnt-sugar finish.
title: Dr. Hermann 2016 Erdener Herzlei Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: A cool, steely undertone intensifies crisp, yellow stone fruit and lime on the nose and palate. With electric, sweet-tart darts of honey and nectar, this is a piercing, concentrated wine that has a long lime-pith finish.
title: Dr. Loosen 2016 Erdener Treppchen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Intoxicating notes of exotic spice, smoke and crushed earth intensify flavors of pristine white grapefruit and peach in this tantalizing kabinett. Deeply penetrating in fruit and vibrantly balanced in acidity, it finishes with a long, crystalline finish.
title: Dr. Loosen 2016 Ürziger Würzgarten Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Scents of mature tropical fruit, walnut and bread crust segue over to the dry savory palate together with yellow apple and lemon zest. Tangy acidity brightens the rich flavors while an elegant perlage lends finesse.
title: Enrico Gatti 2011 Brut Nature  (Franciacorta)

description: Dusty earth and smoke tones are predominant on first whiff but open gradually, offering a succession of ripening fruits from fresh lime and gooseberry to crunchy peach and pink grapefruit. It's a spry, taut wine, with scintillating acidity and a long crystalline finish.
title: Fritz Haag 2016 Brauneberger Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: This wine is a blend of 49% Syrah, 38% Grenache and a whopping 13% Viognier, with the latter expressing itself on both the aromas and palate. The wine pops, with notes of freshly peeled orange, stargazer lilly, gravel, olive, smoked meat, blueberry and boysenberry. Soft and sumptuous, the palate shows a lot of elegance and expression along with an extended finish.
title: Gård 2015 Reverence Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Pronounced aromas of struck match and flint belie the intensity of fresh grapefruit and lemon at the core of this delicately off-dry wine. It's more earth and herbs than forward or fruity but there's a savory intensity here that's beguiling. It's a wine that should improve with some cellaring, try after 2020.
title: Günther Steinmetz 2016 Piesporter Treppchen von den Terrassen Riesling (Mosel)

description: This is the top cuvée from the winery, and just a single barrel was produced. It's packed with baking spices, vanilla, black tea and cardamom. These are more than highlights: they are a substantial element, along with ripe black fruits. This was all whole-cluster fermented, and aged for 18 months in barrel.
title: Gypsy Dancer 2014 Cuvée Romy Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: This typifies the best wines from this AVA, with well-matched components. Ripe sweet red berries are at the core, with accents of dried herbs and a whiff of cannabis. Everything is smoothly integrated and works well as a seamless whole.
title: J. Christopher 2015 Bieze Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: There are the typical rich aromas of blackberry pastry and black plum on the nose of this Zinfandel, but also a flowery elegance and savory hints of char. The palate is quite interesting, with powerful cracked pepper, dried herb and charred wood decorating the pure black plum backdrop and a long caramelized finish. A compelling take on Zin.
title: Labyrinth 2015 Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: This wine is super dark in hue and packed full of blackberry, wood smoke and black pepper flavors. It brings a relatively light (for the varietal) mouthfeel considering that it does have a wealth of fine-grained tannins and elevated alcohol. Drink now with a steak or chop, or cellar until 2025 for more maturity and nuance.
title: Lava Cap 2014 Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

description: This is in its infancy now, but it's remarkably refined and nuanced, showing great promise for evolution and development. Notes of melon rind, orange peel, lemon verbena and fresh fynbos fill the bouquet, while the palate offers more pithy citrus and green melon characters. It's well-balanced, with vibrant acidity and a fresh wet-stone minerality that endures through the long finish. It's hard to resist now, but it will continue to mature and hold well through 2024.
title: L'Avenir 2015 Single Block 30 Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: Fresh and creamy, this elegant sparkler boasts enticing scents of citrus blossom, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of pastry dough. The bright foaming palate doles out yellow pear, candied nectarine slice and white almond alongside a soft mousse. Fresh acidity lends balance.
title: Le Marchesine 2013 Brut Satèn  (Franciacorta)

description: While initially offering more earth than fruit, this sprightly kabinett amasses bold white peach, grapefruit and gooseberry flavors as it opens and melds. Vivacious acidity and lingering undertones of crushed earth and clay lend structure and depth. Drinks well already but should improve through 2030.
title: Maximin Grünhäuser 2016 Herrenberg Kabinett Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: This barrel selection is still tight and tannic, with compact, yet substantial cranberry, raspberry and pie-cherry fruit. It's got muscle and depth, and opens up nicely with aeration, displaying ripe and polished tannins through a long finish.
title: MonksGate 2015 Trinity Pinot Noir

description: There's strong oak, vanilla and spice cake on the nose of this rich bottling from Paso Robles vineyards as well as sugar plums and wet soil aromas. There's an earthy minerality of turned loam to the palate, with hints of forest moss, pine oil and cracked pepper.
title: Nelle 2015 Grenache (California)

description: Clean aromas of cinnamon, dried rose petals and tight raspberry fruit make for a very pretty nose on this lighter delicate style of Grenache. The palate is quite fresh, with cherry, cranberry, orange rind, dried ginger, cracker pepper and sumac flavorings combining for a very refreshing, elegant bottling.
title: Crawford Family 2015 Kimsey Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

description: This wine exhibits a beautifully pristine, precise and elegant character. It opens with delicate scents of apple flesh, orange blossom, saline and just a hint of toasted, earthy spice. That briny, mineral seam continues to shine on the palate, dancing through the fresh fruit flavors and leaving a lip-smacking kiss on the finish. A stunner now, this will continue to evolve and mature well through 2022.
title: Crystallum 2015 The Agnes Chardonnay (Western Cape)

description: This wine offers aromas of black, cherry, raspberry and violet. The tannins are barely noticeable at first, slowly building as flavors of cherry, cassis, violet and chocolate-covered espresso bean make their way across the palate. Hints of spice and cherry are evident throughout the prolonged finish.
title: Dalton 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Galilee)

description: This wine sees 40% French oak and is a reserve-level barrel selection. Soft and smooth, the pretty berry and plum fruit has a touch of mocha, but not too much. It's had ample bottle time to be ready to enjoy immediately.
title: De Ponte Cellars 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Coming from one of the state's premier Syrah vineyards, the aromas pop, with notes of boysenberry, bacon fat, orange peel, herb and spice. The palate is dense and rich, packed with ultraripe blue- and black-fruit flavors. It delivers a lot of hedonistic appeal. For those looking for a big, bold, warm vintage Syrah, this one's for you.
title: Efeste 2015 Jolie Bouche Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)

description: This wine is delightfully fruit-forward in cherry cola and strawberry jam, balancing the strong well-defined flavors against a backdrop of powerful tannin and oak.
title: Eric Kent 2015 Sascha Marie Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Savory and vibrant, this bright polished sparkler delivers aromas and flavors of red cherry, crushed raspberry, Rennet apple, tangy nectarine and bread crust. Refreshing acidity and a lively, refined perlage lift the finish.
title: Ferghettina 2013 Brut Rosé  (Franciacorta)

description: Aromas of cherry, raspberry and coffee bean set the stage for flavors of black cherry, blackberry, apple peel, white chocolate and baking spice. Opulent tannins coat palate, making way for a juicy, blueberry pie flavored finish.
title: Golan Heights Winery 2013 Gilgal Cabernet Sauvignon (Galilee)

description: The Latchkey vineyard is shared with Cody Wright (of Purple Hands). Spicy cranberry, strawberry and raspberry fruit shines here, young and fresh and vibrant. It's snappy and sappy, with good grip and supporting acidity. It should drink best in the early 2020s.
title: Ken Wright 2015 Latchkey Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: There's a dusty character to the tannins, which complement the tart pomegranate and raspberry fruit. It's already quite smooth, lightly toasty and finished with a dollop of cinnamon.
title: Ken Wright 2015 Savoya Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: This shows power and richness with a bit of finesse as well. Accompanying a deep, dark hue are equally dense aromas of black cherry and blackberry, cola, cocoa and a hint of dried herbs. The palate comes with chewy tannins and more plush fruit, but this well-structured wine should come into its own with great dignity soon enough. Drink 2020–2032.
title: Kilikanoon 2013 Oracle Shiraz (Clare Valley)

description: This is a terrific wine from a classic estate which sits at 2,700 in the Sierra Foothills. It offers rich vanilla and cream aromas, with abundant pear and nutmeg flavor balanced by subtle acidity.
title: Lava Cap 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (El Dorado)

description: Leeuwin's characteristic elegance and approachability, combined with ageability, are in full force here. Trademark pencil lead, eucalyptus and red currant characters mingle with dried flowers, herbs and furniture polish. The tannins are dusty and tight-grained, with an herbaceous currant flavor continuing throughout. Drink now–2032.
title: Leeuwin Estate 2014 Prelude Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)

description: This wine from Matchbook has been improving steadily over recent vintages and now it's taken a big step toward more finesse and less flash. A very soothing mouthfeel and generous, but not overt, flavors make a great combination in this creamy, yummy and full-bodied wine. It has everything from toasty oak and lemon curd to mild marzipan nuances that interlace with good acidity for a balanced palate and a lingering finish.
title: Matchbook 2016 Estate Bottled Old Head Chardonnay (Dunnigan Hills)

description: Tinta Negra is a hybrid grape that takes on the characteristics of other Madeira grapes. To taste, this oak-aged wine could almost be a Bual. Smooth and rich, it has a sweet toffee and caramel character to go alongside the intense acidity. Drink now.
title: Miles 1996 Tinta Negra Mole (Madeira)

description: Delicately wood aged, this wine is beautifully structured and balanced. Ripe apple and quince fruits are cut with acidity and a clean, clear minerality. The wine needs to age for a while and will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Niepoort 2016 Redoma Branco Reserva White (Douro)

description: Black fruits dominate this full-bodied block selection. The alcohol is pulled back a half step from the previous vintage, and there's a pleasing minerality to the foundation. A hint of caraway comes up as it winds down through the chocolatey finish.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Balcombe Vineyard Block 1B Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Blue flower, Asian spice and wild berry aromas mingle with a whiff of espresso. The rounded generous palate offers baked plum, fleshy blackberry, licorice and a hint of mocha alongside supple tannins. Drink through 2023.
title: Poggio alla Sala 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Seriously wood aged, this reserva is meant to be matured over several years. Firm tannins, rich black fruits and concentration provide the aging potential. It's a rich, dense wine, still with its dry core. Give this ripe wine until 2020.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2015 Quinta dos Aciprestes Reserva Red (Douro)

description: While the nose is intensely honeyed and floral, there's a steely mineral intensity on the palate of this elegant, dry Riesling. Pristine white grapefruit, lime and gooseberry flavors are invigorating and tart but fall on the palate in creamy, expansive layers. It's an impeccably balanced wine with a long, honed finish.
title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2016 Graach Josephshöfer Trocken GG Riesling (Mosel)

description: Hints of smoke and pencil shavings accent fragrant cherry blossom and pink grapefruit notes in this feather-light kabinett. It's a juicy, unctuously fruity wine but structured keenly by laser-light acidity and earthy nuances that linger long on the finish.
title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2016 Scharzhofberger Kabinett Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: Named after the “Son of Apulia,” Frederick II of Swabia—the 13th century Emperor of the Holy Roman Empire who made his summer home the Castel del Monte, for which the DOCG is now named—this is a pure expression of the Nero di Troia variety. Aromas of dark cherries, spiced bramble berries, old leather and anise permeate the nose and carry through to a tightly woven, grippy palate. There's wonderful tension, depth and complexity to this medium-bodied wine which needs a few years to soften its tannic edge. Drink from 2020.
title: Rivera 2012 Puer Apuliae Nero di Troia (Castel del Monte)

description: Plumes of ripe peach, apricot and mango are exuberant on the nose, while the fruit profile on the palate is markedly demure, offering crisp but penetrating hits of gooseberry, green plum and lime. It's taut and nervous on the palate, with a firm mineral undertone. While elegant already, this should meld its fruit and mineral intensities after a few years in the cellar. Hold till 2019.
title: Robert Weil 2016 Kiedrich Turmberg Trocken Erste Lage Riesling (Rheingau)

description: It's at least the third excellent vintage in a row from Ruby Hill, which is a historic name in Livermore Valley. Rich, concentrated and oaky, this is a no-holds-barred wine that layers toasted, smoky, spicy aromas overripe pear and nutmeg flavors. The body is full and the texture is mouth-filling.
title: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Deeply concentrated lemon and pineapple meld seamlessly into earthier complexities of crushed earth and flint in this vivacious spätlese. It's deft and dancing on the palate, with a piercing honey-struck finish. Drinks well already but should improve further through 2025.
title: St. Urbans-Hof 2016 Nik Weis Goldtröpfchen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: A rich style of Paso Cab, this bottling starts with aromas of rich black-cherry cream, vanilla, nutmeg, gravel and cinnamon. The palate is full of caramel, French toast and kirsch flavors at first, but then the chalky, still somewhat stiff tannins add a mouth-coating texture.
title: TW Ferm Co. 2014 Straight Cab Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Toasty dark-fruit aromas are compact. In the mouth, this wine is more screechy, tannic and taut. Oaky and berry flavors are balanced and integrated on a long finish with driving acidity. Drink this strong-boned Tempranillo from a lesser vintage through 2028.
title: Viña Vilano 2014 Legón Premium  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Lilacs and plump blackberry fruit meet with dried sage, fennel and a hint of green peppercorn on the lively fresh nose of this bottling by second generation vintner Drake Whitcraft. The palate is peppery, fresh and light, with cracked black pepper, rounded purple fruits and a strong acidity proving easy to quaff.
title: Whitcraft 2016 My Friend Matts Vineyard Syrah (Los Olivos District)

description: This full-bodied wine makes no apologies for its assertive oaky profile and matches the power of the smoky spicy elements deftly with ripe pear and hazelnut flavors. It has excellent concentration and a sense of layering, plus a long, delicious finish.
title: Wood Family Vineyards 2016 Para Mas Amigas Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Focused and elegantly structured, this sparkling blend has enticing scents of orchard fruit, citrus and brioche. The vibrant, precise palate evokes white cherry, peach and tangerine zest framed in bright acidity and a refined lively mousse. A mineral note closes the dry finish.
title: Fratelli Berlucchi 2013 Freccianera Rosé  (Franciacorta)

description: A fifty-fifty blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Nero, this opens with enticing scents of brioche, white stone fruit, citrus and red berry. Mirroring the nose, the vibrant palate offers tart sour cherry, pomegranate, bread dough and tangerine zest alongside a refined perlage and tangy acidity. A bitter almond note marks the close.
title: Le Marchesine 2012 Rosé  (Franciacorta)

description: Berry, apple and pastry aromas delicately swirl in the glass while the vibrant palate offers white peach, tangy tangerine zest and white cherry. An elegant, persistent perlage and bright acidity provide elegance and energy while a ginger note wraps around the finish.
title: Vigna Dorata NV Rosé  (Franciacorta)

description: Rennet apple, hazelnut and a whiff of bread crust lead the way. On the palate, tangy acidity underscores white cherry, pomegranate, tangerine zest and a note of exotic spice alongside a lively continuous perlage. A eucalyptus note closes the finish.
title: Mosnel 2012 Parosé  (Franciacorta)

description: There's a pleasant earthy, spicy character right off the bat on the nose of this wine, opening with pronounced scents of Dr. Pepper, cherry cola, red plum, chicory root and church incense. The medium-weight palate offers structured tannins that lend surprising grip, yet bright acidity keeps the mouthfeel lifted. The stalky, tight red-berry flavors on the palate return to spicy abundance on the medium-length finish. Drink 2020–2025.
title: A.A. Badenhorst Family Wines 2015 Raaigras Grenache (Swartland)

description: This juicy bottle bursts open with pomegranate, cherry and orange zest. Hints of Dr. Pepper streak through, but overall it's an elegant and detailed wine, showing more finesse than sheer power.
title: Alloro 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: A shift from the 2005, this is one-third Pinot Noir and two-thirds Chardonnay, disgorged in July of 2017. It's tasty and surprisingly young, with tart apple and peach flavors dominant, along with light custard and some lovely toast. This may be enjoyed now or cellared for up to five years.
title: Argyle 2007 Extended Tirage Brut Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

description: A blend of 80% Pinot Noir and 20% Chardonnay, this vibrant sparkler offers fresh aromas of red berry and citrus. On the palate, a lively perlage underscores pomegranate, red grapefruit and a hint of baking spice. It's well balanced, with crisp acidity.
title: Barone Pizzini 2013 Rosé  (Franciacorta)

description: Exuberantly blossomy, this perfumed kabinett offers loads of pristine white peach and pineapple flavors off set by layers of cool minerals. It's a juicy yet revitalizing wine, with a long crystalline finish.
title: Bastgen 2016 Kestener Paulinshofberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Initially this wine is charred and smoky-smelling, with accents of graphite and cola. A tight, juicy palate is bolstered by bold core acidity, while ripe blackberry and currant flavors capture both the black and red sides of the flavor spectrum. A dry, tannic finish with peppery flavors is intense. Drink through 2026.
title: Bodegas Fuentespina 2014 Selección Old Vines Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

description: It's rare to find a Portuguese white wine this old still available. While it does taste mature, it has wonderful nutty flavors and acidity, giving an old gold, yeasty character. This is a food wine, with its structure and mineral aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Caves São João Quinta do Poço do Lobo 1995 Poço de Lobo Colheita Arinto (Bairrada)
winery: Caves São João Quinta do Poço do Lobo

description: Intense and rich, this is an opulent, concentrated wine from a 240-acre vineyard. Powerful, dense and packed with black fruits, this shows solid aging potential. The tannins are already integrating with the generous berry fruits and the acidity, to give an impressive wine. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Blaignan 2015  Médoc

description: This ripe wine has dusty tannins, a good balance between fruit and tannin, and considerable potential. The dry core of tannins will soften while the black plum and berry fruits are already juicy and rich. This wine will age well; drink from 2024.
title: Château Charmail 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: Ripe fruit shines in this wine. With its rich tannins and soft texture, this second wine is made from a mix of young vines and a selection of barrels not suitable for the top wine. It has a juicy red fruits, a jammy ripe character and will age quickly. This wine will be released in 2020. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Clerc Milon 2015 Pastourelle de Clerc Milon  (Pauillac)

description: Spicy, structured and with a smoky character, this rich wine will develop power. It has a dense texture, layers of tannins that are integrating with the blackberry fruits. This will be a good wine as it matures. Drink from 2024.
title: Château La Cardonne 2015  Médoc

description: Sumptuous Merlot dominates this ripe wine. Plenty of tannins give backbone to the powerful fruit and intense acidity. The wine is firm, both from wood aging and fruit tannins, and needs to age. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Lafleur-Gazin 2015  Pomerol

description: This rich, juicy wine has 90% Merlot in the blend giving it vibrancy, rich tannins and great black-plum and spice flavors. It is a ripe wine, powerful and dense with intense youthful acidity that will soften. Drink this balanced, firm wine from 2022.
title: Château Reysson 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: Made with 100% Pinot Nero, this offers inviting aromas of cherry, acacia, bread dough and a whiff of hazelnut. On the bright structured palate, fresh acidity lifts toasted nut, brioche and pomegranate alongside a lively refined perlage.
title: Contadi Castaldi 2011 Pinònero Natura  (Franciacorta)

description: The nose on this ultimately zesty wine starts off on the richer side, with baked apple, yellow melon, cherimoya and orange peel. On the palate, the acidity is immediate and tremendously persistent, with flavors of apple blossom, pear syrup and tangerine spray riding the chalky texture.
title: Crawford Family 2016 Albariño (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Enticing, fruity aromas of red cherry and brambly berry set the stage for layers of cola, baking spice and cocoa. The medium-weight palate offers a texture like crushed satin, smooth yet defined, with ample acidity to keep the structure and ripe-fruit flavors from feeling overly dense. The spice returns on the finish and continues alongside a hint of peppery warmth. Drink now–2023.
title: David & Nadia 2015 David Grenache (Swartland)

description: Sourced from a vineyard on the western edge of the valley, this sports lovely aromatics introducing matching flavors of black cherry and a dash of pepper. There's a pleasing minerality, like a lick of granite, and a whiff of dried thyme also.
title: De Ponte Cellars 2013 Lonesome Rock Ranch Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A blend of 29% Roussanne, 23% Chardonnay, 22% Chenin Blanc, 18% Grenache Blanc and 8% Viognier, this opens with delicate aromas of pink apple, orange blossom, strawberry hull and white melon. The medium-weight palate offers just enough fruity weight to ground the precise cut of the vibrant acidity. Harmonious and well-balanced, this is one to enjoy now–2022.
title: DeMorgenzon 2015 Maestro White (Stellenbosch)

description: There is a slight hint of lime zest and fern on the nose. The palate is more expressive but in a slender, subtle way, offering a lime zest flavor countered by white pepper and a streak of green fern. Citrus freshness tingles everywhere and even has a pithy, textural element to it.
title: Domaine Ostertag 2016 Les Vieilles Vignes Sylvaner (Alsace)

description: Dusty mineral and zesty lime aromas are contrasted by plump, summer-sweet peach and tangerine on the palate. It's a spry, frisky kabinett, with lip-smacking sweetness balanced neatly by streaks of spine tingling acidity.
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2016 Bernkasteler Badstube Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: There's a buzz of electric acidity that hits the midpalate here, softened by tones of luscious peach, pineapple and guava. It's delicate and thrilling on the palate but lavishly floral and fruity through a long, reverberating finish.
title: Dr. Loosen 2016 Bernkasteler Lay Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Fruit for this wine comes from the state's original Syrah vineyard. Expressive aromas of dried herb, dark raspberry, huckleberry, spice and licorice lead to ripe, full fruit flavors that glide on the finish. It's not shy, bringing a lot of richness and appeal.
title: Efeste 2015 Eléni Red Willow Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)

description: Intensely earthen tones of smoke and slate abound in this profoundly mineral spätlese. The midpalate brings forth sweeter, sunnier tones of fresh lemon and lime, along with a pleasantly bracing astringency that lends structure to the finish. It's a savory but complex spätlese that needs time to meld. Hold till at least 2020 but its likely to improve for at least a decade beyond that.
title: Günther Steinmetz 2016 Kestener Paulinsberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Just a handful of Oregon wineries produce this varietal wine, and one hopes more will follow. Fresh, leesy and rich, with mineral-soaked flavors, this broadens out in the mouth with apple-flavored fruit. There's an appealing note of toasted cracker, peanut shells and a whiff of sea breeze. It's a fascinating wine.
title: Helioterra 2016 Redman Vineyard Arneis (Ribbon Ridge)

description: A delicious bottle of Pinot Gris from Iris is as certain as a sunrise. This lightly tawny wine brings scents of lemon oil, white flowers and lemon verbena. The lovely fruit pulls in apple, pear, kiwi and a touch of banana, all in perfect balance. In short, this is a thoroughly engaging and versatile white wine.
title: Iris Vineyards 2016 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

description: This exceptional site was planted back in the 1970s, and winemaker Jay Somers pulls some of that old-vine depth and nuance out of his first release from Medici. Bursting with ripe cherry fruit, it's got a base of clean earth, with highlights of coffee grinds and dark chocolate.
title: J. Christopher 2015 Medici Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This is tight and reserved at first, needing time to open and reveal notes of green apple, lemon-lime citrus, yellow plum and underripe mango. Given those tight, bright aromas, it's surprising to encounter the medium-weight, round mouthfeel, with low acidity and ripe tones of guava and white grapefruit that carry through to the close.
title: Ken Forrester 2015 Dirty Little Secret One Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

description: This remains tightly wound, but the deep flavors of black cherry and cassis suggest that once it unwraps it will add muscle and mass. Highlights of coffee and charred wood lead into an astringent finish with drying tannins.
title: Ken Wright 2015 Guadalupe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of oak, coconut, forest floor and plum cake that carry over to the chewy palate along with juicy black cherry, mocha and vanilla. Soft rounded tannins provide supple support.
title: La Braccesca 2013 Vigneto Santa Pia Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Pure and very appetizing notes of baked pear and fresh, yellow apple play on the nose. The palate reprises these flavors with juicy, fruity abundance and balances them with vibrant freshness. There is concentration and depth of pear and apple flavors. The finish is just off dry but full of that glorious fruit.
title: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2016 Black Tie White (Alsace)
winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

description: There's a lot to like about this refreshing, savory sparkler. It opens with inviting aromas of baked bread, baking spice, white stone fruit and a whiff of lemon pastry cream. The vibrant elegant palate delivers ripe Gala apple, white peach, candied tangerine drop and hazelnut alongside tangy acidity. A lively perlage provides the backdrop.
title: Lantieri 2013 Arcadia Brut  (Franciacorta)

description: This tightly wound, still very young bottling from Rick Longoria's estate vineyard needs a little time to open up, but when it does, there are grapefruit pith, candied lemon rind and freeze-dried honeydew aromas to enjoy. The texture is tremendously chalky, delivering flavors of lime skin, apple rind and orange candies.
title: Longoria 2015 Fe Ciega Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This wine shows a heady, toasty nose of black-fruit aromas, along with maple, spice and heat notes. Spiced blackberry and cassis flavors are typical of this Tinta de Toro, however a palate that's rough as sandpaper makes this a tough go. Drink through 2025.
title: Maurodos 2014 San Román  (Toro)

description: Smooth and toasty, this cuvée pushes pretty barrel flavors front and center, well-defined and framing crisp fruit flavors of raspberry and cherry. There's a dash of orange marmalade that seals the finish. The wine spent 16 months in barrel, 40% new and 60% once-used.
title: Megan Anne 2015 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Elegant and almost ethereal, this lovely sparkler has delicate aromas of orchard fruit, baked bread, field flower and a hint of citrus. On the elegant palate, tiny continuous bubbles provide the backdrop for white peach, Rennet apple and lemon zest. Bright acidity provides balance while an almond note wraps it up.
title: Mosnel NV Brut Rosé  (Franciacorta)

description: This medium-bodied Pinot offers aromas of tree bark, vanilla, dried leaves, cherry cola and a hint of licorice. The palate is supersmooth, with silky tannins and a tart cherry finish.
title: Ninth Island 2015 Pinot Noir (Tasmania)

description: A blend of 51% Petit Verdot, 42% Cabernet Sauvignon and 7% Carmenère, this opens with floral tones of crushed violets and carnation alongside brambly berry, chocolate-covered cherry and sweet spice. The plush, velvety palate showcases a solid tannic structure and a fruity berry-preserve flavor, while final notes of tree bark, wood spice and cocoa powder linger long on the close. Drink now–2023.
title: Paserene 2015 Marathon Red (Western Cape)

description: Lightly wood aged, this ripe wine was fermented initially in open tanks, giving the wine its rich black-fruit character and open texture. Spice from wood aging mixes with generous fruits to make a richly textured wine that will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2013 Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a ripe wine full of broad black fruits. Smoothed by the wood aging and with plenty of acidity to balance, it is rich and structured. The tannins in this wine from the de la Rosa estate are already enmeshed in the fruit. This wine could be drunk now for its fruit, although it will be better from 2019.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2016 Red (Douro)

description: This is a well-balanced and attractive pour, with scents of orange blossom, lemon verbena, quinine and lime that frame the just-ripe peach and melon fruit core. A pithy astringency provides a subtle texture to the palate and lends some lingering grip to the finish, coupled with a vibrant acidity that leaves you read for more. Drink now–2022.
title: Quinta Essentia 2015 Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: While subdued on the nose, there's a deep concentration of sweet-tart tangerine and grapefruit flavors on the palate of this lushly textured Riesling. It's bold in mouthfeel for a kabinett but zesty acidity and a flinty mineral undertone keeps it invigorating.
title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2016 Graach Josephshöfer Kabinett Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: Subdued red apple and lemon on the nose ripen into sweeter, honeyed tones of mango, peach and nectarine on the palate. Surprisingly lavish and deeply concentrated, it's an unctuously fruity yet elegantly balanced wine, with a vivacious lemon-lime finish.
title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2016 Graach Josephshöfer Spätlese Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: Scintillating acidity highlights crisp yellow peach and apple in this racy, light-footed kabinett. It's a delicately honeyed but penetrating wine that's approachable now but concentrated enough to hold well through 2025.
title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2016 Ockfener Bockstein Kabinett Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: Reflecting a warm, dry vintage, this wine smells ripe and balsamic, with notes of cheese blending with raw wood, cowhide, coconut and cassis aromas. A bipolar palate features creamy oak and lemony acidity. Deep berry-fruit flavors are pushed by perky acidity towards a finish with toast and chocolate notes. Drink from 2019–2030.
title: Resalte 2012 Expresion  (Ribera del Duero)

description: A blend of 70% Nero di Troia and 30% Montepulciano, this is an enticingly savory and earthy wine with lots of appeal. Aromas of spiced red cherry, cured meat, peppery tobacco and anise meld seamlessly on the nose. The aromas are echoed on the mouthwatering and engaging palate of medium weight, lingering on a sanguine note. Currently grippy and structured with grainy tannins, this will soften with time in bottle, giving way to its wealth of complexities. Enjoy from 2020.
title: Rivera 2012 Il Falcone Riserva Red (Castel del Monte)

description: Here's a savory red with surprising depth for the cool wet vintage. Dark wild cherry, licorice, violet, juicy plum, tilled earth and truffle aromas all follow through to the buffed palate. Fresh acidity and supple polished tannins lend brightness and give it a smooth, rounded texture.
title: Romeo 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Red berry, bread dough and toasted nut aromas emerge on this elegant, structured sparkler. On the palate, bright acidity underscores Rennet apple, pomegranate and nectarine alongside a refined perlage.
title: Ronco Calino NV Radijan Rosé  (Franciacorta)

description: A gorgeous bouquet of apple skin, grilled pineapple, beeswax and a touch of baking spice sets the stage in this easy-to-like wine. The medium-weight body offers a superb balance of richness and freshness, with ripe, spicy fruit tones that harmonize with bright, lingering acidity, resulting in a fine overall texture. Drink now–2021.
title: Rustenberg 2015 Chardonnay (Stellenbosch)

description: Pommard and Wädenswil are the clones, and the wine spent 18 months in roughly two-thirds new French oak. It's luscious and loaded with blueberry, cherry and chocolate flavors, gliding into a finish with moderate tannins, a whiff of coffee and a streak of caramel.
title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2015 Heritage Clones Pinot Noir

description: Earthy plum and berry aromas open this firm gran reserva from a cold vintage. This wine is chunky on the palate, with scraping tannins. Rooty, meaty berry and cinnamon flavors are slightly stewed, while this is long but hollow on the finish. Drink through 2026.
title: Sierra Cantabria 2008 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

description: While sunny tangerine and yellow peach flavors abound, deeply embedded layers of smoke, struck flint, fennel and pollen lend savory complexities to this kabinett. It's luscious yet spry, with racy streaks of acidity and a lingering, spicy finish. Drinks well already but should improve through 2025.
designation: Nik Weis Goldtröpfchen Kabinett Grosse Lage
title: St. Urbans-Hof 2016 Nik Weis Goldtröpfchen Kabinett Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: The debut of Napa native winemaker and entrepreneur Josh Phelps' own label, this is a blend of 73% Cabernet Sauvignon, 8% Malbec, 7% Cabernet Franc, 6% Merlot and 6% Petit Verdot. It delivers tremendous value for the quality, a mix of chocolate-covered cherry, blueberry and vanilla cola wrapped in smooth, seductive layers of robust elegance. Tobacco, pencil shavings and cigar box add alluring seasoning.
title: Steady State 2015 Red (Napa Valley)

description: Spicy bramble berry aromas are lifted and pure on the nose of this wine, riding over an earthy core of pressed violets and Mediterranean scrub. There's energy to the moderately full palate, with vibrant acidity cutting through juicy red and black berry flavors. Orange rind and tense granite tones provide further intrigue, with soft, integrated tannins giving structure.
title: Tenute Chiaromonte 2012 Riserva Primitivo (Gioia del Colle)

description: This unique blend of 44% Mourvèdre, 33% Zinfandel, 20% Grenache and 3% Counoise starts with dried alpine strawberry, pomegranate, wild chaparral spice, crushed pepper and bay leaf on the elegantly woven nose. A strong sagebrush character ensues on the palate, giving nuance to the saucy plum fruit. The acidity and tannins are well primed and ready to drink.
title: Thacher 2014 Controlled Chaos Red (Paso Robles)

description: This blend of 42% Carignan, 29% Cinsault and 29% Grenache is full and concentrated, but not overly done. There's a mentholated and slightly liquorous edge to the ripe black plum, cherry and boysenberry fruit, as well as subtle hints of cocoa powder and pressed violets. Medium weight, the texture is like crushed velvet, with structure and finesse to frame the fruity palate. Final notes of charred sweet spice, black pepper and tea grace the lingering finish. Drink now–2022.
title: The Blacksmith 2015 Vin Noir Red (Coastal Region)

description: Toasty lemon peel and spiced orange rind set up a spicy, citrusy welcome on the nose of this wine. At the core are rich notes of lemon custard, pear flesh and melon, all cut by superb acidity and a fresh, steely minerality. It's driven and focused, with clear precision on the palate and a medium-length finish that evolves from fruit flesh to rind and finally a kiss of earthy spice. Drink now–2022.
title: The Foundry 2015 Grenache Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: This wine offers aromas of scorched earth, pipe tobacco, mature black-skinned berry and a hint of leather. The rounded, generous palate doles out juicy black cherry, fleshy raspberry, star anise and a hint of cinnamon alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2022.
title: Trerose 2015 Santa Caterina  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Aromas of blueberry, black cherry and fennel bulb prepare the taste buds for flavors of blackberry, raspberry, vanilla, juniper berry and thyme. Soft tannins and a pleasing interplay of fruit and spice wind down towards a berry-laden finish, with a touch of eucalyptus.
title: Golan Heights Winery 2013 Yarden Bar'on Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Galilee)

description: Plump with ripe black-plum and cherry flavors, this single-vineyard wine offers a greater density of fruit than the producer's entry-level Pinot Noir. Still, it shares a ghostly elegance marked by faded whiffs of dried violet and lavender, dusty spice-box and earth notes. Vibrant acidity lends finesse to the palate along with a meandering finish of fine grained, bitter tannins.
title: Günther Steinmetz 2014 Kestener Paulinsberg Unfiltered Pinot Noir (Mosel)

description: This wine features a bouquet of raspberry, black cherry and violet. It is smooth on the palate, with flavors of blackberry, cherry, pomegranate, vanilla and almond blossom. Cool minty notes come into play towards the finish, followed by lingering brightness.
title: Hayotzer 2014 Genesis Merlot (Galilee)

description: Excellent concentration and pinpoint focus are hallmarks at this property. Tart cranberry and raspberry fruit comes with a streak of dark chocolate and polished tannins. The focus and detail are exceptional.
title: Helioterra 2014 Vintner's Select Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Shades of subtle oak, fig and lemongrass are framed by tightly wound acidity on the palate. Light in feel, this is a bright, exotic Chardonnay with loads of energy.
title: Hendry 2015 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A gentle mix of red berry, red plum and cherry carries some of the lightly earthy tones of the AVA. Soft and accessible, there's a hint of Dr. Pepper running through the flavors also. It's drinking right about at its prime and should hold through the early 2020s.
title: Holloran 2013 La Chenaie Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Here is a tasty chewy full-flavored effort, loaded with black-cherry fruit. There are notes of cola and brown sugar, along with a finishing hint of coffee. It was aged for 11 months in just 7% new French oak.
designation: Not One iOTA Pelos Sandberg Vineyard
title: Iota Cellars 2014 Not One iOTA Pelos Sandberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This showcases a nice balance between ripe-fruit notes, toasty warmth and ample acidity. Aromas of lemon custard, creamed pear and baked apple set the stage, framed by scents of toasted walnuts and clover honey. The palate offers a bit more restraint and verve, with notes of orange and lime peel that refresh the sip. Drink now–2023.
title: Ken Forrester 2015 The FMC Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: Young, big and pleasantly chunky, this flavorful wine is loaded with green apple, tart melon and enough acidity to conjure up gooseberries. Enjoy it now for its exceptional fruit and freshness.
title: King Estate 2016 Backbone Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: Fruity aromas of red berry unite with dark culinary spice and fragrant blue flower. On the soft juicy palate, supple tannins lithely support fleshy Marasca cherry, crushed blackberry and ground pepper. Drink through 2021.
title: La Braccesca 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: This opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, violet and leather. The savory balanced palate doles out raspberry jam, black cherry, tobacco and black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Enjoy through 2027.
title: Mamete Prevostini 2013 Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)

description: Savory, mossy plum and currant aromas are mature and woodsy. High acidity is the lifeblood of this gran reserva that tastes of reedy, leafy currant and herbs. The finish is dry, with a note of tobacco. Drink through 2026.
title: Marqués de la Concordia 2008 Viña Alarde Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Earthy black-fruit aromas open this fully built crianza. A tannic palate with cutting lemony acidity gives this a ton of energy. Berry and cassis flavors are equaled by oaky vanilla and café-mocha notes, while a coconut flavor and heat come up on the finish. Drink through 2026.
title: Martín Berdugo 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

description: It's no surprise that this appropriately named blend of 76% Petite Sirah, 20% Tannat and 4% Petit Verdot is dense and dark, starting with aromas of crushed asphalt, elderberry jam, white pepper and baked goods. The palate is equally unctuous, showing concentrated purple flowers, tar, more elderberry and a judicious hint of wild mints.
title: MCV 2015 Black Red (Paso Robles)

description: This wine exhibits superb interplay between just-ripe fruit character and earthy, spicy tones. Notes of tree bark, fresh turned soil, cocoa nib and olive mingle harmoniously with fruity tones of black cherry and plum. A sanguine accent dances across the silky, medium-bodied palate, while a peppery kick unfolds on the lingering close. Drink now–2023.
title: Mullineux 2015 Syrah (Swartland)

description: Dirk Niepoort's venture into the Bairrada region at Quinta de Baixo blossoms in this wine. Rich fruit gives the wine both firm tannins and a ripe, crisply textured character. It is balanced with acidity, full of juicy fruit and perfumed with mint. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Niepoort 2015 Lagar de Baixo Baga (Bairrada)

description: Toast, underbrush, tobacco leaf and cassis aromas lead the nose. Reflecting the cool wet vintage, the palate is austere and lighter bodied than usual but still elegant, offering raw cherry, pomegranate, licorice and ground pepper alongside tight close-grained tannins. Give the tannins several more years to unwind.
title: Ornellaia 2014  Bolgheri Superiore

description: Two clones and two vineyards combine here, with 18 months in French oak pulling it all together. It's a tasty mix of fruit, spice and barrel, with pomegranate and red-plum flavors at the core. Baking spices suggest buttered cinnamon toast, with a touch of cocoa powder adding the coup de grâce.
title: Quintet 2015 Yamhill Duet Pinot Noir

description: Aromas of black plum and coffee bean set the scene for flavors of blackberry and black cherry that are quickly joined by stronger flavors of smoked meat and espresso bean. Rich tannins coat the mouth, receding into a smoke-filled finish.
title: Recanati 2016 Shiraz (Upper Galilee)

description: Drenched with melted butter and vanilla flavors, but not blatantly oaky, this full-bodied Chardonnay is so lush that it's almost sweet. It seems to expand on the palate, brimming with delicious Fuji apple and Bosc pear notes that don't quit but last through a lingering finish.
title: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Reserve Collection Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Clear varietal character comes out in this wine, with solid black-cherry fruit and highlights of licorice, espresso, vanilla and black tea. The concentration and balance are impressive, and it lingers with a late show of power. This winery does far better with its red wines than its whites.
title: Schmidt 2014 Syrah (Applegate Valley)

description: An aroma of ripe pear makes an appearance on the nose. The same pristine and abundant tone plays on the palate, supported by fresh lemon. Balance and concentration are an ideal counterbalance to a racy vein of acidity. The finish is utterly refreshing and lasting.
title: Trimbach 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

description: A solid effort, this brings plum and blueberry, black cherry and baking spices together in a substantial, even muscular style. Earthy tannins form a strong base, and the overall sturdy character, along with the balance and texture, suggest that this will age nicely over the next decade. Drink now through the late 2020s.
title: WildAire 2015 Timothy Pinot Noir

description: White flower, yellow orchard fruit and brioche aromas carry through to the elegantly sparkling palate together with yellow apple, white peach and tangerine zest. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors while a creamy mousse gives it a silky texture.
title: Majolini 2009 Brut  (Franciacorta)

description: This vineyard emphasizes rather steely mineral-driven flavors. The fruit is ripened in an austere mode, firm and sculpted, with flavors of wild mountain berry. A whiff of tobacco follows through, with a similar vein in the finish. It's a dense wine that will reward aggressive decanting.
title: Ayoub 2015 Brittan Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: Savory tones of smoke and crushed earth permeate from nose to finish, suggesting a complex auslese that's more mineral than fruit. Still, vibrant lemon-lime acidity and silken streaks of honey penetrate the midpalate and extend through a long, invigorating finish. It drinks well now but should show even better from 2021.
title: Bollig-Lehnert 2016 Dhroner Hofberger Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Formerly the property of one of Napoleon's generals, this estate is now performing impressively after renovations. This wine is richly structured and packed with black fruits. Dark tannins vie with black currants and ripe spice in this wine that will age well. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Bernadotte 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a fruity wine with lovely acidity and a firm background of tannins. The black-currant and berry flavors are up front, giving delicious acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink this fruity wine from 2023.
title: Château Couhins 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: A seriously structured and dense wine, this is also rich in dark plum and damson fruits. It also offers spice and dry tannins. Concentrated and dark, the wine is going to be slow to develop, its tannins needing plenty of time. Drink from 2025.
title: Château de Côme 2015  Saint-Estèphe

description: Named after an ancient tower on the estate that could once have been a lighthouse close the Gironde estuary, this estate remains family owned. This wine is rich in tannins as well as juicy black-currant fruit. Structured and concentrated, the wine has great potential. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Tour des Termes 2015  Saint-Estèphe

description: A tiny production of lightly oaked wine from primarily Pommard clones, this wine presents as thick and tannic at first, with a touch of reduction. Its intensity and density mellow in the glass to show a greater sense of elegance and fresh acid-driven flavor, built around pomegranate, strawberry and wild lavender.
title: Whistler 2014 Corvus Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: White flower, yellow orchard fruit and brioche aromas carry through to the elegantly sparkling palate together with yellow apple, white peach and tangerine zest. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors while a creamy mousse gives it a silky texture.
title: Majolini 2009 Brut  (Franciacorta)

description: Aromas of black plum and coffee bean set the scene for flavors of blackberry and black cherry that are quickly joined by stronger flavors of smoked meat and espresso bean. Rich tannins coat the mouth, receding into a smoke-filled finish.
title: Recanati 2016 Shiraz (Upper Galilee)

description: Drenched with melted butter and vanilla flavors, but not blatantly oaky, this full-bodied Chardonnay is so lush that it's almost sweet. It seems to expand on the palate, brimming with delicious Fuji apple and Bosc pear notes that don't quit but last through a lingering finish.
title: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Reserve Collection Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Clear varietal character comes out in this wine, with solid black-cherry fruit and highlights of licorice, espresso, vanilla and black tea. The concentration and balance are impressive, and it lingers with a late show of power. This winery does far better with its red wines than its whites.
title: Schmidt 2014 Syrah (Applegate Valley)

description: An aroma of ripe pear makes an appearance on the nose. The same pristine and abundant tone plays on the palate, supported by fresh lemon. Balance and concentration are an ideal counterbalance to a racy vein of acidity. The finish is utterly refreshing and lasting.
title: Trimbach 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

description: A solid effort, this brings plum and blueberry, black cherry and baking spices together in a substantial, even muscular style. Earthy tannins form a strong base, and the overall sturdy character, along with the balance and texture, suggest that this will age nicely over the next decade. Drink now through the late 2020s.
title: WildAire 2015 Timothy Pinot Noir

description: Ticking all the right Chardonnay boxes, this classy wine balances grilled peach characters with buttered toast and nuts, flowing seamlessly into a gentle, creamy-textured palate of more grilled fruit along with taught acidity and well-integrated oak. A lovely food wine for any time of the year.
title: Yering Station 2016 Little Yering Chardonnay (Victoria)

description: Fresh pressed boysenberry, fennel bulb, white pepper dust and Italian herbs show on the nose of this blend of 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Syrah and 25% Zinfandel. The leathery tannins grab hold of the palate rather quickly, and still need some time to smooth out, yet provide solid structure from which to hang the black plum and mulberry flavors.
title: Zenaida Cellars 2015 Fire Sign Red (Templeton Gap District)

description: The particulars of this estate-grown blend change annually, but it remains smooth and deeply-fruited, a tasty riot of loganberries, marionberries, blackberries and more. Juicy and fresh, with spot-on tannins, it's flat-out delicious and a stunning value.
title: Abacela NV Vintner's Blend #17 Red (Umpqua Valley)

description: The top selection of the 2015 vintage, this estate-grown wine has a lovely mix of strawberries, raspberries and plums. Tangy citrus brightens the acids, and a dusting of cocoa amplifies the finish.
title: Alexana 2015 Revana Vineyard Block 7 Pommard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: The Nicholas reserve sees 40% new French oak yet isn't at all oaky. Rather, it's fruit-powered, smooth and supple. Blue plum and black cherry come with pastry spices and a dash of sassafras.
title: Anam Cara 2015 Reserve Nicholas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Hints of vanilla and woodsmoke combine with subtle red cherry on the nose. The body is gentle, translucent and light, handled with a welcome, light touch. This is an earthy, elegant Pinot which shows a lovely warmth but vivid freshness in cherry fruit at its core.
title: Bestheim 2014 Exception Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Intriguing aromas of boysenberry syrup, plum, sweet herb and barrel spice lead to exquisitely balanced, somewhat elegantly styled fruit and savory flavors. It's a very understated, very pretty expression of this warm vintage and growing region.
title: Betz Family 2015 La Côte Rousse Syrah (Red Mountain)

description: Earthy plum and cherry aromas are typical of Rioja gran reserva. A full, grabby palate is not silky-smooth, while this wine tastes of fig and chocolaty berry fruits that are on the cusp of cooked. It loses steam on a finish with raisiny notes. Drink through 2022.
designation: Hacienda Lopez de Haro Gran Reserva
title: Bodega Classica 2009 Hacienda Lopez de Haro Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Heady aromas suggesting grilled herb, sea breeze, wild berry and eucalyptus lead the nose. Made with Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot, the tightly knit palate offers dried black cherry, red currant, white pepper and star anise framed in taut, fine-grained tannins.
title: Campo alle Comete 2015 Rosso Stupore  (Bolgheri)

description: Under the same management as Château la Dominique in Saint-Émilion, this wine, dominated by ripe Merlot, is full, open and developing quickly. There's a rich edge to the black fruits as well as some powerful tannins that will need to soften. It is an open, generous wine, full of fruit and richly structured. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Clément-Pichon 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: Dating to before the French Revolution, this estate produces some rich, generous wines. This vintage is in that mold, with its rounded black fruits, crisp acidity and solid core of dry tannins. The structure will allow the wine to age, giving great potential. Drink from 2024.
title: Château de Panigon 2015  Médoc

description: Under the same ownership as Château Cissac, this ancient estate, dating to the 6th century, is producing some fine wines. This rich vintage is well structured, dense and with classic black-currant Cabernet Sauvignon flavors. Ripe Merlot adds its rich jamminess to a wine that is still young. Drink from 2024.
title: Château du Breuil 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: With over 80% Cabernet Sauvignon in the this Kopp family blend, this wine is packed with black currants, ripe tannins and a smoky backdrop from the wood aging. It is structured, dry and juicy at the same time. With this firm core, the wine will need aging, so drink from 2024.
title: Château du Retout 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: Aged for a year in wood, this wine has a toasty character. At the same time, it also has good fruit, plenty of black-currant flavors and acidity. A well-wrought wine, it melds the tannins and fruit into a balanced whole. Drink from 2024.
title: Château La Branne 2015  Médoc

description: Owned by the Pagès family, this rich wine is dense and structured. It has layers of dusty tannins and full black-currant fruit from the 60% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. Drink this firm wine with great fruit from 2023.
title: Château la Valière 2015  Médoc

description: From the Haut-Médoc, part of the same property as Château d'Arsac in Margaux, this wine is made with the same rich character and intense fruit and structure. It is a dense, powerful wine, full of fruit with a solid background of tannins. It will certainly age, so drink from 2025.
title: Château Le Monteil d'Arsac 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: Most of the Cabernet Franc from this estate went into this wine, giving it a super-perfumed character while keeping its tannins intact. It is richly endowed, firm with a generous structure and impressive for a second wine. Drink from 2023.
title: Château l'Évangile 2015 Blason de l'Evangile  (Pomerol)

description: Pineapple and ripe apricot flavors give this wine a tropical character. It has a mineral structure, tangy with pink grapefruit. This delicious, ripe wine is ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2015 Aile d'Argent  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Very dense, this wine holds a high amount (33%) of Cabernet Franc, which gives a beautiful perfumed character as well as restraining the exuberance of the Merlot. It is full of tannins that will allow the wine to age well. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Nenin 2015  Pomerol

description: This ripe, impressively textured wine is going to be rich and generous. Not just yet, because the tannins need to soften and integrate. That said, the blackberry fruits are juicy, with balanced acidity and a full texture. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Château Paveil de Luze 2015  Margaux

description: Ripe Merlot dominates this wine from a vineyard in the city of Libourne. It has a bitter edge of extract although the ripe fruit should come through as the wine matures. Plenty of acidity and crispness go along with the black fruits. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Quinault L'Enclos 2015  Saint-Émilion

description: Just to the north of Saint-Estèphe, this 44-acre estate regularly produces good, structured wines. In this vintage, the structure is right there along with layers of rich blackberry fruits. This is a solid, dense wine, ripe and ready to age well. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Tour Saint-Joseph 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: Rich black cherry, clove, gingerbread and nose-tickling Christmas spices show on the rich nose of this appellation blend. It's also rich on the tip of the sip, with dried black cherry and more clove, but there is a black plum skin tang that holds it in check.
title: Cordant 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
